Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	The text means: "Thus Commences the speech of Albucasim."
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O sons, I have finished this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, because of your faith in me, because of your exposure, and because of your declarations, so I have undertaken to complete this treatise for you, which is a part of my art, that is to say, surgery.</end_of_turn>
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery is very rare in our land and in our time, so that the science of it is almost lost; and its witnesses are few; and it remains only with some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which alter the most and aggravate those errors and hesitation which were in them until understanding of them is clarified and their power and art is increased.</end_of_turn
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I believe that I have composed this treatise in such a way that it follows the way of exposure and declaration and abbreviation; and that it should be added to the forms of the instruments of cautery and other instruments of the work as well as for the addition of the declaration, and for preparation, which is necessary.</end_of_turn
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The greatest cause for which a good craftsman is not found in our time in this art is that the art of medicine is long, and that it embraces many actors who must exercise themselves in the science of anatomy, since Gualius knew the movements of the limbs and the shapes of these, and the connection and separation of these; and the knowledge of bones, nerves and veins, and the number of these, and their colors; and of the pulse veins and the quietness of these, and the places of their sensation.</end_of_turn
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And thus says Hippocrates that in my name is more, in the small work, and especially in the art of the hand.</end_of_turn>
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	And as we said at the beginning of this book, whoever is not learned in anatomy is not worthy of the name of a physician, because many have perished by the hands of those who have erred in this science. Indeed, I have seen many who have been trained in this science and have abandoned it.</end_of_turn
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I have seen a foolish and ignorant physician who, having incised an abscess of scrofula in the groin of a woman, has inciscated several arteries of the groin so that great blood flowed into her, and the woman died between her thighs.</end_of_turn
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I have seen another physician who, because he thought that a tumor had grown in a man who was in his prime, extracted that tumor with a piece of the bladder, and the man died on the third day.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already told you that I will speak of these things, and I have seen that because of the greatness of the tumor and the condition of the patient, he knew that he would die.</end_of_turn
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I have seen another physician who took a fee from a duke from our land for surgery, and he was indebted to a black slave who was his servant; and the physician, in his ignorance, extracted the fracture, with sponges and cloths, with great tension, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Then I will show you according to your desires, and I will relieve you, and I will tell you to leave for a few days and command you to rest; and thus this matter was settled until the wound came out spontaneously, and the patient perished.</end_of_turn>
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I went to him and I showed him that the liament should be removed, and peace and joy appeared on his face, so that he forgot his pains.</end_of_turn
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	And indeed corruption had already been confirmed in the limb, for it was not able to restrain that, and it did not cease to spread corruption in the limb until the patient perished.</end_of_turn>
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I have seen another physician who performed an operation on a cancerous tumor, and made an ulcer nearby for several days, until the tumor grew bigger than it had before.</end_of_turn
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this is that cancer is pure melancholic humor, and that it does not suffice for it to be overcome by all the forces of the will, but that it should be overcome in every limb in which the patient suffers from it.</end_of_turn
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, sons, it is necessary for you that the art of surgery be divided into two parts: that is, in surgery in which there is associated health, and in surgery in which there is peril in the greatest precautions.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already spoken of this in all this book in the place where I mentioned surgery in which there is error and fear; for it is necessary for you to guard against this and to leave that behind, so that the fools do not think that they can speak and despise you.</end_of_turn
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore take up the sacred arms in the request of God, and the sacred sick in the mercy and protection of God.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way through God's grace to preserve health and praiseworthy success, and lay aside the terrible diseases of difficult healing, and rest the sacred arms from those which make you fear, so that you may rejoice in your faith and in your name, for it is remaining for your glory, both here and hereafter with the holy ones.</end_of_turn>
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Indeed, I have already spoken in several of your monasteries.</end_of_turn>
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“No cure any disease badly, for thus no will many doctors be named.”</end_of_turn
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already finished this book according to three chapters.</end_of_turn>
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.</end_of_turn
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered of the head downwards, concerning the forms of instruments and the utensils of cautery, and what is necessary for the operation.</end_of_turn
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.</end_of_turn
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, concerning swelling and perforation, and windings, and ulcers, and the extraction of arrows and similar things, all classified and ordered concerning the forms of instruments.</end_of_turn
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.</end_of_turn
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, concerning restoration and dislocation, and care of twists and similar things; classified and ordered from the head downwards, and concerning the forms of instruments.</end_of_turn
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and acute medicine and reminder of the operation.</end_of_turn
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that in which the treatise of all the book begins.</end_of_turn
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Since I have said what is the quality of the instruments of that cautery and their documents, and in what completion it is prohibited to cauterize.</end>
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech concerning the quality of the cautery instruments and their documents is a long and profound speech, subtle for science, and a secret hidden; and that many learned men have spoken of it, and they disagree with each other, and to me it seems that a little of their speeches suffices, fearing a prolongation.</end>
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Therefore I say that cautery conforms to all universal completion except for two completions, which are caudal completions of its matter.</end
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the caudal and dry completion with its matter, disagreement arises; for some say that cautery is useful for that, while others say the opposite, that cautery is not convenient in diseases of the same kind as its quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that the disease be cold and dry with what is cauterized and dry to be healed.</end
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And I say that whoever says the opposite, that for cautery is useful in every cold and dry disease that is seen in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of a man with the humidity of the air to the completion of the fire, you find the body of a man cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say concerning this speech that I have already experienced it several times in my practice.</end
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, I do not say that because of this everything concerning that which has already been exposed and exercised in the chapter of cautery after practice, and to know the diversity of the men and the situation of diseases in their bodies, and the causes of these, and their accidents, and the space of time of these.</end
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	However, in other completions, this is not your fear, and especially in cold and wet diseases, for already all doctors agree on these, and they do not disagree concerning the use of cautery in these.</end
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that from the secret of healing by cautery with fire and of the goodness of it, is about cautery with acute medicine, for the fire is simple, the action of which reaches only the member that is cauterized and does not notice the other member with it adjusted except for a small document.</end
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	For the action of acute medicine reaches only that in the limb from which it is administered, and it makes it come into the diseased limb of difficult healing and makes it go away.</end<end_turn>
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	For the fire, by its subtlety and substance, does not do anything but what is already known to us by experience and by the length of our service in the study of the truth of causes; and for this reason I am excused from the length of this speech, for it is not written in this book for you the secret of the fire, and the quality of its operation in the bodies and the expulsion of the disease by which it is expelled.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Indeed, master, the best time for cautery and rest is in the earlier days of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, so that its document for the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of that which makes the cautery hurtful, especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, which do not suffer from delay, for fear of those who come late, which is greater than a small document entering at the time.</end_of_turn>
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And I do not say that we must not cut in other cases, or, master, those who do not esteem but the vulgar people and fools among the doctors, so it is that for that disease which is cured by cautery, it is not ridiculous at all times, and rest that consequence.</end_of_turn>
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus that they say because it is cut, for cautery is nothing but in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries the humors which are the cause of these pains.</end_of_turn
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, excessive cautery surpasses medicine by the will of its value and the virtue of its operation and greatness of the patient.</end_of_turn>
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the disease will return at any hour of the time, according to the complexion of the disease and the location of the disease, and the virtue of the things which are prepared in the body from the accumulation of humors in it, and that which is obtained by them in their acquisition in food and drinks and the like of those causes; but when the disease in which cautery is administered is a subtle disease in a limb with few superfluities and humors, just as if it were cautery for pain and like that, it is possible that in them the said pain will not return, even if it is made small.</end_of_turn>
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it may be said vulgarly that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a subtle art, not to those who understand it, for they grow that it is not a cure that makes use of medicine or any other cause except cautery.</end_of_turn
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is true only when they administer the methods of care in certain diseases, and those medicines do not confer, and at the end of the cause they administer manuevers of cautery, and take advantage of that.</end_of_turn
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And the hour has passed sixteen that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding which the vulgar people and the fools of the doctors have.</end_of_turn
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And I say to them the old men that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and I do not say anything but for the equality of the gold and the limitation of its substance.</end_of_turn
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And I say that the place of cautery does not make it bad, as it is not absolutely true, for I have already seen that it does not do anything but in cases where the others do not work, and that cautery with that is good and better than with iron, just as they say; however, when you make cautery with fire from gold, it is not your business to declare, for it is ignited according to the quantity you wish for the roughness of the gold, and prepare to receive cold; and if you adjust over it the fire will consume the gold for the fire, and if there are some plates in the fire so that the craftsman cuts for the occupation of that.</end_of_turn
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason it is useful to make cautery with iron, we must put it more lightly and more cautiously to the rectification of the operation.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those who are coming after me to do the same concerning the feet, so that I may relieve those who ask me what they want of me.</end_of_turn
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for headache from cold and humidity.</end_of_turn
Le capitol primier.	First chapter.</end_of_turn>
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers cold and humidity upon the accidental cause of which it is useful, so it is the cause of soda and multiple flows of rheumatic flux, applied to the cortex, from the head to the limbs and the joints fluent, and multiple of sleep, and toothache and gut pain, and universally of all diseases that come from cold, even as paralysis, sopor and apoplexy, and it is similar in these diseases.</end_of_turn
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The way of this cauterization is as follows: first command the patient to evacuate with laxatives for three or four nights, according as you exceed the virtue of the disease and the age of it and its custom.</end_of_turn
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and do that between his thighs on a fallen bench and place his hands on his feet.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And keep your wrist close to the thumb, over the bridge of the nose between the eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	Moreover, when the doctor suspects the location of the pain, he should touch it and with a pointed cautery he should burn a little olive oil of the shape of that:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then he should place it over the painful area, holding it firmly so that the hand does not slip away, and you should gradually tighten it
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then lift your hand lightly and support the area, and if you see already some quantity of the head of the bone uncovered, thus as much as the quantity of barley of errors, then raise your hand again, and if it has not returned, do the same with the other hand, until it is seen from the bone that you have said.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And take a little salt and dissolve it on the area and keep it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And keep it covered in oil at the border and keep it there until the burn of the fire is healed
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the area with four medicines until it is healed.</start_of_turn>
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And I say that when the wound remains open, so much honey should be given to the patient, because it is better and more helpful.</start_of_turn>
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	I say to you that the bone should be cauterized until the bone itself, and that it should be held cauterized until all the parts of the substance of the bone have healed.</start_of_turn>
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And keep it moist that which is adjacent to the bone, and keep it cured.</start_of_turn
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And I say that it should be cauterized until the marrow appears, until it strengthens the bone within that the bone is softened, and this is the form of small alphbetization.</start_of_turn
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And it is estimated that from that area the vapors of the head expire.</start_of_turn>
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, and it should be cured when it is consolidated.</start_of_turn
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not see these two kinds of cautery in all my life, except in some men according to their fear; and leave it, for you, it is better to be healthy than to be burned, when it is possible; for the head is developed by the solution of continuity of its parts as we have testified in other members, and more when the head of the patient is of fiery nature.</start_of_turn
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first kind of cautery is better and more useful for you; and of that one and of this work we have health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter two.</start_of_turn>
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.</start_of_turn
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head chronic pain and lasting pain occurs and it lasts in the disease for a long time, and when it is used of herbs and of poultices and of capsulars and of plasters and of butter and of vinegar and of broth and of eggs and of rosemary, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that they recount and that does not benefit it from any of those causes, then consider that if the head of the disease is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not fiery and does not find great heat, then that which cauterizes with another cautery leaves a little space.</start_of_turn
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And cauterize that on the nail of the heel up to the marrow is separated.</start_of_turn
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the bone and uncover from the bone the quantity that we have recounted and cauterize that with a cautery in the posterior part of the head in the area where the wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And withdraw your hand in help, and do not uncover the bone, for the disease for this finds great pain other than the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.</start_of_turn
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	I say this cautery in its place, for the cautery of which we cauterize the nails of the head and the occiput is more subtle than that which we cauterize the middle part of the head; and this is the way of it.</start_of_turn
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.</start_of_turn
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cautery of the ancient emigration.</start_of_turn
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When in the part of the head severe pain or widespread pain spreads into the heel, be evacuated with medicines that soften the head, and be administered the other care that I have mentioned in the preceding diseases; and all this without benefit, for the cautery in them is done in two ways: either with acute medical burning or with fire.</start_of_turn
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May the cautery be applied with medicine, for you shall take a dose of ale, evacuate that and remove the extremities from both hands.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And approach the area of pain in the temple with a lancet, so that the wound is visible, leaving the hair covered.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And strengthen the area around it with a compress of constriction, and leave it for three hours; then remove the dressing and give the patient ale, and leave the wound covered for two or three days, and put your hand over the area that is below the knee until the pain subsides
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And care for that which is affected until it is healed
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, know that there are many medicines that combat these which I have written in the treatise of medicinal treatments
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cautery be applied according to this manner: fire for cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called closed nails, because its head is like a nail with a curvature in which there is a small prominence in the middle of the area.</start_turn>
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And place your hand over the area of pain, and hold your hand — because the vessel that is left behind must not be torn — and remove the fire little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of the blood that is left behind by the specification of the wound is as great as most of it, elevate your hand so that the artery that is left behind does not suffer injury, so that there is no flow of blood.</start_turn
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And immerse the area in salt water and leave it there for three days; then remove the dressing and cover the area with a bandage, and care for it until it is healed.</start_turn
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize at the tip of the toe according to the cautery, and keep the incision of the artery in this area away from the tip of the toe in particular, because it is not an old wound.</start_turn
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.</start_turn>
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery of an old wound.</start_turn
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you have cured the wound according to what has been said of the previous care, and what has been said in the division of diseases, and you do not take advantage of the care, and sometimes for the disease does not suffice for it what has been said of the first care or of the cautery with fire, then you must wait until the fire has become white before you cauterize the toe, because it signifies over the area of pain along the length of which is the greater part of the finger, or whatever; and withdraw your hand for a moment and strengthen it before you make the incision and reach the bone.</start_turn
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However necessary it is that you guard the continuity of the mandible, which is unfortunate because of chewing, and that the wound does not suffer injury and the nerves that are in it do not suffer damage, and that no spasm occurs.</start_turn
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and care of the flow of blood of the artery that is being cauterized, which is feared, and more so in that one that ignores what is done and is negligent; leave the operation to the beginning.</start_turn
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I come to remember the regimen of the flow of blood in case of injury to the artery according to its manner, in this place of this book.</start_turn
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that this cautery does not suffice and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize that in the middle part of the head as we have recounted, and care for the wound until it is healed.</start_turn
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter on the stretching of the artery with two nails, and this is a better cautery and safer.</start_turn
Capitol .v.	Chapter five.</start_turn
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cautery of the pains of the heel.</start_turn
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the heel there is pain due to cold and it is cured by means of lacative causes and by the other care that has been mentioned in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cautery, which is called puncture, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And approach the puncture near the fire, and be careful around the entire heel as if it were rotating, or in the area of any abscess if the pain is in any place.</start_turn
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with you the cautery of the root of the heel a little at a time because you have to mark the area with your hand.</start_turn
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	If it is necessary to make several points on the whole ankle, and which are those, then take care of the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .vi.	When several punctures are necessary throughout the ankle, and which are these, then care for the wound until it is healed.</start_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de turtura.	From pointed cautery.</start_of_turn
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The wound which is being cauterized is cured by the pointed cautery, and it is not anything other than the specific things which cause swelling, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.</start_of_turn
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cautery of the area which must be dry or which has a spasm of the nerve.</start_of_turn
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you have cured that area of the ankle with blistering and blistering plaster, and you have supported it with bandages, do not touch the wound, for now you must cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one to remove the root of the hair, the second a little to leave the area with some feeling, and the third to join the two lips.</start_of_turn
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And rest the wound for the opposite of the diseased part, for the burn does not see anything but the part that appears to be healed.</start_of_turn
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the way to cauterize is that you cauterize that area which is around the ankle joint above a little over the heel, and in the temper another, the length of which should be according to the length of the digit which is below, and stop your hand when the quantity of the matter of the wound has been consumed.</start_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the way of cautery, and it is the way of the surgeon, the form of which is like a saw.</start_of_turn
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	More importantly, do not make the wound too wide; and cover that of excessive thickness with a little.</start_of_turn
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the wound so that it is as it is at the beginning when it is healed.</start_of_turn

When the apoplexy is ancient and you have cured that which we have said, and do not touch your medicine, and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize that area with four cauteries: over all the heel of the foot; at the edge and the middle of the foot, as we have said; and in the groin.</start_of_turn

De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of pointed cautery for effective oblivion for inflammation.</start_of_turn

E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And take care of the whole patient and stop their groaning, and place your hand over their groin as described in the treatise on plasters.</start_of_turn

E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And thus if for those who are well it is good; and if not, then do three cauteries in the latter part of the heel, which are dependent from the most elevated part of the foot up to the most distant part of the heel.</start_of_turn
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And stop between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and take care of the cautery as it proceeds.</start_of_turn
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	More if you become addicted and the patient is so tolerant, then do the cautery in the middle of the foot; and if you wish to have greater addiction, then cauterize that over the two nails.</start_of_turn
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Take care of the wound once it is healed; and let the cautery be olive oil according to the manner which is recommended.</start_of_turn

De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On cauterization for epilepsy.</end_of_turn>
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not cauterized for epilepsy, but for that epilepsy is from spasm.</end_of_turn
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore modify the brain of it at the beginning and towards the end of the treatment, and in the other treatment which we have dictated in the division when the illness is great and the patient tolerates the exception of medicines.</end_of_turn>
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not suffer from the medicines, then administer astringents and masticators, giving him this for several days, to the benefit of the diet.</end_of_turn

De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterization for melancholy.</end_of_turn
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and great spasm, then cauterize as many times as I have said above, having paralyzed.</end_of_turn
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive fluidity declining to melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him to drink that which modifies the brain of it according to what has been said in the division.</end_of_turn

And give him to drink every day a meal for a week, or do another regimen of him that he is healthy; or if you will, cauterize those who make little points according to the greatest of them, but keep your hand over his hand in order: this is a kind of cautery that moistens the brain equally.</end_of_turn

De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterization of water descending in the sweat.</end_of_turn

Incisions are made over all the veins and arteries which are left over the codena; and these are cauterized in that length in the width of the temples.</end_of_turn
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Keep yourself away from the flow of blood when cauterizing; if you see blood flowing, leave any medicine behind, for it is of no use to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And indeed I learned this wisdom in the extraction of arteries and in the excision of those and caution against the flow of blood.</end_turn>
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And every vein is cauterized at the junction of two bones by two cautery instruments, which are produced immediately.</end_turn
Capitol .xiii.	(The text continues with the next section of the treatise.)</start_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of ancient tears.</start_of_turn
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the eyes are ancient and have become thick and clotted in the veins and arteries which are in the upper part of the head, and it has been verified that these are harmful humors, then cauterize that which we recounted at the beginning in the chapter concerning the beginning of water when it is poured over the eyes, and also cauterize in the middle part of the head and two cauteries at the junction of two temples, and two cauteries at the junction of two bones.</start_of_turn

De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cauterization of the stench of the nose.</start_of_turn

Capitol .xvi.	(The text continues with the next section of the treatise.)</start_of_turn
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cauterization of the eyelid of the eye when the hairs are converted to the parts behind the eyebrows and put the eye out.</start_of_turn

When the hairs of the eye are converted to the parts behind the eyebrows as well as when you put the eye out, cauterize in those two ways, either by burning or by medicinal fire.</start_of_turn
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you burn with the cautery, command the patient to lick his wounds until they are prolonged and equal; and if you put out the eye, then strengthen the eyes of the patient with a bandage so that they are not painful until the hairs are born anew.</start_of_turn

When the hairs are born anew and equal, then pause the head of the patient in the chest and then put your hand over the eyelid of the eye with your finger, as it is according to the figure of the palm of a hand, and be the beginning of the signal at the edge of the hairs.</start_of_turn

And indeed cauterize over the figure which you have signed, little by little, in veins that are seen, until the surface of the wound which is like a palm of a hand is completely burned, as it is indeed like a palm of a hand.</start_of_turn
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of the completion of your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already being contracted and the hairs of the eye already being elevated beyond the puncture of the eye.</start_of_turn

E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that which is inflamed until it is healed.</end_of_turn>

Maybe if it returns for any reason, then renew the cautery and soften the area with your finger, for the pain will have vanished as it did at first.</end_of_turn>

Maybe if the area is painful on the surface, then cauterize that until it is elevated to its natural place and is equal, and let the area not smell.</end_of_turn

Maybe apply medicine and burn this so that the patient reads the area until it is prolonged and equal, and then apply a paper bandage in the shape of a palm leaf.</end_of_turn

And take a spoonful of broth and cause him to drink water once.</end_of_turn namely.</end_of_turn> or how much, and mix these causes well, and make him drink water quickly so that he does not become chilled; and expand a little water over the paper which is applied thus in the shape of a palm leaf, and place that over a foul smell or both; and place the patient's head in the pit of the abdomen, and let the patient's head rest on his chest.</end_of_turn

And pause for a little while about the medicine and give him a little, and do not delay until the patient feels the biting of the medicine, which is in him just like fire.</end_of_turn
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel. And it is necessary for you to know that you must keep watch diligently over the wound so that no more medicine is spilled, and if the area is painful for several days, it is softened and any cause of the area's pain is gone, then repeat the medicine on that area which is softened, just as you did at the beginning, and let him recover until it is healed.</end_of_turn>

You know that the humors of men are diverse according to their magnitude and their smallness, and therefore according to what is useful for your contraction.</end_of_turn
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Do not be ashamed of the way things are done in this art.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.</end_turn
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cautery of fistula which is in the tear duct of the eye.</end_turn
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure the fistula with water as we have said in the divisions of diseases, do not trust your care, then cauterize as follows: command the patient to keep his head down on his chest, and have his head held by some minister between the thighs in such a way that it is neither too high nor too low on the chest.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And pause your hand immersed in water or in slime over the eye.</end_of_turn
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And take the cautery which is of this form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is conquered, thus as the shape of a hook or of a turning pin, from one extremity to the other where the cautery is applied.</end_turn
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, pierce through to the other extremity.</end_turn
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, withdraw thus as you did.</end_turn
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	Better is that which is conquered to the chest work.</end_turn
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And immediately close the fistula if it is open, and bring it back to its natural place and dry that.</end_of_turn
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open that and remove the pus from it.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And pause your hand over the cautery which is well ignited, and hold his hand over the eye with a little of the cautery of the eye to the side of the nose, so that neither your hand nor the patient is irritated, and then pause the cautery on the gray matter of the eye and remove that.</end_of_turn
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, if at the commencement of the wound the cautery has penetrated the bone, it is not good; but if it has not, repeat the cautery once or twice more if necessary. Leave that to rest for three days, and then place your hand over that part and send for an exsiccator to drain it until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If it has been a few days and it has not healed, then suspend the corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and as much as it is convenient according to the custom of the sick person
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another method of cautery for fistula is as follows: enter the fistula and leave that there for a while, and then place your hand on the surrounding tissue, which is the cause of the fistula. Leave enough of the fistula open to allow the blood to flow; but do not make the wound too large, for fear of causing further pain. Keep your hand over the wound until the fistula has healed completely.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula has healed as we have said concerning the cautery and the treatment, it is not necessary to do anything further; but if it has not healed, it is necessary to administer an emollient through the nose and reduce the fistula to the root of the nose according to the situation
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cautery of the wound we speak further down
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many veins that accompany the nerves are cut accidentally by fissures in the lips, and especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures as we have said in the previous chapters and do not avail yourself of your treatment, then do the following:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And make the depth of the incision according to the thickness of the tissue.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	And keep your hand firmly on that part until the cautery has reached the base of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cautery of fistula in the mouth
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or on the roots of the teeth there is excessive eating and it becomes painful, and it is broken, and it is softened, and there is formed a fistula, and when you have treated it and have not benefited from the treatment, then cover that area with cautery according to the amount that is received in the fistula. And put that light on the edge of the fistula, and put your hand over that until the fire of the light reaches the root of the fistula, and after that make an incision once or twice. And take care of that as we have said of the treatment until it is healed
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	Therefore, if the swelling is resolved and it is healed, it is not necessary to do anything further; but if it has not healed, it is necessary to uncover the root and remove the corrupted bone as it is convenient according to the custom of the patient
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cautery of the teeth and of smoothing of the veins
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the veins are softened by humidity and the teeth are blackened, and when you have treated those with medicines and they do not yield, then put the tip of the instrument in the belly of the patient and, having lit the cautery, make a small incision so that the flame reaches the root of the tooth without causing excessive heat.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And withdraw your hand and repeat the cautery several times as you wish
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And rinse the patient’s mouth with salt water and keep it there for an hour, and then remove that, for the blackened tooth is stopped and the softened gum is strengthened and the putrid humidity is dried out
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cautery for toothache
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold, or if it is too hot or does not yield to treatment with medicine, then do the following: either cauterize along the gum line or cauterize with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterizing along the gum line means that you take the edge of a piece of leather and put it into a pan of fire, and when it is red hot, you touch it to the edge of the tooth with your hand covered with cloth, and you keep it there until the tooth is numb.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat that several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you wish, immerse a sponge or cloth in the border of the diseased limb, and rest it on the painful tooth, and rest it on the ignited instrument until the instrument reaches the depth of the curvature of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the use of the cautery with fire is that you must be attentive to the quantity of charcoal or instrument, and in the midst of them any roughness and the sharpness of the fire should not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And if you have ignited the cautery, let it take the shape you wish, and rest it on the tooth and keep your hand there until the cautery is cooled; and do whatever you can so that the pain may subside or on this day or on the next day
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And know that in order to prevent infection from that cautery that the patient should fill his mouth with good broth and keep it there for an hour, and then remove it; and this is the method of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as much as you can according to what is possible for you.<end_turn>
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the method of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cautery of extrusions.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrusions are of fleck and cold humors and do not obey digestion by medicines, and you wish to digest them lightly, then your fire will cauterize the shape as follows: with two limbs covered so that the smoke from the cautery does not reach the other limb, and rest the ignited instrument on that area for a while, and if you wish to digest further, do so until it reaches the bottom of the ulcer.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the ulcer is small, then rest the cautery according to the quantity of the ulcer, and keep it covered for three days and rest its sponge soaked in broth until it is consumed what the fire has consumed
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that which is burnt and tents and cloths until it is healed
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the way of the cannula or give the cautery in this way is convenient
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of the cautery of the palate of the voice and of the constriction of the throat
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity is on the palate of the voice and is more so when it is cold of composition, then know that the patient must be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that beyond the root of the epiglottis in the recessed place
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And take care that you do not reach the epiglottis with the cautery or burn the edge of the cord rather a little bit
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that beyond the other cautery must be done beyond the junction of the jaw at the back of the vertebra of the throat

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of cautery of the spleen.</start_of_turn

De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	From the cautery of the heel towards the base of the toes, in order to remove the swelling.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you have incised the heel, then do you ignite the cautery so that it is like a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Return the ignited cautery between the heel and the base of the toe, and stop your hand until it reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood flows out.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do two incisions, if you see that the wound is gaping, then cauterize each one as much as we have recounted, and take care of those which are around it so that they do not suffer from the heat until it is healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery on anything, it is more dangerous in treatment.
Capitol .xxxvi.	End of text.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	From the cautery of fistulas which are useful in nature are harmful in their parts.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work which we have recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened of it, whether it is healthy or not
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore when one sees fistula in nature that is old, corrupted by dirt and moisture, and one must know that it is more useful to try to close it than to open it up again.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Like a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And put the ignited cautery into this fistula, and according to the quantity of the tissue which you must penetrate
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And do this until you have burned up those corrupt tissues for a while, two or three times, according to the quantity of your need
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	Beware of burning nerves and veins; or if the fistula is in the bladder or the belly, then take care of all those parts; and do not do anything else until the fistula is in a fleshy place and you think that it is not penetrating
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the place until it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed, and if you have removed from it the matter, and you remain like this for a long time, then know that it is already healed entirely
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the matter is not removed from it, then know that it is penetrating or in the preparation of doing so, or that it comes from those causes from which it will remind you in its place.

De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Of the cautery of the boils
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the boils there is pain from cold or from great wind, and to prevent the suffering of the patient, then cover that which is over the boils with the cautery over every boil which has a claw from which the cause is remembered
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And do the cautery with force according to a little space, because three cauteries will go in a line, and therefore will be more effective in treatment

De cauterizacio de la vesica.	Of the cautery of the bladder
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When it happens in the bladder swelling and softening from cold and from moisture, and also that the urine does not retain the mal, then cauterize that which is further from the bladder on the flank of the belly, from the start of the ribs, and cauterize with a cautery at the back, and with another at the front
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And the length of each cautery according to the quantity of the wound; and do the cautery with two cauteries if necessary
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And be careful of the claw as it is processed

De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Of the cautery of the thumb
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is in the thumb cold and moisture, and to prevent it from being burned, and when the nails are corrupted, and when there is a delay in the production of the nails, and when there is pain that has happened to them, then cover that the place should be cauterized with three cauteries in the circuit of the navel, as we said in the cautery of the bladder; and with a cautery over the further part of the belly, or with two cauteries, and be careful of the claw as it is processed
