De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist mucus humors are spread throughout the ankle joint, and causes swelling of the limb, the sign is that the swelling is prolonged on the other side when compared with the normal.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	The place of dislocation is found at the point where the bones touch.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore when you cauterize the disease on the ankle with a pointed cautery, do so in a circular fashion so that you do not tear the surrounding tissue, and so that the surrounding parts do not suffer damage.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the cautery which precedes this should be of the same form as the cautery of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not at hand, then do three cauteries with olive oil.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And do the cautery according to the quantity of spiciness of the whole area; and take care that it is healed correctly.
Capitol .xli.	End of text.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	The next text is about cauterizing the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When there is pain in the ankle area, caused by cold and moisture, the disease is cured with what has been said before and not confirmed, and when it is old, that you must remove the moisture of the humors with solid pills or with artificial or similar pills; and then cauterize that area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of cautery in this case is in two ways: either with medicinal substances that are comburents, or with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	The second way is that you make three triangular cauteries on the ankle bone at this point, and do them with good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the space between each cautery should be the size of the thickness of the finger, and if you use olive oil or grease
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Some people put the cautery on the lower part of the ankle above the ankle bone so that there are four cauteries in total
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	Or do the cautery in the circle that precedes the form of the ankle dislocation, and make it continuous and consume the spiciness of the whole area
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	This is the manner of cautery for the sciatica when the pain is attached to the ankle and is not extended to the swelling.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	If it is extended to the swelling, then do two cauteries on the swelling on the limb where the pain is, and one cautery on the heel for four fingers a little beyond the wrist
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is too deep, and the depth of the cautery is according to the quantity of spiciness of the area
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	If the disease sends that the pain is extended to the foot bones, then do three or four cauteries here where the pain is sent as well as there.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	If the disease sends pain that can be seen outside the swelling, then do one deep cautery here.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And take care in all cauterizations that you do not burn nerves or large vessels, and that for this reason you must be careful not to damage the disease or contract anything.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have seen others who have cauterized on the heel and finished the cautery, and the limb was so inflamed that the tumor almost reached the heel, and the limb was perforated and corrupted throughout
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	Therefore apply a strong vinegar solution from the belly, and do the same with wine.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts do each one according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the learned men say that the best way of cauterizing the ankle is to make a circle of iron whose circumference is the size of half a palm; and the depth of the burn should be according to the thickness of the date stone or less
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And put another third in; and let the space between them be the size of the nail of the thumb; and these circles should be close together, and the length of these incisions should be a nail or two, and do in these marks of iron diligently around the circles; and this is the form of it.
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	And do the fire in the firebox until it is covered in ash and sparks are seen, and do hold it still over the ankle, the disease is placed on the side of the ankle.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	Therefore, cauterize with three cauteries around the area in a circle.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And so leave it for three days; then plaster that area around the edges and leave the wound open for several days; and finally care for that area until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Say Albucasis: or, friends, with this type of cautery we have rarely used for the terror of its appearance, and for what few have found that which is useful for it.</end_of_turn>
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	More of the better cauteries for those who suffer from it, and find in that place the area.</end_of_turn
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	More cautery than medicines remains, for you must make two circles having the navel pierced in which to insert the thumb of the hand; let the length of the line from the navel to the armpits be two nails or as many as those.</end_of_turn
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space which is between each quantity of the thickness of the thumb; and if it is opened up from below and above, and if it contains as much as this form:

E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And so raise your hand with the instrument and wash the warm water from the entire ankle with cold water.</end_of_turn>
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And so leave it for three days and place your hand over that border until the blackness of the swelling has gone, and leave it for a few days, and come back to see if it has disappeared; this is the end of treatment.</end_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Finally care for that area until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain is extended to the thigh or the leg, make it stay in that place which contains water as is done in the ankle swelling.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	This is the way of warm water, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the rectification of medicines.</end_of_turn>
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe of alkali and caustic not extinct of both parts, one part each, and grind them and leave them in a new wave of which the part left should be perforated with a small hole, according to the quantity that enters into it.</end_of_turn
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And leave the bottom of the wave another wave coming, and take over that alkali and caustic alive from lukewarm water which you take by a thumb, and when you have grasped those with your thumb for a good compression, and leave the rest that comes from the acute water in the left part to the wave coming.</end_of_turn

And so adjust all that water, and take another live caustic and another renewed alkali, for that which in the hours if it be put in strong acute, which is administered in surgical operations of medicine and in cauterization of the other members, for that operation is like fire.</end_of_turn
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And so of the many medicines which are cauterized widely, some are like tartar and alum, and caustic like sulfur which are mixed together.</end_of_turn

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of the cautery of gout and joint pain.</end_of_turn
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament. E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And it is that you burn around the evacuation in the circuit of the ankle bone with more cauteries.</end_of_turn
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let the cautery be olive oil of which this is the form:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.</end_of_turn
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if the pain rises within the bones or in the other joints, and when these things are seen to be necessary, then burn over each painful area with three cauteries or over the entire area with this olive oil cautery.</end_of_turn
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	And if more cauteries are necessary than these, then do burn with greater care and do not touch the cautery too much before, neither only with the point but also with the handle of the cautery.</end_of_turn
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if the pain arises within the bone and the heel, then administer the cautery that we have said in the previous chapter.</end_of_turn
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pain is only in the toes and is urgent, then puncture in the circle of the nails as if it were a wheel, puncture in those two lines.</end_of_turn
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	If pain persists in the toes, the doctor punctures the circumference of the bones every night and on the pinch of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	If pain continues to linger for several days in the joints or muscles, the doctor cauterizes them throughout their entirety
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	Do not evacuate the patient from good order and reception of medicines, for if it is good order and inflammation, it is evacuated with this pointed cautery without danger, God help us.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of cautery of fractures.</end_of_turn>
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a fracture has occurred in the ankle and saying the bones are tender before the hernia, and when this begins to approach, the doctor must order the patient to lie still in bed and to use soft supports so that the wound does not open from the belly button.</end_of_turn
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And then follow the patient between your thighs on the bed, and command them to keep their thigh bones inside until the hernia is retrieved or the hernia or the intestine appears.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity and signal the fracture on the fifth bone by indicating the limb that appears similar to a half circle of the upper parts of the body.</end_of_turn>
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then make the cautery in this way:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it is soft and gives a tingling sensation.</end_of_turn
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.</end_of_turn
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then pause the cautery on that signal with your hand on the cautery, and when you have driven the fracture into the middle of the bone; repeat this until you have achieved it in the first attempt on the bone.</end_of_turn
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe wisely the condition of the intestine during the cautery, that you do not burn the intestine so that there does not result in death or other great harm to the patient.</end_of_turn>
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And remember that when you have finished the cautery do not neglect the bone, do not confer your operation.</end_of_turn
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And cover that the cautery of the children should be subtle according to their age and measure.</end_of_turn
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And take care of the place of the cautery for three days with a border until the wound of the fire is healed.</end_of_turn
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And take care of those who are with inflammation until they are healed.</end_of_turn
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient should rest on the bed for forty days until the wound and the swelling are sealed.</end_of_turn
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And cover that you suspend the food of the patient according to the length of time of the treatment of the which it covers the belly of the patient, and that the intestine does not come out due to the effort to recover.</end_of_turn
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when it is time to take the patient away after forty days, the doctor must administer medicine properly for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And be careful of work and of replenishment of food and drink, and of harsh words, for when you use this regimen of treatment entirely you will find the patient completely healed.</end_of_turn
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I say the treatment of fractures in other parts of the belly, and so at the beginning, and you must not neglect, the doctor must cauterize the fracture round as much as necessary; and this is what is ejected from the cavity as well as a third part of it; and take care of that which we have said, and do not adjust it.</end_of_turn
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And I have already said that the first fracture must be cauterized with a triangular cautery in this way, because it is signaled with a tremor.</end_of_turn
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	and it is stopped like that for the width of the limb beyond the fracture, and another line at the heel; and hold your hand with a claw cautery, for the first cautery is more painful and better.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLV.</end_of_turn
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of cautery of torsion.</end_of_turn
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain persists in various parts of the body due to an accident or percussion, and the pain does not subside with medication, it is necessary to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	The cautery should be applied to the entire limb according to its size, its toughness and flexibility, its twisting and pain sensation
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if the first cautery does not suffice, repeat it several times; for it is often from these punctures that pain originates, in order to ensure that the pain is relieved when the ailment is cured

De cauterizacio de lepra.	On cauterization for leprosy
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Many books speak of cautery for great benefit, but it should not be used for the species of leprosy that causes putrefaction of fat and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	Therefore, when you wish to cauterize, consider whether the leprosy is acute or chronic and cured with what we have said in the division, neither too little nor too much; and fear lest the corruption should embrace the whole body and its completeness, for then cauterize on the head with three cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and two at the sides, and on the forehead above the eyebrows; and two at the back, over the nape of the neck or on the shoulder.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, lay your hand over the cautery for a moment until a slight blistering appears on the bone, and from that the scales will be loosened; so that the expulsion of thick vapor is alleviated from them; and cauterize on the belly as required
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If the leprosy has already spread over the body and is evident, it is necessary to cauterize in addition to the previous cauteries mentioned in the head; and on the tip of the nose, and two on the two cheekbones, and two on two vertebrae of the neck, and five on the vertebrae of the chest, and one on the chest near the shoulder, and two on the wrists, and two on the thumbs, and two on the knuckles, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of the thighs; and cauterize on all the joints of the fingers and toes, and on all the nails of the feet and on the teeth of the patient
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And beware of the nerves that are above the ankle so that you do not burn them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	Many are cauterized with a cautery on the fifth toe bone and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the heel
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	Remember that the more cauteries you make, the greater the benefit and the greater the safety; and remember that the body is already stupefaied when there is no pain in the cautery, just as if they had never been applied
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And know that the cauteries should be large or small according to the limb and the joints as it precedes the species of instruments
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And take care that the cautery is well bound with a piece of cloth or bandage and with another care that it is not too tight
Capitol .xlviii.	End of Book.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization for stupor
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When any limb is stiff or sleeping and is cured with medicines, oils and plasters, and is not cured, then you cauterize the stiff limb with cauteries as it deserves according to the greatness of the limb or the smallness of it
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And do the cautery on the testis entering the testicles a little
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that which is within until it is cured
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And some are cauterized every stupor that comes from the head and the feet, from the vertebrae of the neck and see the loosening of the nerves that are causing that limb, and it is remapped the stupor
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not presume more than what is known in the anatomy of the limb and the exit of the nerves throughout the body

De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cauterization of gangrene that is rotting
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When gangrene is old and does not yield to the application of medical remedies, then you cauterize on that which is cauterized before a little according to the quantity of the matter within that the white becomes gray and the color turns to black.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that which is of the earth and of lentils with olive oil and marjoram leaves, with columb or vinegar, give each a little and mix them all together, and keep it covered with a bandage and hold it in place until it is cured

De cauterizacio de cranc.	Capital. Freedom. From burnings.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins and wants to devour that limb, then cauterize that part with a pointed instrument around the circumference as it is twisted.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And say the learned men that it is cauterized behind the heel in the middle area; however, to me it is not seen that it is ulcerated, for I have seen several veins.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is better to cauterize around the circumference as I have said, or by cautery.

De cauterizacio de adubilati.	From burnings of the bones.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some bones are delayed in maturation, and this is due either to excessive fatness or for the state of the patient, who is old in decrepitude, or for little rest, or for the time, and you want to hasten the maturation of bones; then cauterize around the circumference with small punctures; and immediately say that which is fasting in maturation
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena. De cauterizacio de corrodent.	From burnings of the teeth
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	The tooth is a mobile corruption in the limb, which consumes that as if with fire like burning dry wood
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if sometimes that corruption is in the place where you suffer from the cautery with fire, then do you cauterize the nails a few, as it is convenient in that place where it is corrupted.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And immediately cauterize all around until you have eradicated the whole corruption and there remains no cause of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And immediately say that for three days, and suspend on the cauterized places until three days have passed with olive oil mixed so that the scars are completely eradicated and the whole corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And immediately care for that which is engendered by the flesh
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	However, if for three times three days that the flesh should grow healthy in which there is no corruption, it is not so; however, if not, then immediately repeat the cautery over that which is broken in the corrupted places
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And the tooth is treated in many ways with acute medicine, which is half in place of the cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, fire cautery is more useful in many ways.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the treatment of them with acute medicine in the division, and therefore take that when there is an abundance of it
Capitol .liii.	Freedom. Three times
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	From burnings of nails and of the like things
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many veins that are seen outside the foot are diseased in the lower parts of the foot that is called claw, and this is a great cause, made, which comes from there; and the cautery is done in two ways, one with fire and the other with cold water
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	However, fire cautery is more so that you ignite the cautery instrument like punishment of a wound, which is made of iron according to the quantity which the claw contains throughout, and of slight stripes
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And immediately suspend that ignition on the claw, and immediately turn your hand over the cautery around the circumference of the claw until the cautery reaches the depth of the claw.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And say that for three days until the limb starts to recover
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz. E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And immediately care for that which is engendered of the flesh until it is healed
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not recover, and many veins have been seen to happen on the surface of the limb, mainly in the feet, then you must know that you must administer in those cauteries with cold water, for take a little bundle of wool or iron or punishment of a wound, and suspend that on the claw; and immediately put some cold water over the bundle of wool, and keep your hand, and turn that over on compression of your hand all around, and press the margin of the bundle against the root of the claw, and hold the cold water away from the root of the claw; and wait for the patient for a while for the pain of the cold water to pass for an hour, and then remove that, for the claw will have been eradicated from its root
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus we must enter with one hand into those which we have just opened until we come over all of them throughout the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And we must take care of those whose roots are eradicated with the incisions so that the flesh does not suffer from their emergence.</end_of_turn>

De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of cautery of tremor.</end_of_turn
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When indeed an ulcer trembles from cold in the nerves or from excessive heat, or from another similar cause, then you must cauterize in four places or more over the vertebrae of the two, between each vertebra with a cautery; and on the feet of the patient, and over their stomach, with olive oil.</end_of_turn
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor subsides and confirms the health of the feverish disease.</end_of_turn

De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of cautery of accidental wounds to the body.</end_of_turn
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body there are spilled blood vessels, and there are pus-filled wounds which are caused by corrupt thick matter; therefore you must at the beginning when it appears that it must be cauterized over the head of the fistula with a fine needle and a loop of thread, the extremity of which is extended towards the fire; or at the root of erotology longus; or with a small cautery.</end_of_turn
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes it is cauterized somewhat at the beginning of its discharge in this manner; and do not be surprised, for the excess is broken and the swelling is reduced thereby.</end_of_turn

De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of cautery of the flux of blood from an accidental wound by incision of an artery.</end_of_turn
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many times there is a flux of blood from an artery which is incised behind the plaque which must be excised, or behind the incision of apostemas or cautery of the limb, and in this way it is difficult to control it.</end_of_turn
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore when such a thing happens to you, then immediately you must cover with your hand the orifice of the artery, and pause for a moment over that place where you have indicated, and hold in place until all the blood has drained from the wound, and that it does not escape.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And immediately stop the bleeding by applying a few coarse and fine cauteries, in number as many as necessary, and uncover those until they are no longer inflamed.</end_of_turn
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And immediately take hold of those with a little or a great one according to the place and the wound in which the artery is broken, over that vein firmly holding back the bleeding until it has clotted, and cauterize until it is healed and that bleeding has ceased.</end_of_turn
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you have held back the bleeding and squeezed the cauteries, then take another cautery immediately covering the previous ones which are in the fire, and therefore do not cease until the blood has clotted.</end_of_turn
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And take care that you do not burn the nerves which are here, and that you come over the patient with another disease.</end_of_turn
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you must know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to restrict the blood flow, and more when the artery is large, if there is not one of four methods: or to cauterize as we have said, or to extract it when not extracted, or when extracted the limbs are burned and the blood is clotted, or that it be bound with thread or a ligature to make a strong structure, or that they be held with powders or astringents.</end_of_turn
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	May those who administer decent restriction of the thread and stricture with a bandage or for the position of causes which burn and prevent, do not grieve but rather rejoice.</end_of_turn
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	May he also say that if this happens to you and the physician is not present or the medicine is not available, then open immediately at the orifice of that vein as we have said, and understand with great care that the bleeding must stop before the wound is finally healed; and that the artery must not be clotted; and that over the artery must be poured a strong cold water until the blood is clotted and thickened; and do whatever is necessary to cauterize or to use medicine.</end_of_turn

De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	From incision and perforation and winds and from phlebotomy and from plagues and from swellings and from their appearances.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter that in all diseases in which the pointed cautery is convenient and the medicine is combatant, and the occasions and the causes of them, and the instruments necessary for them, and the forms of the cautery; and we have ordered the chapters of the subchapter to the feet
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter in that way, so that what you desire may be relieved, whenever you demand it
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And since I am beginning this, know that in this chapter is for terror what is in the first chapter of cautery
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because of that I say that great care must be taken in this operation, because in it are evacuated the things which are in the great danger of causing death, such as the bursting of the vein or perforation of the abscess or excision or extraction of the tumor or opening of the wound or cutting of the bone and their like.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all of these are accompanied by fear and tremor and in most of them death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that you must not fall into that which is the state of things, for in some cases negligence may cause you to act in a manner worthy of men of low character rather than of men of great maladies
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And it is from this that some will go mad with their disease and will be glad to die rather than bear the burden of their disease, and will be filled with fear of the disease itself, and of the fear of death which it brings.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And concerning these things I say to you, do not hope for that healing, and do not speak of it, for your expectation of healing will be pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	Therefore do not consent to that which is done to you of which you are speaking; and your care should be greater than your desire, and your speed greater still; and do not presume any cause except for that which you know with certainty is the cause of your disease, and of which you are sure that it will bring about a beneficial result.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	Use in the treatment of all these maladies the prognosis and the indication of which is the greatest health benefit, for in that lies your help in the acquisition of fame and memory, of love and glory
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, children, God be with you and do not fear to listen to my direction and my protection, for it is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter to be distinguished by chapters according to the order of the chapter of cautery, of the care of the head to the feet, so that what you desire and what you have need of may be alleviated from you.

De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the care of the water which is contained in the head of childhood.</end_turn>
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You know that this disease does not depart from childhood until it has finished with the head of the child when the new maid begins to nurse the child when she gives birth to the head of the child.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And every negligence is for a hidden cause which is not known
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I do not see this disease except in childhood; and in all those whom I have seen it, death has been hidden by it, and for this reason I say that I have seen it left undone in these cases.</end_turn
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was filled with water, the head of which was always swelling up until Caesar could not place his hand over it because of its greatness, and that the humidity increased until it brought about death.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is either added to the bone and the marrow, or is added outside the bones over the brain
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For if the humidity is between the bone and the marrow and the abscess is little, then you must make a wound in the middle of the head with a fissure two fingers wide, until the humidity runs out, and this is the form of the wound:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the humidity is greatly increased and the abscess is large, then you must make two wounds according to this manner
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is outside the bones, a sign of this is that you often consume the food of the head open to the whole and the water is squeezed out when you press with your thumb against the parts surrounding it and it is not water that you have hidden
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Therefore make three wounds in the middle of the head according to this manner
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And thus extract all the humidity; strengthen the fissures with drapes and feathers; and apply vinegar and oil for five days; then remove the ligament and heal the wound with attempts and warmth, and strengthen the head equally; and feed the patient dry food of little humidity until the limb is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	Another method of incision is to consider the magnitude of the swelling and the collection of fluid, which sometimes occurs in the occipital region, or in the front, or on the right, or on the left; therefore pay attention to the incision where the swelling appears and the fluid is collected, and do so as much as possible.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	Note that you should not incision the artery and ensure that blood flows freely from the wound and relieve the patient of pain by evacuating the fluid with the discharge of humidity.

De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples

De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	From the care of the limbs affected by sharp and acidic ulcers of the humors.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa. E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of any incision is the quantity of three fingers adjusted.</start_of_turn
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge pad or dry cloth moist with those which you can absorb the blood.</start_of_turn
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And immediately place between the palm of two sharp extremities, from which this is the form of the incision of them:</start_of_turn
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	That it is from the first part of the temple up to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio. E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And do the same with this sponge and put inside the first incision another vessel or instrument, which is called the cutellar, somewhat blunt on one side and sharp on the other side.</start_of_turn>
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And stop the bleeding of that sharp instrument which is over the flesh of the limb, and the bleeding of the bone does not go down to the heel, and fill that up until it reaches the fissure that moves, and cut away all the vessels that go from the head to the heel.</start_of_turn

Maybe the incision should be continued up to that part of the limb, and do so with the point of the incision in the middle of the fissure between the two incisions.</start_of_turn

And do the same with any old wound that is callous, and cover those dusts with vinegar, oil and wine vinegar, and whatever does not adhere after cautery.</start_of_turn

And on the third day remove the ligament and give great abundance of warm water or tepid, and do so with the point of the cautery over ointment of beeswax with olive oil and other things that will make the wounds heal.</start_of_turn

De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Concerning the care of wounds of the limbs that descend from the parts that are below the head.</start_of_turn
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When some violent catarrh exists and continues, and sometimes the limbs of the patient extend slightly, and since regarding them it is necessary to show moderation, their ulcers and their pus are to be regarded as matters of great importance, and in the front of the head there is acute pain of the teeth and subsequent vomiting, which are the result of these accidents that the substances and catarrh do not go down but by blood vessels from the parts that are below.</start_of_turn

E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And do the same with dusts covered in vinegar and oil so that it does not adhere after cautery.</start_of_turn

And when you remove it and see that the swelling has already diminished, the time has come to cover the bone until it begins to become soft, and do so with the point of the cautery as if you were taking two barley grains and four barley grains and mixing them, or doing something like that, and make a plaster and administer it to these wounds that are of soft tissue.</start_of_turn
Capitol .vi.	End of Document.</start_of_turn
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Regarding the care of what is catarrhal in the ankles.</start_of_turn
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Every cause that causes catarrh in the ankles is of four kinds, either a mineral pebble or something that simulates a pebble, such as iron and gravel, or of plant origin such as chaff or beans, or of a fluid origin such as vinegar and wine vinegar and similar things.</start_of_turn
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when a pebble causes catarrh in the ankle or any other cause that does not fit or grow in the ankle, and if sometimes the pebble is discharged in any of these causes by olive oil or by vomit, do so with the point of the cautery, and make it vomit with condiment, and wash the area around the event of vomiting.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And do the same with some pieces of cloth or gauze around the ankle and stretch the ankle towards the parts above, because the swelling caused by these causes is soft-yielding.</start_of_turn
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not soft-yielding, do so with the extraction of the ankle using the instrument called epicicarios subtle which is like this:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is soft-yielding with the thumb, it is good; but if not, do so with the extraction of the ankle using an ointment of little duplication.</start_of_turn
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	Therefore, if it is not urgent, make a needle of gut and insert the extremity of the needle into the space between the tarsal bones and close around the needle with wax and olive oil to prevent anything but the needle from coming out.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And if you have extracted with the gut string with great attraction, which troops have seen as much as we who have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	May be if it is not urgently done in this manner, then take a pinch of alum or vinegar and apply it to the area with which the boils are present, and let the patient rest for a while in that extremity, and then cover the area adequately with a bandage
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And insert it into the space between the tarsal bones easily, and immediately remove the moisture from the area
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	Therefore, if it is not urgently necessary in all of the causes that we have recounted, then you must order that the patient be treated with cautery or spasm for the pain that is left over after the other treatments.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to treat this is to cauterize the phlegmas of the vein of the foot and extract the abscess according to the virtue of the herbs, and then make an incision between your thumbs and convert the heel to the parts below, and do not make a large incision in the heel, but rather a small fissure in the heel where the abscess is located, and leave the heel gray in the place before and after the treatment.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And the wound should be of a crescent shape until it reaches the nail, and when the nail is grasped, hold it with appropriate instruments; and immediately close the wound at that moment, and care for it until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the pain is one of the fats that grows and inflates, then administer the care and extraction of these; even if you do not obey your order immediately, the physician will take spontaneous action according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	give an incision to that fat which is causing the pain in the heel.</start_turn>
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	Do not be afraid when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the heel, and rest in soft matters, and we will extract it with nails or with instruments, or by incision as we have said, for the extraction is alleviated.</start_turn
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that is introduced into the heel cover that the pain uses to emit at the beginning, and fill the heel cavity with some old cloth, and keep that heel on the water, and if because of that it is urgent, do not be afraid; but if not, take troops of nails and leeches according to the length of the toe, and tie them in the heel for a little while, and the patient will put one of those into the space between the heel and jump on the other foot over that part and strike with the other foot on the foot that is causing the heel pain.</start_turn
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore do not stop until all the water is gone.</start_turn
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water is finally gone, take paper or gauze.</start_turn and put one extremity into the heel and extend the other extremity over the fire until the majority of the pain is gone.</start_turn

Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of beasts that enter that heel, if it is small, praise and hold it still, care for it as we have said in the division; but if it is of great size which causes pain at the same time, the physician will administer the extraction with nails and instruments, and the cause of this is less severe than all the other causes that cause pain in the heel.</start_turn
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of worms that are engendered in the heel, when you have cured that which we have said in the division and in the treatise of distillations, and do not fear your cure, the physician will cover that the patient must go out into the sunlight.</start_turn
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Therefore, if there appears any cause of the worms, the physician will extract that with nails or fine needles, but if no cause appears, the physician will take a needle and make a hole of sufficient size for it:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz. But if you do not obey my order immediately, the physician will apply an ointment and close the opening of the needle with wax as we have said; the physician will administer distillations which have already been prepared in the treatment of the worms, and will find that in the treatise of distillations.</start_turn

E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Then make an incision of silver or lead, leaving a small tract, and place a pledget therein.</end_of_turn>
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And thus proceed as is customary when the canula of containment is in the curvature here where it is necessary.</end_of_turn>

And if you wish, take the rag and wrap it around the lower part of the limb adequately, and pour oil onto the cavity of the wound, or juice of any herb, or any other medicine you wish in the canula — and that is in the heel — and then put the rag back onto the limb and press with your hand that which is pressing in a temperate manner until the oil is expelled from the cavity of the wound and the patient feels the oil remaining in the wound.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And when it is infiltrated in the heel, it is already scorched with fire a little.</end_of_turn>
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And take care that the cause from which you distill in the heel is not too hot, because the medicines of the heel do not suffer from that.</end_of_turn
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.</end_of_turn>
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the care of the ointment of the heels.</end_of_turn>
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some girls and even some women of greater age do not perforate their bellies, and when it has already happened in some men, ointment in the meat of the heel for pleasure or for nothing in particular; and this ointment is sometimes useful in the groin of the heel which does not always happen, and sometimes in the outer parts.</end_of_turn
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the groin of the heel, which does not always happen, is in the greatest precautions of difficult healing.</end_of_turn
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that in which you can make it happen, cover that you keep the heel of the patient towards the sun and rest in that.</end_of_turn
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And thus if sometimes the ointment appears, open that with a fine spatula of which this is the form.</end_of_turn
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the limb in which it is small has a narrowness, of which one side is acute and the other is not; and the spatula is of two lion heads so that it does not make a wound in the heel.</end_of_turn
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And thus if the ointment is for nothing born in the heel or in the meat of the limb, then do that with fine nails and cut that with great ease until all the flesh is gone.</end_of_turn
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the ointment is in the groin of the heel, then take a fine lion’s nail and burn that with a little fire, and then put that in the meat of the heel.</end_of_turn
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And thus if you smell ointment in that which the patient is at rest with ease, for the gravity of the sitting, endeavor to press the oppression of it with ease; and take care not to damage the nerves of the heel.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And thus keep the heel wrapped around like the amount of the width of the incision which you have enveloped in Egyptian unguent; and do that for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound; or that you take something and put it inside and sprinkle over it salt and powder and use it; and if sometimes the heel has already become festered, then cover that and change that for another one which you will wrap in lint that is useful with olive oil, until the festered wound is healed; and take care of that until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	And if there happens to be a flow of urine, cover the sponge or cloth in cold water and place it on the heel, and use another remedy which restricts the flow of urine, which is mentioned in the treatise on distillation.</end_of_turn
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.</end_of_turn
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the care of the swelling which is caused to the eyelids.</end_of_turn
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	The swellings which are caused to the eyelids by any kind of vegetable are some moist, and some are dry.</end_of_turn
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore you must keep those with nails or onci, and scratch those with the nails of your hands, and then rest upon the places where it is scratched.</end_of_turn
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	And if there is pain in the flow of urine, then you cauterize those with a pointed lancet.</end_of_turn
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is when the abscesses and carbuncles are removed when any cause of those causes has disappeared; and when they are cauterized with fire, those abscesses are consumed and do not return.</end_of_turn
Capitol .ix.	Capitol ix.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Capital ix.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	The cold humors which infiltrate each part of the body cause great pain in the feet, which is usually called gout by physicians.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, in such a case you must consider that the great pain comes from the foot itself, and not from the outside. The cause of this is its lightness.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore open the space between the patient's thighs, and gently push out that which is outside so that it escapes easily, and place your hand over that which remains to prevent it from escaping.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you do not wish to open the wound, just slightly pierce the foot with a small incision, for the pain will not be noticed in any way.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the swelling is great, then you must suture it; and care for that until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is slight, you need not fear that it will cause any harm because the swelling will restore itself and shrink.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	If the swelling is diminishing on the side of the foot, you must draw out the surface of the foot, suspend the swelling with your hand, otherwise if you pull out from the incision, the patient will not notice anything.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And finally, close the incision, wash the area with salt-water; and care for the wound until it is healed.
