De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	The treatment of this great pain of the foot which comes from the outside of the foot.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	The greatest of these is that which is engendered in the humors of the foot itself, and especially in children, for they suffer from this more and their bones are weakened thereby; and they cannot bear the heat of the sun because the fat in their limbs becomes soft and sticky at this time.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	Therefore they sometimes walk on their faces all the time, and on their faces they sleep; and their feet are always wet with moisture, for the swelling has already covered them, and the appearance of further swelling is imminent; and when you touch their hand with your thumb, the swelling is reduced within them
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	Every way of operating in such a case is to make the patient lie down on his side and gently push up the limb and put on a bandage; and circle it according to the quantity of humors which are contained throughout, and then press on that and pull down from the thumb of your hand so that the swelling is more concentrated in the middle of the circle, and finally open the space between the thighs to the extent that the incision does not exceed the breadth of the incision in phlegmatique swelling.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the preparation do not make the incision too deep, because after the process of drawing out the swelling the remainder will be like white chalk.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore extract that which you wrapped with the cloth which you have placed between the thighs to the sides and roll up between your right and left hands until it is gone.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And take care that you do not puncture the skin with the incision, so that the fat does not escape and remove that which has escaped already
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	If you do not see the humors coming out at the beginning of the incision, then make a small opening in the incision so that the humors can escape; and extract that which we have mentioned above.  Then wash the area with vinegar and wine vinegar and put a bandage over the area and leave it closed for a while.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so when it has dried, sprinkle salt on it and leave it in the hollow of the incision so that the remainder of that swelling is absorbed
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And care for that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if after the process there is a wound on the hand, then care for that with oiled patches until it is healed

De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	The methods of treatment for this foot-ache.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the humors of the feet become natural and cease to be painful, the time has come to consider the natural methods of treatment and those which have been used in the past, for tears, baths, and rubbing of the feet and oil within can be causes of the destruction of the humors that must be treated in four ways: by cautery; or with acute medicine as is said in the chapter of cautery; or by incision and suture; or by leech as I shall say

Therefore keep the head of the patient towards the navel; then convert the upper eyelid with your left hand, and if it is converted, well and good; otherwise enter the needle into that part where it is firm of the departure of the eyelid, and make it penetrate deeply, and when it is thus — close to the margin of the eyelid where the eyelashes arise — close the eyelashes, and convert that to the line.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt. De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	The swelling of the joints from cold humors is acute when the foot is affected.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil. E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And finally withdraw your hand when the bone is well out of its unnatural position and reposes over the fat, over the natural bone

And so be attentive to the sight of the foot, because when the fat has been cauterized and the bone has been placed back, the wound will swell and cause some groaning and itching of the foot, and let it close for two days or three, until the bone adheres to the surrounding flesh and rises over the good bone.

If the wound is less severe, then adjust the natural bone to the same length as before, and elevate it so that it is slightly longer, or that you let it rest until it has regained its normal length, and then elevate it once more.

Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz. De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	About the incision of the nail and the eminence of the caruncles of the lacrimals
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Wisely observe that the nail is divided into two ways, so that either it is nervous, resembling a hard, soft sponge; or it is non-nervous, resembling white moisture solidified, which when you touch it, or force it to take hold with the nail, is detached and the nail is not fixed in it

The manner of working in the incision of these is such that the patient should keep his head still in the pit if possible, and place your hand on his heels, and elevate the lash with your hand, and collect the nail with the nail clipper with little duplication and extend that to the surrounding areas
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla. De reduccio de arizati al nas.	For the reduction of ear cartilage to the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you treat ear cartilage with cautery or acute medicine and it does not heal according to the narration, do not be afraid of incisions but make incisions on the edges of the wound to uncover the maturity of the tissue, and extract all the moisture that is in it until the bone is revealed
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And thus when the bone is revealed and sometimes in its corruption or blackness, then you should grasp it with a clamp of this kind:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	This is called coarse forceps, and is made without handles, and has a round head like a needle pierced with holes for puncture by needles or by awls (as it is in the following form).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And rest that part over the corrupted part of the bone, and with your thumb and fingers press gently until you see that that corruption is gone.

Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Therefore if the limb is consolidated and there is good flesh in it and the wound is closed and the limb is kept for forty days, and it is not renewed and is not washed and there is no accident, you know that it is healed

Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	The triangular part of the instrument is placed over the limb as sometimes in this way

De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Of the reduction of the prominence of the head
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils. E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the way of the herbs is that you take lion’s mane cloth and each fold is doubled four times; make of these folds

De curacio de alconati.	Treatment of colic pain.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This ailment which is called colic is nothing but a spasm which is adjusted in the gut like descending water and is not that.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	More useful is the work of the servant who makes the pain lie on the saddle-shaped prominence and grasps it with two hands and that one which enters sees that the pain remains behind, and let it dry and do not let it go down, and keep it firm, for the pain sees its remedy just as before.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not go down, know that it is water
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	More if it is not prepared for the descent of the pain as we have said, for then make the pain lie between your knees and take a spatula and burn that over the caruncle that is between the continuation of the conjunctiva and the cornea in the crown (in the middle of the eye), so that the pain is expelled.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Therefore when it is expelled, then take cold water in which you have mixed honey or water in which you have already boiled fennel and honey.

De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Treatment of descending water from the gut
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said the species of water in the division and what is necessary to perforate it as we have declared

E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And with your right hand take vinegar, if the water is left; or with your left hand if the water is right.

E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And then penetrate the albumin of the eye and sit that the vinegar has already arrived because of the weight.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And keep that the measure of the limb of vinegar to the pupil is equal to the measure of the space from the pupil to the end of the black of the eye, which is the crown of the eye; so that you see through that pupil with the vision of the eye for the clarity of the cornea tunica
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel. Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	The greatest part of those who are from our time pause over that which has been eaten with bread and broth.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	If you do not obey your medicine at the entrance of the heel due to its hardness — for some men whose heel is hard like a stone —, then you must take for it the sponge which is called alberid, for this is its form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	Therefore prick in that joint, and do not remove your hand from the wound, and do not do so until the medicine has reached the bone marrow
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then introduce the medicine as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And you must praise your work, whether you prepare the patient for sleep by making them lie down in a dim-lit room, and prohibit any movement.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And rest in the nature of things so that its nature is calmed, and do not make them move from the place where they are burnt or towards the side where they are not burnt
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And the dressing should be according to its disposition within three days.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then remove that from the dim-lit room and expel the cold sight, and do some things for it, and then return the dressing within seven days.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And do not make them do anything during the time of treatment or at any other time
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	There must be some nourishment for them so that the water does not irritate them greatly and fiercely in respect of their custom

And if the crisis subsides after the cautery, then you must remove the heel for seven days, and rectify that which was caused by the crisis which appeared after the cautery.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you will see their face and rest over their oral cavity for which reason you must regulate their food for several days, because they exist in the dim-lit room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And do the same with that dim-lit room gradually and speak to them about their causes
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in no way is the disciple of vision excused for some herbs, and when you are sitting above the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has already reached us from some of those who are learned, and some have said that fire is applied to the radix of the magdala which is pierced by the needle from which the water is sucked up.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	However, we have not seen in our land anything like this, nor have we read of anything like this among the free men of the ancients; and it is possible that this is new
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	These are the forms of magdalans so that whoever does not know those will be about those:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they can be made of lead or iron properly, and their extremities should be like this triangular shape, with the acute angle like this.</start_of_turn>
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter XXV.</start_of_turn>
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the care of wounds nothing new has been said.</start_of_turn
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When there are various wounds which have arisen together whose cause is not known, and which resemble a scorpion's tail or many heads of a serpent; and this disease is called polipus which is like that head which is represented.</start_of_turn
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And it is a foul wound, ulcerous, of yellow color; and it is not like that of a lion but of a tawny color.</start_of_turn
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in those wounds which are neither fraudulent nor cancerous, you must make the patient lie between your thighs and place him in the sun, and uncover the parts of the wound, and prick them once in those wounds.</start_of_turn
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that from the other parts, and then cauterize what you have understood of those with the pointed cautery until you know that all the wound has been evacuated; for if there remains any cause of the abscess which is possible, then you must repeat the cautery until no cause remains.</start_of_turn
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	However, if the master suffers from a wound or crisis after the cautery, then you must stop for him; or if it is a malignant abscess, you must cover it and cauterize until it is evacuated and all the cavities are healed.</start_of_turn
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And do the same with the wound in the nose, with vinegar or wine or both.</start_of_turn
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	However, if the nose is opened and humidity proceeds into the palate, then you know that it is already healed.</start_of_turn
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	If the humidity does not penetrate as far as the covering, then you must know that it is not in the pus surrounding bones that the disease originates, but rather in the parts that have not received any nourishment.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore you must cover that area faithfully where any swelling exists, do not move it, and leave between each part the quantity of liquid or medicine that is necessary. Then you must apply the illness and introduce a limb of the body into the area where there is pain or for another cause which makes it possible
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And when that has happened, that is to say when the odor has vanished from the channels of the nerves, and when it appears on the surface of the skin, troops that are going in this way resemble the girls at school, and it is a light cause of this which makes people do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	Then take two limbs of the body, one that goes over the nose and the other that remains in the nose, and give support to the bones that are in the limb, and do this until you know that the bones are already in the limb itself
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	Then withdraw the limb, and leave in the nose the abstraction of the saint with a bandage, and do this for three days or more until the ulcer has healed all the damage that was done to the flesh
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of the treatment, leave in the nose a lead cannula for several days until it is healed.</start_of_turn>
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	If you finish the treatment, use this one too.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	This is the way the instrument for capturing vapor is made, which is used to distill oils and medicines into the nerves.</start_of_turn>
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make it of silver or of gold, which is similar to a small lamp with a wick, like a little candle, and the meat should resemble something like that.</start_of_turn
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas. Capitol .xxv.	End of treatment.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	From their stays in the limbs of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	The girls who are going in like this are naturally stupid in the limbs of the nose, and this is magnified and praised for several days until it is finally cured as regards them.</start_of_turn

E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And so pause over the wound or cautery or medicine that is in the place of it.</start_of_turn

And even if it is delayed until it is magnified, know that it must be considered if it is watery, dark, of a brown color and with little sensation; for girls who are going in like this will do great harm to him on account of his great malice towards the one to whom this has happened.</start_of_turn

Capitol .xxvi.	End of treatment.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of suture of the nose and of the lips and of the ear when the continuity is dissolved by plague or by similarity.</start_of_turn

Therefore, when you must do something for some cause of these, know that you must consider if it is fresh plague on the skin and that you must adjust the two lips of the plague with a suture, and take care of that until it is healed.</start_of_turn

And so adjust the two lips towards the suture and tighten those, and upon those sprinkle holy chalk and sprinkle three times, and place over the chalk a pad of plaster of Paris, or of some other firm plaster, and leave that for two days or three, and then remove that and exchange it for another, and leave that until the wounds are healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	May the manner of the suture be that you add the solution of continuity or with needles as we have recommended in the suture of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with a thread as well as you do and make known.

Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII

Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of the reason for teeth with iron.</start_turn><end_turn>
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth in the parts around the teeth and those of the cheek and between the gums are adjusted rough scales, legs, and some are black and are faytas citrinas or vertiginous until the gum sees for what corruption is made and the teeth become loose.</start_turn><end_turn
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore you must remove the evil between your teeth and stop their heads in the gut if necessary, and scratch the teeth in which these scales appear and which cause a resemblance to sand until no harmful cause remains, and what causes the blackness and the citrine color and the others that remain must be modified.</start_turn><end_turn
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore if it is not at the end of the reason that remains, do not do it; but if so, when you have repeated the reason three times in the morning and evening and afternoon until it comes to the fourth time that you wish.</start_turn><end_turn
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have required various forms of support and figures according to how you prepare for your operation.</start_turn><end_turn
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And so that the razor with which the tooth is shaved from the part around the teeth is different from the razor with which it is shaved between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of shaving must be prepared by you which you will see for the most part.</start_turn><end_turn
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of the extirpation of teeth.</start_turn><end_turn
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Therefore you must care for the tooth from its pain with all ingenuity and afterwards in the total extirpation of it, for there is no cause that replaces the absence of it when it is extirpated, for it is a sublimated substance except in the extirpation of it.</start_turn><end_turn
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	Moreover, when the patient is forced to eradicate that tooth, you must certainly confirm that it is the painful tooth, for many things can deceive the patient concerning the pain and cause him to think that it is in a sound tooth, and you eradicate that and only then does the pain cease until the painful and diseased tooth is eradicated, for we have already seen concerning the operation of the barbers.</start_turn><end_turn
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore when you must confirm that it is the painful tooth, and you know well, when you have confirmed that, then cover that you scarify around the tooth with the palm of your hand in the area where there is any power, until it is dissolved from the tooth and the gum of the whole part, and take away that which is in the ties or with fine forceps from the beginning gradually until that is consumed.</start_turn><end_turn
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And so hold something firm in their force that is good for speaking or great stupor, and stop the head of the patient between the painful teeth that you must hold that do not hurt, and gently extract the tooth in the manner that you do not break that, nor does greater pain arise from it.</start_turn><end_turn
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	Therefore, if it is not forgotten, take one of those instruments and put it on all parts so as to facilitate and expedite the evacuation of the matter as it is done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	If the tooth is fractured or rotten, take care that you cover that cavity with wax and compress it with the edge of a sponge so that it is not fractured during the constriction at that point where you hold it.</end_of_turn>
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And cover excessively with sacrifice throughout the circumference of the gums and keep your hand firm so that you do not break that part and leave it divided, and return over the patient for the wickedness that is greater than the initial pain.</end_of_turn>
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And take care that you do not do what ignorant barbers often do in their fistination and boldness concerning the extirpation of their patients, for they do not administer what we have recommended. Indeed, many laxatives cause great discomfort among patients, and their causes remain hidden, or some of them, or that they extract that matter from the jaw even though many laxatives have testified of it.</end_of_turn>
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And for the extirpation of these matters, wash the mouth with warm wine or vinegar with salt.</end_of_turn>
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if blood flows from the wound to aid the process, as is often the case, take some of the bile and sprinkle it over the wound, and if you do not confirm that bile, cauterize.</end_of_turn
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps and handles that are usually useful for grasping teeth at the beginning is long handled with a broad thumb and thick, so that they do not bend when working.</end_of_turn
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And they are thus useful once as when you first begin to use them, when they are not bent, but are short handled.</end_of_turn
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they are useful of Indian steel, descending in size, and in their descending order are teeth that enter one another and expand for strong constriction, and some of them, the descending parts of these, have the shape of a heron's beak, so that it is wide and strong.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxi.	The treatise ends here.</end_of_turn>
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of the extirpation of teeth and the extraction of the bones of the fractured jaws.</end_of_turn>
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When the tooth is fractured and remains in its place for some cause, take care that you rest your hand over the area bordering for a day or two until the area is softened; and meanwhile apply an emollient or bandage to the surrounding area which is shaped like a heron's beak called ciconia or guinea fowl, using forceps of this shape.</end_of_turn
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The surrounding area is useful for biting like a lime or an apple.</end_of_turn
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey these instructions with these forceps or handles, take care that you scratch the cause and remove all the pulp, and insert the instrument that has the name of atali, which is a small lever whose shape is as follows:</end_of_turn
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And its handle is short and wide, and do not hold it too tightly so that it is not fractured.</end_of_turn
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if the root is soft, it is not necessary; otherwise, use another instrument of these shapes: the first instrument has a triangular handle of the kind in which there is any thickness.</end_of_turn
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The second instrument has a triangular handle and a wider base.</end_of_turn
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And already with this instrument you have two slopes of which this is the shape following:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And with other instruments that precede in the extraction of teeth; for in this way this instrument is useful which is similar to a large onion, and this is its shape:</end_of_turn
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	The triangular handle of the large or small kind, which is any thickness, and do not hold it too tightly so that it is not fractured.</end_of_turn
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And other precautions that must be taken with teeth and their instruments are similar to these other instruments.</end_of_turn
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	And the skilled and learned artists in this art find for themselves various means according to what they understand of the operation and the various diseases; for these are the diseases for which the ancients did not say or even suggest any proper instrument, due to the forms of various species.</end_of_turn
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the jawbone or any other bones of the mouth are fractured, or if there is pus, take care that you press firmly over that area in the place of those instruments and forceps that we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help with the grasp of which this is the shape:</end_of_turn
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let it be known in every great or small matter, and let it be bound or secured at the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until the bone is fully healed; and then restore the limb with appropriate medicines accordingly.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If in the bone is a small wound, then know that the wound of that wound and its blackness must be cured, and care for it until it is healed.

De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	About the care of prominent teeth compared to others.</start_of_turn>
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When prominent teeth do not follow their natural shape for those with a wide space between them, and especially when they are directed towards the female parts, and more towards the beloved; therefore take into consideration: if the tooth is not adjacent to another tooth, and if it is not possible to ligate or bandage it, then leave it alone; but if it is not connected to another tooth, then you will make an incision with this instrument of which this is the shape; and it is like sawing through pork, and let it be made of Indian steel of fine quality.</start_of_turn
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your incision be such as to which you will make the incision in a few days for the hardness of the tooth, and that it is not like that of other teeth.</start_of_turn
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if a prominent tooth is exposed to wear, then know that you will file it with a file of Indian steel of which this is the shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it be of Indian steel, the mark clearly; and let it be from a fine point point to avoid damaging other teeth and causing them to fall out.</start_of_turn
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And return it to its place, and care for it as much as the barbers.</start_of_turn
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if a part of a tooth is fractured and the tongue is swollen, then know that you must ligate that until the expectation of that fragment is lost and healed, and be filled so that the tongue does not swell or the word does not corrupt.</start_of_turn

De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	About the restoration of decayed teeth with gold or silver foil.</start_of_turn
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When the teeth suffer concussion and loosening due to percussion or extraction, and the patient cannot bear to eat, and you have cured it with medicinal treatments, and it has not helped, then know that the only thing that will prevent them from falling out is to cover them with gold, not with silver, for silver turns green and becomes useless in a few days, while gold never changes.</start_of_turn
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the gold be of such fineness and thickness as is appropriate to enter between the teeth; and the way to make the restoration is that you take the gold and double its width between two healthy teeth, and that it grows between two curves of the gold between two decayed teeth, or if one or two, until the fabric reaches the healthy tooth of the other side.</start_of_turn
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And repeat the process until you reach the part from which you started, and strengthen your hand with ease and knowledge until it is not decayed.</start_of_turn
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your grasp be such as to hold the gold firmly without escaping.</start_of_turn
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And let you remove the excess of the gold with forceps or pliers, and add those to the instruments in every place, and convert those and hide them between the healthy tooth and the decayed tooth, so that it does not harm the tongue.</start_of_turn
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And thus do it steadily as Rome.</start_of_turn
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	And even if it is slipped or broken, strengthen that or those with another gold in such a way at all times.</start_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the restoration of two healthy teeth and two decayed teeth, as well as when these are linked:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when you make the return of a tooth or two, almost at the same time as the extraction, and they are reduced as we have recommended, and that they remain.</start_of_turn
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And do nothing but a good craftsman and a wise man.</start_of_turn
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And many times the bones of a cow are suitable for any cause of teeth, and it is useful to them as teeth, and is placed in the place where the tooth is lacking, and is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves for a long time.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter XXXIV.</start_of_turn
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	From the beginning of the ligament which is seen on the tongue and prevents it.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which is seen on the tongue prevents it from being bitten or is natural to it which the man does not know, or it is accidental and has happened by wound which has already solidified.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation for this is that you burn the mouth of the patient, if there exists in the belly; and elevate the tongue, and then cut that ligament nerve as far as necessary until the tongue is freed from its retraction
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	May there be no hardness or fracture, and that which is standing for the consolidation of the wound, for when you have cut through the ligament and it is dissolved, the fracture will be healed.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And take care that there be no tear in the groin of the limb and that you cut here the vessels and come out blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the remnants of the incision with vinegar or wine or with cold water; and then leave the tongue loose; for this is the way which has the patient leave the tongue in any night so that it is not solidified again
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	And if there is bleeding from the blood vessels, leave the clotted blood still; but if the blood clots, then cauterize the area with the cautery which you will apply to the blood
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of the other causes until it is healed.

De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Extraction of wisdom tooth leaves the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Some wounds happen that leave the tongue stuck together resembling a small nail which hinders the natural operation of the tongue; and it is very painful until the mouth is evacuated.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation for this is that you burn the mouth of the patient sitting in front of the sun and consider the stuck tongue.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if sometimes of brown or black, hard, to which the patient does not feel any sensation, then do not touch that which is fractured

And if it is pale, in which there is humidity, then put on the thumb of your hand in the limb, and cut that which is in the spleen, and cut through it completely; and if blood clots in the hour of your operation, then leave the clotted blood still, until it is withdrawn from the blood

De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Extraction of wisdom tooth from two angles and that which is nothing in the jaw and from the other wisdom teeth.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When inflammation occurs in the jaw it is because the glands which are together are obstructed, which causes two angles to be deformed and are not nourished by two wisdom teeth, which when you cure them with water as we have said in the division and it is not healed, then you consider if the wisdom tooth is hard, of brown color, with little sensation, for do not touch that which is fractured
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of black color and the root is large, then do not touch that which is fractured for the flow of blood; better leave it alone, or you will tear that, or it will break by itself
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is pale, red, and the root is thin, then that which must be cut must be covered with an incision.

Thus when you have promised that to the patient and he has shown you the wisdom tooth, and you have placed your hand on that which is in the belly, then take hold of the thumb and leave that in the wound, and pull that away from the margins as much as you can.

e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut. If this instrument is not at your disposal, it is sufficient to note that the cause of this disease is that its shape is like that of a spear: acute at one end, blunt at the other.

Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is a flow of urine, guard urine from decoction of millet or marigold flowers and remain as close as possible to the aforementioned causes until the flow of urine is restricted, and then care for the healthy one.</end_turn>

And every other plant that grows in the ground, others after these two herbs, and note those according to how you saw and said at the incision of two wounds that touch each other.</end_turn>
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have already treated a woman who was lying in the field of this plant, who had a swelling that tended to a dark color, with little feeling, which had already closed the field of this plant, and the woman breathed with great difficulty, and I had already forbidden her to eat and drink water, and she was on the verge of death if more water had not been given for a day or two.</end_turn>

Therefore I treated her surgically and remained by her side, and I pulled out the one that was causing her great pain, and I threw out a large part of it, and I opened the other tooth that was causing her pain, and I compressed her tongue, and I kept her mouth closed by the side of that swelling.</end_turn

Therefore I went with her and cauterized her field, so that she did not become addicted; and I went away and did not know until later that she had died from that.</end_turn

De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	When a wound is infected and inflamed.</end_turn>
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the wound is covered with pus, and is swollen and long, it is not called perpendicular; and if it is in the lower part large and round, and it is called buba.</end_turn
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	If it is cured with the water that we have said in the division, and you do not neglect your care, sometimes the swelling will go away of itself and will become subtle; in that case you should leave that which has been added round; but if it is of that length, and is bloody, dark in color or black, and is not at the center, you must fear the incision of that, because there is fear of the patient.</end_turn
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you have seen that according to the method that I have said to you concerning its whiteness and length, that the patient is well and has relaxed the tongue of the instrument which she has used to process her shape, and that she has left the mark on the new one in its place, throw that away and incites that one with two instruments which I have mentioned at the incision of two wounds.</end_turn
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And keep that you do not incite that except when it is adjusted according to the natural term of its addiction, because if you incite it more, you will cause her to suffer.</end_turn
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And at the incision, use the water which we have recommended at the incision of two wounds, and care for that one until it is healthy.</end_turn
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the patient is frightened by the incision, keep that the cautery of the instrument is only with acute water, and that you hold the patient’s head down, and with that hand hold the tongue of the patient with the instrument that I mentioned, and take some water that I have mentioned in the chapter of cautery, and comfort her with that, and do not make it thick or subtle, and fill the cavity of the instrument that has that shape.</end_turn
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Just as the curvature of the medicine is stopped in the same way as the curvature of the heel of a ray, and put the instrument with the medicine on the nail, the patient will lick over her lips so that she will secrete saliva or mucus from the mouth of that medicine, so that it does not remain from that cause on the field of her nails and that she removes it.</end_turn
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And put your hand on the medicine and press that on the uvula for about an hour until it is softened and softened by the biting of the medicine.</end_turn
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	If you wish, take a portion of the affected limb and wrap it around the extremity of the ray. Submerge the portion in medicine and enter the ray into a tube over which the portion adheres, and do so until you have achieved as much as you can from the cauterization of the stone. Then let that which has been leached dry and fall away in approximately three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	If you are unable to achieve the desired result, repeat the application of the medicine. Then remove the cauterization from the circumference of the stone, and moisten that part which is in the circumference of the medicine, and wash it with cold water, and heal with ointment, and leave it treated with salves until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	This method of treatment is more effective than the beginning and of longer duration.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some herbs are cured by that which is more subtle than cautery and more soothing, which is cured by fumigation in this way: take cinnamon, rue, origanum, rosemary, Arabic gums, chamomile, barley and others similar to those herbs, and mix them all together, or some of them, in a bowl. Soak them in strong vinegar and water; let the vinegar be sufficient to moisten the herbs without diluting them too much. Place the herbs on the middle of the bowl and put an instrument with teeth on it over them according to this manner; make it of silver or metal.</end_of_turn>
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And put the extremity into the mouth of the patient until the vapor reaches the stone above the tonsil, until the stone is no longer opaque.</end_of_turn>
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And repeat the procedure over the swelling until it is dry. Keep in mind that this treatment should not be administered at the beginning of an attack, because it would be too strong for the attack. Rather, you must declare the attack finished.</end_of_turn>
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	If you do not have this instrument, take a tube and apply it to the extremity of the limb for the mouth of the patient to be covered, because the closing of the tube hinders the vapor from burning the mouth.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	This treatment is good for health.</end_of_turn>

De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	From the extraction of stones and from that which adheres to the bladder and from the other causes.</end_of_turn
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	The swelling of the veins adheres to the bladder or heel or any other cause.</end_of_turn
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore cover that which you have extracted from those which are apparent, over which you cast the gaze, because you must touch the tongue with the instrument that has teeth so that it is known that that which is in the bladder has been extracted.</end_of_turn
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which is not apparent and is hidden in the bladder, cover that you must vomit the patient until the food is digested in the stomach, because that strengthens the underlying cause of the bladder if it is not evacuated by vomiting. Or that you swallow the patient once with a gulp of barley or a spoonful of radish or a spoonful of bread; or that you insert a spoonful of sponge cake soaked in oil into the patient, and bind that firmly with faith, and then expel that which is strong in the place where the stones are and are extracted, so that when it is expelled the cause of the stone is expelled.</end_of_turn
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And take a hook and hold it firmly bound, and extract it from the mouth. Or take a thumb and hold the root and the root is extracted.

E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be thicker than ray a small one, and in the extremity of the limb let there be a cavity into which you will insert it easily.</end_of_turn
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And the patient should hold his breath, and keep your hands away from the throat, so that you do not damage the throat or the bone or that the physician puts his hand there.</end_of_turn
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	Therefore if the patient vomits excessively, for his knowledge of the location of the underlying cause and covers it in himself, he should withdraw his hand from the instrument in his mouth, as much as he is prepared to do until it is evacuated.</end_of_turn

De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of blood clots that are attached to the bladder.</end_of_turn
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When blood clots are medicated with that which has been said in the division of the treatment with medicines and do not cause discomfort, consider the time in the bladder of the patient at the sun, because you have compressed the patient’s tongue with the instrument which you have recommended.</end_of_turn
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore if at times the bloodsucker [disease] comes, extract that one little or that subtle one diligently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible to extract it [the disease], then take a curved needle and pierce it into the belly of the patient, and then place a burning iron on the curve of the needle. Make as many incisions (until the disease is dead and remains in the belly) and abstain from giving the patient anything to drink for the whole day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And prepare a basin full of cold water, open the patient's mouth with your hand, and wash the mouth with this; and do not let them swallow anything from this for a while, and massage the water an hour or two later with your hand, because the disease will subside as soon as the water cools down.</start_of_turn>
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	However if it is not forbidden by what we have recommended, then suffocate the patient with the thumb or index finger against the instruments with which we have recommended for the fumigation of the uvula.</start_of_turn>
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do thus, so that it will fall off.</start_of_turn>
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	Another way of operating in the fumigation of this is to take a sponge in which charcoal is ignited and cover the sponge with a cover in the middle of which there is a hole, and put the extremity of the instrument in that hole; and when the sponge is sufficiently burned, remove the cover from the fumigation; and place the patient's mouth at the extremity of the needle, and close their mouth so that the fumigation is not lost until you know that the fumigation has reached the disease, because the disease will subside as soon as the fumigation is complete.</start_of_turn
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if that does not happen, then repeat the fumigation many times; and abstain the patient from drinking, and feed them salt and other foods, and do not give them water, and if necessary, remove this regimen.</start_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the form of the instrument with which the disease is treated from the belly when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps in this way as sometimes, but it has in it some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is flat against the belly, and the extremity of it is like the beak of a heron, which is hooked, in which is grasped from lime, so that when any pressure is applied, that does not slip away.</start_of_turn>
