En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the sermon concerning the opening of apostemata and the cutting of them.</start_of_turn
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Apostemata are various kinds, of various methods, as is remembered in some part of this book.</start_of_turn
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And there are two ways of perforating and cutting them, according to two methods: one for the kind of apostemata that are in the middle; and for what is pressed from the humors.</start_of_turn
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is proper for the places where the diseases of the body happen, because the apostemata that happen in the head are different from the apostemata that happen in the buttocks; and the apostemata that happen in the fleshy parts are different from the apostemata that happen in the joints; and each one of them must be treated in its operation.</start_of_turn
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some apostemata that must not be perforated except in the proper time of the disease in those or alongside them.</start_of_turn
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	So other apostemata must be cut when they are crossed, and are not matured according to their complement, just as apostemata that are proper for the joints, because an apostem that is near a joint, in the sense that it is prolonged until it is poor in the circle of its parts, and strongly corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, for it is a harmful cause of contraction of that limb; or it is a simple apostem of a limb, and if you delay the perforation of it when it is mature it does no good to the limb; or it is of the buttocks, therefore pierce it only when it is not mature; and do not pierce it cruelly, except for a simple indigestion, but only that which is proper of the buttocks, so that you do not weaken the root of the limb and that it is prolonged to the lower parts of the buttocks, and that there is formed a fistula, or that it is finished in its term without being healed.</start_of_turn
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	And you must know the time of the perforation of the apostem, and this is when it is mature.</start_of_turn
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you must know that it is mature when there is the cessation of pain and fever, and alongside the decrease of swelling and pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the apostem, and the other symptoms.</start_of_turn
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you must know that the perforation must be done in the place furthest from the apostem and from where the humors come from for the care of the swelling.</start_of_turn
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And if the puncture is to be made through the length of the limb or the body, if the boils are in the parts of the toes or the feet, or in the place of cuts, nerves, or blood vessels; and finally, in all other places where there is no reflection; in those where there is reflection, use puncture according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	When the boil is in a fleshy place, then let the puncture be delayed until digestion has taken place according to custom, as we have said; for if you puncture before that, you prolong the suffering of the limb and cause more pain, and you toughen the edges of the wound and its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	When any boils are to be punctured, do so according to the breadth of the limb or the body as is necessary, or according to what each member digests.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And let you know that you must administer a small puncture, in large boils great puncture and wide or many sections according to the variety of the size of the boils.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are of boils in which you must make the incision concave and closed, when it is necessary as when it is in the groin or in the armpits, as in the case of boils that occur in the groin or armpits.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised with a section having three angles; and of those that are incised as a leaf of ivy, as the boils of the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those that are punctured with round section and lunar section, and they resemble the latter two
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	When those to whom it is not possible to make such puncture as are superficial boils, know that you must puncture them only superficially, or plane simply.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And know that when the boil is large and has collected much pus, that you must puncture it and do not hesitate to extract all of its contents at that time; having extracted a part, and having placed the boil back inside the other day, and having extracted a greater part the next day, and doing this until the swelling has gone down.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And more so if the patient is of cold temperament, or lean, or a small child, or an old man in decrepitude, for the animal spirit is resolved with the discharge of the pus, and you will find that the patient is better, and you will have done your duty
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Keep this chapter with great caution, and take great care when you puncture these boils, because you must extract the plagues and consider therefore if the plague of the boil is small, or if it is a flat section, when you administer which of the two or neither; and if the boil is large, and the wounds of the puncture are numerous, know that you must wait patiently in any case until they heal together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the boil a part of the cord or has concaved that in the circumference, know that you must bandage it with old cloth or thread of silk, as when you treat wounds or burnings, so that the moisture may be absorbed; and leave it on for the third day; and process it again and care for it until the inflammation has gone away
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	And if flux of pus occurs at the time of your operation, know that you must administer cold water and vinegar in which you have dissolved a little of alum, and place that over the area of the flux of pus until the swelling has gone down
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	And if the flux of pus persists, know that you must administer treatment and care and powders that I have recommended in many other places of this our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	And if it is wintertime, and the place of the boil is a place of many nerves, know that you must cover it with wine and oil caut, and place those over the place.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer, and the places are fleshy, know that you must apply powders moistened with water and oil or with wine and oil, and keep it wet until the third day, as we have said, and then take out the boil and extract the pus and administer its care until it is healed

This is what is necessary for the knowledge of the care of boils universally, more especially according to the way of distinguishing which I have already said concerning every boil in what way it should be treated according to the chapters singly.

De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the incision of boils which occur in the cord of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the cord of the head small boils, and of various sizes which contain tunics that are their substance; and the various sizes of them are numerous
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And of these there are vesicles, and those that contain moisture resembling slime
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And these are the ones that contain moisture similar to pus, and resembling them; and these are the ones that are soft, slippery.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	In all sections, and in the extraction of these, there is no fear, as you must know the extension of these does not cause harm to the bowels.</end_of_turn>

The operation in the section of these is that you cut them with an instrument of the shape you see, which is called between them, until you know that they contain.</end_of_turn
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what is contained is moisture, then split that at the section according to the length section by section in this way:</end_turn
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa. When the moisture is evacuated, then you will scrape away that which contains that moisture, and do not leave any cause of this, for if there remains from any cause, the troops will return.</end_turn
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula. Then the plague will be cured when it is healed.</end_turn

am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the shape of a cross, and grasp two lips of the section and extract that from all around, and exert your power in the extraction of the membrane which contains that.</end_turn
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	May it be that your incision causes harm, for I will tell you immediately.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And thus do in the soft swelling of the section and in the care; as I have told you. The section over the soft swelling is lighter, because it has little sand and little moisture.</end_turn
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And many of these swellings are like these that are in the head of many households with those whom there is no moisture; for I have not seen it applied to an old woman's swelling and I have smeared the swelling like gypsum, as white as stone, rough, blunt, which could not be squeezed out, and if there be any of those in this, plague that.</end_turn></end_of_turn>
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial. De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section of scrofulas that happen in the groin.</end_turn>
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These swellings are accompanied by these boils in the groin and in the buttocks and in the armpits; and some are caused in other parts of the body.</end_turn

Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the limb is severed.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	When the limb is severed.

De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of excision of the pillar of the heel in an accident where the gout has penetrated.</end_of_turn>
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	Say that this excision is done in the heel, and no man in our land has ever had success with it.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	This is the inscription of the sermon of these things.</end_of_turn
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	May in the women there be no spasm, cover that the extraction of the heel is avoided, as it is not of any use for the salvation of all the veins and the greater part of the disease is here.</end_of_turn
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	May in those who have apostemas caused in the mouth or in the heel or two nails, when the disease is not in the bone, cover to use the excision of the heel to escape the loss which is of benefit for perforation.</end_of_turn

And so we cover that when we want to, let them lance the heel leaving three circles of the circle of the heel, or four on the small side of the section for the width in those who are between two circles in quantity, that the section be in cartilage, not in bone, and this place is convenient for section, because it is private of flesh and the vessels of the limb are loosened.</end_of_turn
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is clumsy, cover that he extends the Achilles tendon to its origin, and then cut the tendon until it reaches the canal, but avoid the vessels of the limb if you see any cause of that.</end_of_turn
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And so make the incision according to what we have recommended; and it is significant about the section of the canal for the inflammation which is of that which is said to be broken with water and for the abortion of the voice.</end_of_turn

E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And behold Albucasis that the sum of the sermon which we have recommended, exposure is nothing but to see that among these apostemas already have opilated the heel of the disease, and the disease is overcome within death, and the blood is separated from it, and these go to infect the epiglottis so that the disease is saved from death over the place of the wound for every breath, and is saved from death.</end_of_turn
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this we command to leave the wound open until the malice of the disease is consumed; and the malice of it is for three days; and therefore we command you to close the wound when it is healed, and care for that until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen for my part is that a servant brought a bowl and poured it onto the heel of the foot and lanced into that part of the canal of the lung, and I was called to care for it, and I covered the mucus in the same way as it is emitted from the dead, and I uncovered the wound and covered the limb with the hand that was injured by the wound little.</end>

E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	I did not harm the servant if he did not murmur, and indeed on the contrary on the following days he returned to better health
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the epiglottis there is no fear.

De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the section about the apostema which happens in the outer golay, and is called an external hernia of the golay.</end_of_turn>

E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural it is not useful to cure.</end_of_turn

De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the section of the species of nodes.</end_of_turn
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the nodes there are many species, and I have already mentioned all the species in the division.</end_of_turn

Therefore I say that an extrusion is characterized by heat, fever, and severe pain until the inflammation of the superfluous fluid has subsided; and it is completed by decomposition when the fever, the pain, and the heat cease.</end_of_turn
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a node is neither heat nor fever nor pain, and contains that thick liquid which is in the belly or sac itself.</end_of_turn

And this is a method of inquiry of apostemas and all nodes, that you take hold of that discomfort and bring that which is in the cavity of the apostema to the most humid place that you find in it, and you will remove the strings which you see until you believe that the discomfort has already penetrated the cord.</end_of_turn

These are the forms of the scalpels with which the nodes and abscesses are cut and scorched, and there are three kinds, of which one is large, one is medium, and one is small.
Forma de scapel gran:	Large-sized scalpel form
Forma del scapel migier:	Medium-sized scalpel form
Forma de scapel pauc:	Small-sized scalpel form
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The extremities of those upon which the cut is made are acute, while the others are not acute, and are not to be grasped in such a manner, but rather because it is useful for the excision of the nodes in order to avoid injuring a vein or nerve, and for those it is healthy for the patient and brings tranquility when bringing about the excision of the abscess.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	These are the forms of dressings, and there are three kinds: large, medium, and small, just like veyras.
La forma de magda gran:	Large-sized dressing form
Forma de magda migier:	Medium-sized dressing form
Forma de magda pauc:	Small-sized dressing form
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made of silk and resemble a ray of the kind from which alcohol is made.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And in the extremity where the puncture is made with the sponge covered with cotton wool, and in that which goes to the joints above and below, when you wish, just like you see
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The forms of sponges, which are hidden between the fingers should cover the perforation of the abscesses and not be perceived by the patient, and there are three kinds: large, medium, and small
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	These are the forms of those things:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The forms of fans with which the flow of air is broken, and there are three kinds: large, medium, and small; the forms of these are:
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made of citrus silk, round with some length, and are subtle
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And cover that these kinds of fans are to be brought before you, large, medium, and small, so that by them the flow of air is broken with speed when necessary, and when you first of all do not need it for medicine
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	But do not use them to break the air in all parts of the body, and do not use them except in fleshy places, such as in the cuts of the limbs and the joints, in the cuts of the ribs, and of the breasts, and of the belly and the armpits, and resembling the cuts of the fleshy humps

And many herbs are useful for those instruments and other small things resembling fish scales according to this form; for which the air is broken when it is useful for phlebotomy, or for puncture of a vein or artery
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And many herbs are useful which are round according to this form:

De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the care of the breasts of men which are composed of women
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some herbs cause the breasts of young men to swell due to their sleep when they begin to become pale, and so they swell the breasts and unite the breasts of women, and remain apostemous, leaving.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And to that one who is tormented by this, cover that it is to be incised with a lunar incision according to this form, from the line of B to the line of G, and remove the whole lump, and replace the wound with a plaster of medicinal ointment, and adjust the two edges of the wound with sutures, and care for that which is within that it should be healed
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. More so if the breast leans downwards towards the lower parts and is softened by its magnitude just as it does in women, the hour it is to be cut in two lateral seams more spacious, with two cuts resembling a lunar shape, of which each one contains the other one at the end of each one, until the greater line contains the smaller one according to this form of the line of B and the line of G. And remove the cord which is between two edges of the wound, and keep the swelling, and administer what has been said concerning the suture and the powders that are necessary for the care until it is healed

And if you do not comply with the incision of that which you cover to be incised because of the discomfort of the patient, and for the flow of air, cover that you place the plaster of ointment completely submerged in corrosive ointment and leave that which is within until that which is corroded is removed of the fat, and care for that which is within until it is healed

Capitol .xlix.	Capital xlix
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	From the incision of abscesses that occur by strangulation or by a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When the artery is broken, and the cord is consolidated which is above that, then the veins are seen gaping open that accompany the abscess. It is known that inflammation and abscesses are caused by an artery or vein: for when the abscess is caused by strangulation, it is long associated with the groin of the body; and when it is caused by a vein, sitting in them where there is stridor
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is caused by a vein returns to the manifestation of the body
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the incision of this abscess is wrong, especially in those who leave the hairs, and in the armpits, and in the groin, and in many parts of the body; and it is not great, therefore cover that its treatment with iron should be avoided, and that which is in the limbs, or at the head, should be avoided
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But concerning that which is from the inflammation of the orifice of the artery, divide the cord with a section in the long; and immediately cover the section with a bandage and the artery, and deliver from the tunics until it is uncovered
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And immediately put on that needle and make that penetrate from one side to the other, and open the artery with a firm double in two places, — which causes and makes you see two arteries that are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And immediately put on that needle and make that penetrate between two ligaments with space until the wound is healed throughout, and dissolve the abscess
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And immediately administer treatment in which is engendered poor blood until the ligaments fall away; and immediately treat that with oil as is convenient until it is healed
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if the abscess is caused by a vein, then cover that you have with your hand over the abscess with the cord, and immediately insert the needle where you left your hand, and make that penetrate; and be in that fold double until you extract that from the other side, and immediately ligate the abscess with good thread as I have said above.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that you will extract the thread, then immediately insert the thread with that needle from the beginning of the abscess, and strengthen the ties in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	And immediately dry the abscess in the middle of it until when it is finished there, then you will cut away the surplus of the cord, and leave only what is bound.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And immediately stop over the powder which you have soaked in wine and oil, and immediately administer the treatment which is useful with warm compresses and oil until it is healed
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Capital l of the abscess which occurs for the twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as it occurs in an abscess in an artery and in a vein, and in the same way it occurs in nerves when it occurs in their percussion or occurs by excessive work, and for the same reason.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is more useful in the places of the attendants or the heel, or in any place where there are inflamed joints
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And the abscess is hard, and is like the color of the rest of the body, and is in the greatest of its abundance when it is stretched with great force, sitting in the wound like a stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not associated with the groin of the body, and for so it is left open, and is more painful at all parts and does not go to the preceding or following parts
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, when these humors that are in the joints are not covered with iron, they cause a strong contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	If they are in the head or on the forehead, they cause the hair to split.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If there is little pus, then cauterize them and remove that which is from the root.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is great, then suspend it with oil, and extract that, and then apply that; and suture the wound, and care for that until it is healed.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	This refers to the swelling of the belly that happens when the spleen is cut.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	In general, fat people with veins that are swollen in the belly and in other parts of the body of those who are affected by this, are likened to fungi because of their shape, because their root is subtle and their head is big; and their lips are contracted, and it is of those that are little, and it is of those that are not magnificent.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz. And the operation in the incision of these people is that you consider if the disease is humid or dry, and if the color of the blood is white, humid, or of subtle root; then you must cauterize with a spatula, and when the fat that is in the belly is expelled, do not leave any residue; and if you see that it is healed, cauterize that area.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if sometimes the disease is slight and fearful, do not make an incision with iron; rather wait for a recent scab to form, and strengthen that blood, which is the kind that we have mentioned; and let that alone for two days.

And adjust the stricture of the thread of the scab; therefore, do not cease strengthening the scab greatly until it has detached and fallen off by itself

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the care of great importance of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The great importance of the navel is useful for many causes; or for cracks of the sac which is over the belly, and these are covered with the cloth or the gut according to what is necessary in other ruptures; or for healing which flows from veins or from intestines as it is said, or for wind that is restricted in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is for a crack of the sac and for vomiting of the cloth, the color of the pus is similar to the color of the body; and it is painful, and it appears in various positions
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	If it is for the evacuation of the gut, the position of that which we have mentioned above is more diverse, and as you have previously said concerning those who have mentioned that it is hidden, and it returns; and it is strong in that area so that it is magnificent without exceeding the introduction of bath and violent work
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is for humidity, it is painful and is not hidden when you put your hand on it, nor is it constricted, nor is it swollen
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is for healing, the pus appears black and declining.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	If it is for nothing, the pus is difficult, thick and hard, and is fixed according to a quantity
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	If it is for wind, the touch of it is painful
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	The operation is such that if the swelling of the navel threatens to burst from an artery, or a vein, or from wind, you must refrain from its cure, for in such a case fear and pain are imminent as you have been taught in the chapter where I spoke of the aftercare for an artery and a vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	If the swelling of the navel threatens the intestines or the skin, then command the patient to sit upright; and place your hand around the navel circuit and command him to lie down between your thighs, and surround the area around the navel with a broad strip of linen; then extend the major part of the incision downwards to the groin; and join in the circuit with a strong suture or a needle and thread of good quality.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Then bring the edges of the incision together over the ligament and insert the needle there and downwards again at the point where you desire to hold the intestine; if you have not found or retained the ligament, then extract the excoriated tissue and push the intestine into the depths of the abdomen
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	If you have found the skin, take hold of it with one hand; and cut away the excess of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	May it be contrary to your artery or vein, then surround that part and return to your operation; take two needles and make two strong holes in those two fields and insert two needles into the circuit that you have made around the incision in the manner of a cross, which shall pierce; and strengthen the incision in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Or if you wish, keep the needles in and release the extended part until it collapses on its own; or cut that when it is slight and let it go, and care for that which covers the intestines until it is healed
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	If the swelling of the navel is of fatty substance in it or for moisture, then command to uncover the incision as we have said and extract the fat or moisture which you find in it, and care for that which covers and consolidates the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 63.</end_of_turn>
De curacio de cranc.	Of the care of a wound.</end_of_turn>
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said in the division concerning the nature of wounds and how to treat them with medicines, and that it is dangerous to treat them with iron so that they are not ulcerated; and we have said that wounds are engendered in the marrow and must be treated with care.</end_of_turn>
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients say that certain ulcers never disappear from their place, especially those that are in the armpits or in the groin and in the limbs where it is necessary to remove all that is within, and more so when they are beginning small.</end_of_turn

De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the upbringing of children and the care of what happens to those who undergo circumcision

De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the care of retained urine in the bladder.</start_of_turn
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by fullness due to stones, sand or gravel, or poverty or meat, and is similar to those we have mentioned regarding the methods of treatment in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	If the urine is not dissolved, and the retention is due to stones which are already in the bladder, the patient must be encouraged to walk around with a support under their buttocks
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And immediately place the foot of the patient on the buttocks and extend the knee of the limb further downwards from the buttocks, and the patient should strain the limb as much as possible
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, when the bladder is strained, the stone is forced out to the back, because the urine is expelled.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved by the methods we have mentioned, the cause of the patient’s suffering is the stone, therefore you must administer the extraction of it with an instrument called a siringua, which is like this: made of silver or gold, like a needle with a long body resembling a palm tree, to which is attached a tube of the same material at the top.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	The method for extracting the urine is as follows: grasp the bladder with a folded sheet and bind it at the waist with a good knot; introduce the instrument through the opening of the bladder and remove any foreign bodies that may exist. Then insert the catheter into the neck of the bladder with force. Finally, tighten the bladder around the catheter and an album of urine
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient sit on the edge of the bed, and bandage the bladder with a soft cloth and oil of olive and vinegar.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And immediately insert the catheter through the opening of the bladder until it reaches the root of the bladder; then bend the bladder downwards from the navel; then pull out the catheter gently; and finally insert the catheter until it reaches the bladder, and the patient will be relieved of the pain, and this will not be in vain according to this order, but in the meat in which there is pain
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And gradually withdraw the catheter with the urine following the thread
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then evacuate the catheter and perform urinary care, and use a siringua, do not stop until the bladder is empty and the patient experiences relief from the pain

De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of what quality should be the irrigation of the bladder with a clamp and what instruments should be used that are appropriate for this purpose
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there is an ulcer or swelling in the bladder, or gravel, or if it is coarsened by poverty, and you want to drain urine and medicines, then it is appropriate to use a clamp, which is like this:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	But if it is deaf in the limb, so it is closed
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And there are three veins: two from one side, thus two times
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning is the bladder, which is filled with water, and according to the quantity that fills that, so much is added, until when any cause is removed from that, that is, when the humidity is evacuated, whether it is by vomiting or by diarrhea, and when it is expelled long, according to how much the clamp tightens that has been placed on the navel in the sea battles
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you want to expel humidity from the bladder, insert the clamp into the humidity and drain the water that is filled in those parts, because the humidity is expelled in the concavity of the clamp.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And immediately insert the clamp into the bladder according to what we have recommended in the siringua; and then pull out the clamp, because that humidity will remain in the bladder for the most part, and the patient will be relieved of that pain
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The shape of the subtle crystallization in which the bladder is crystallized, and this is the shape:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is appropriate to make it of silver or gold, of which the head is similar to a small feather, and to tie it with a thread.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And immediately take the bladder from the movement, and stop the humidity that you want to crystallize in the bladder, and immediately tie that between two strong ligatures with a doubled thread, and heat that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And immediately insert the clamp into the bladder
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And immediately put your hand over the bladder with the humidity in a descending structure until the patient feels that that humidity has already reached the bladder
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	May it be that if you do not see a bladder present, take a piece of barley and make a circle of it; and pierce that through its entirety; and then insert firmly into those tracts, even if they are revolted; and then add the circle around it as is added to the alum, because you have rested in that which you wish to expel the humors, and smell and water.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tighten that on the instrument and make it like that as you did with the bladder, and express by your hand that the humor reaches the bladder.

De extraccio de peyra.	Extraction of stones from the bladder.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stones and their care with medicines, and the difference between stones engendered in the humors and stones engendered in the bladder, and we shall tell you of these.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the stone in which cathes operation is made by me, and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone engendered in the bladder itself is that which is fixed in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And thus I have narrated that which is exhibition and abreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore I say that the stone which is engendered in the greater bladder mostly appears in children; and of its signs is that the urine which comes out of the bladder is similar to water in its thinness, and appears on that sand; and the patient has frequent pain in his belly, and spotted vomit, and he is pale; and in that water lies the root of the stone.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is strange the healing of children of that which have reached thirteen years; and the treatment is difficult for the old ones.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	Better in the young than in the old because it is between these two
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that of which the stone is greater and the treatment is easier; and if it is little, it is contrary to that
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore when we come to the treatment of that, cover at the beginning of that which I have mentioned before that we will modify the pain by making an incision through which we will extract the whole of that which is in the belly; for that incision many times causes vomit which hinders the inquiry of the stone
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And thus be present the pain in the belly and the feet and be counted and make vomit again so that the stone descends to the bottom of the bladder, or that it jumps from its place a few times
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And thus do that which is between your hands prepared, and the most of them will leave the cushions of their legs, so that the whole bladder may be made to fall down to the flanks of the flanks
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And thus require that and all that which surrounds it.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore if you feel the stone in the space, the hour you will cover it so much by incision over it
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not catch it all of a sudden, the hour you touch it with oil you will say with the left hand, if the pain is in a child, or you will say little if it is an adult, and you will put that in the belly
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And require the stone until it is out of the belly
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And convert that little by little into the neck of the bladder
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And thus do on that which you have said, and expel that to the outside of the body where you saw the incision
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	Command the minister to hold the bladder with his hand; and command another minister to extend with his right hand the thighs to the flanks, and with his left hand he will grasp the coccyx which is left by the thighs, in the part where the incision is made
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And thus insert the sponge be incidental of which this is the shape of them:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And split it in them in the water which is between the buttock and the thighs, not in the middle part, behind the left cushion; and the incision is to be made over that stone and the hand is to be held in the buttock, and the incision is to be made transversely, because the incision outside should be wide and the depth should be as much as is necessary for the quantity of stone which comes out to be as little as possible, and not more, for that which is in the buttock the stone because of the incision is pushed forward
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And you know that of the stone there is some which has angles and margins, for that its extraction is difficult because of that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that water which is like urine is round, and is made of it the lightness and beauty of it.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if it is the one from whom the angles and margins are taken, adjust it in the fissure.

And if it is not thus far removed, then command that you place your hand over that [area], or that you grasp firmly over that [area] in a decent manner, the limb from which it is thus far removed like a limb with a limb above it, and do not depart from it; or that you insert between them the instruments for bending the limb.</end_of_turn>
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	Or if you do not know how to handle it, then increase slightly the traction, and if you see blood flow, cut off [the supply] of that [poisonous matter].</end_of_turn>

Or if the foot is larger than one, then at the beginning you press your hand to the mouth of the bladder, and immediately pierce over it; and immediately press a little of the liquid there; and do the same if there are more than two [stones].</end_of_turn

De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Extraction of a stone from the kidney.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in the kidneys is rarely engendered.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	Moreover, if one sees a stone in any of these, the treatment is difficult and is prohibited by experienced doctors
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the strong kidney is verging.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	The second is that you do not find the kidney well known by the physician when it is cast, or from kidneys having malaria.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you do not find the kidney well known in this art, most especially the operation with the hand
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	The fourth is that the location of the incision concerning the stone in the kidneys is far from the location of the stone, because it indicates a pre-existing incision, and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	Moreover, if necessary you must cause it to come out by any means, the hour must be known by the physician, and it is not easily found
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	Moreover, if you are deprived of this, the hour is close to madness, or presents a mistress or a noble woman who has been injured in the faith of the kidneys, or a kidney which in this art has suffered a loss of part of the organ
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore make this presentation, and command her to do whatever you command from the inquiry about the stone until the end; the reason for which is that it regards whether the kidney is verging, the hour that she puts everything aside that you have said in her belly and wants the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore if you find this, close that and leave it aside, and the hour commands her to make an incision about that
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	Moreover if it is not verging, the hour commands the mistress to enter with all that is said in the belly of the patient and over the stone, since she puts her left hand on the bladder, and confirms that.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore if you find this, the hour commands that gradually one should pull that out from the orifice of the bladder to the lower parts until it reaches the level of the cushion.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And thus make an incision about that appendicitis of the belly that has stopped and centered the stone in that part, and do not touch the stone with your hand from that moment on
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the incision should be small at the beginning; and immediately enter around that incision, and if you feel the stone, the hour adjusts in incision according to the quantity that you know the stone will be freed from that
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the species of stones are various: for some are small and great, and yellow and rough, and long and round, and have a ramp
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore you know what species they are of them for what you signify about what you want
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of urine, adjust in the wettest part treated and keep her there for an hour until the urine is drained, and then return to your operation until the stone is freed.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And make ready from your instruments which are said in the extraction of a stone in men, so that you are helped with them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of urine, and you know that the expulsion of the urine is from the artery that is incised, the hour that you stop the powder on the location and open that up like dust and stricture descending, and do not touch anything; and leave the stone and do not extract it, for it is strong enough to kill the patient.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And take the pulse.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore when the acute pain of the urine has passed a few days, and the location is relaxed, the hour returns to your operation until the stone is freed

De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On the incision concerning an abdominal hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	An abdominal hernia is nothing but an accumulation of moisture in the white sac which is left by the knee of the genetia containing the urine, and is called a hernia
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	Every vein that comes from the root of the limb to the outermost part has its own peculiar heat, which is sometimes hot and sometimes cold; and this is the cause of the gout which we mentioned before.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	The origin of this hernia is from excessive fat which occurs on the genitals, for in these is poured out this matter, and sometimes it happens by a violent point made on the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this moisture has various colors, for its color is sometimes red or tending to orange or blood-stained, or on the contrary, black feculent, or white watery, and this is the best
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	These signs from which it is understood that this accumulation of water is there: for if it is in the white pith which we mentioned before, then its tail is rounded, declining slightly in length like a figure of water, and the genitals appear, for the moisture contains all around.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the moisture is in the root of the limb, then its tail is round at the part of the water and by this we know that it is another water
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the root of the genitals and the white pith, then we must leave it untouched
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And as for the knowledge of the color of the moisture, then you must describe the color of the moisture in the swelling along with the surrounding skin, following the shape that precedes it; and according to what is seen in the remnants of the surrounding area, judge what is its origin
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore when we come to the treatment of this matter, we must command the patient to rest if it is possible, and sometimes we must put their body under pressure
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And immediately rest on both sides about any cause a little high, and place a little cloth under them
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And immediately sit on the left side of them, and command the servant to follow the right side of them, who extends his hand to the groin as far as two palms from the root of the genitals to the part of the navel of the belly
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And immediately take hold of the foot and split the root of the genitals from the middle to the tip along the length almost to the heel.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And make the incision according to the rule equally distant from the line that should be drawn on the skin of the genitals, until it reaches the white pith including it
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And evacuate that, and observe, and take care that you do not perforate that; and evacuate your wound along with which you evacuate by part as much as possible, and write your evacuation clearly according to the quantity that is possible for you
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And immediately pierce the full pith of water with a wide perforation, and extract all the water
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And immediately separate between two layers the edges of the incision with nails, and stretch the pith outwards; and do not touch the root of the genitals including it, and insert the pith in that manner that is possible for you
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And insert it in its entirety or in pieces, and especially the two lateral margins, because if you do not carefully examine the incision of them, it is not certain that the water will not return
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	If however the water proceeds from that beyond its root at the time of your operation, when you have completed the incision of the pith, return that which has escaped, and immediately suture the two edges of the root of the genitals, and take care of it as you would of the other wounds, until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the water corrupted by another disease, then you must tie up the vessels which are its sources, and extract the water, and take care of it as we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	And if the water is gathered in two parts, it is known that there are two hernias; therefore insert that part according to what you have done to the other equally; and if you see that it is a surgical operation, then do it.</start_of_turn>

e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas. Every vein that carries this hernia artificially with cautery in the place of incision with a needle; take cautery of a subtle kind and insert it into that place where the codena of the genitals is. E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then perforate that sack, and light it until all the moisture is driven out
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque. De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Of the care of hernia which is of the gut.</end_turn>
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.
