Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Method of flebotomy with needle:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Both the needles of the same kind as these as well as sometimes, convene you to open the veins that contain apparent large blood clots, and to those which contain thick blood clots.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	Method of flebotomy by cautery
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	This flebotomy is of less breadth and of little depth, and convenies to flebotomy of subtle veins which contain thick blood clots of the citrine kind
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	The application of flebotomy to the basilica vein which is one of the three veins: which extracts the blood from the diseases which are left in the gut and the belly, and from what is left of the feet and the belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the flebotomist, when he flebotomizes that one, that he should guard well that and be over-calm in that, because if he slips and makes a puncture of the vein, he will injure the artery and blood will flow, so that he must quickly stop by cutting as if necessary.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilica does not appear to be apparent, the hour you must leave that one and move to the other, or that you seek any branch nearby; or that you flebotomize in place of it the furthest from the arm, which is also apparent; and cut that one with the flebotomy immediately as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	May it be that if you wish to perform a flebotomy of the limb, then cover beforehand the stricture of the arm that touches the area until you reach the area of the pulse; and then secure over it with a bandage; and ligate the arm and cut the vein with a curved incision as we have said; and keep that the percussion be at some distance from the area of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, when you stretch the ligament, swelling in the area that you have marked with a bandage, then know that that swelling is swelling of the artery, and therefore avoid that.</end_of_turn>
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if sometimes during the flebotomy, like urine from a child, there appears yellow fluid, know that this is the blood of the artery; and therefore keep that the hand is tightly bound over that for a long space; and another servant should hold the hand bound, and if it is cut, know that the veins have been cut; then tighten the hand and let go of that.</end_of_turn>
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the patient from the discharge of the wound, and over-treat it and do not allow anyone to touch it for several days until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	Or if the blood is not cut, and sometimes when you must not have medical attendance at this time, know that you must puncture the artery if you see it; for the limb will be contracted, and the blood will be cut; or that you take a short forceps, and grasp that, and take hold of the thumb and tighten that over the area of the vein with the stricture descending from the ligament and from the particles within until tomorrow.</end_of_turn
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	Or if the blood is cut, that is good; but if not, know that you must care for that from which the blood has drained before remembering the place of the clots that have bled out the blood.</end_of_turn>
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	The excision of the blood of the limb is difficult in many situations for the small size of the wound and the possibility of the ligament of the arm.</end_of_turn>
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	And from the jugular vein the flebotomy is useful in that it extracts the blood from the upper part of the head and from the lower part of the body; for it is composed of branches of the basilica and branches of the cephalic, as we have said.</end_of_turn
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And cover the flebotomist if there is any over-treatment in the flebotomy of the limb, for there is a nerve; and when you puncture the flebotomy and find the nerve, you will cause him to lose consciousness, and it will be difficult for him to recover, and often will not recover at all; and this nerve is often hidden from view among many people and is subtle and not shown; know that you must stop the flebotomy at the point where you saw the bleeding, and avoid the nerve with your strength.</end_of_turn
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut the vein in its length.</end_of_turn
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The advantage of the flebotomy of the cephalic vein is that it extracts the blood from the head and relieves the pains of the calves.</end_of_turn
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And take care of this in the same way, if you want the flebotomy to puncture with olive oil or with myrtle; for this is the best way of all, for it does not touch the artery or the nerve.</end_of_turn
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	And indeed you must know that you must not puncture the top of the thumb with the flebotomy, but rather seek the most sensitive place, and do not touch it, if not until you have first struck it with the percussion to see if there is any bleeding there.</end>
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	And indeed it is often the case that it is postponed in many people, when it is not performed in the first percussion, may it not be noticed in that postponement.</end>
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	And the quality of the flebotomy of that and the accidents of it must be considered in the rectification of them.</end
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first is that you must know that the flebotomy is not administered except in the conservation of health and in hope of its success and caution against the occurrence of diseases, and that it is useful to perform the flebotomy in one of the veins that are in the fold, that is: cephalic, femoral and basilica; and that it is useful to perform the flebotomy at the beginning of spring, after breakfast in the spring and autumn, and in winter almost at the time of seed increase.</end
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And it is useful to perform the flebotomy and the third day or at the first hour after three hours have passed.</end
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	When the flebotomy is administered, it must not cause discomfort or necessity at night or during the day, at any hour or at any time.</end>
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And it must not be performed before thirteen years, and a woman must not be flebotomized until after four months have passed, and the old ones must not be flebotomized who have already passed sixty years.</end
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And if someone wishes to be bled for any reason, cover that you modify the bowels beforehand with a sponge in the bladder, if there is retained blood in those, so that the veins do not draw out the surplus in the bladder bleeding, which is pushed, and that it does not harm the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	Do not let the patients be bled excessively at once, neither for sacred purposes nor for drunkenness, nor because of any illness or fever, until such time as that which remains of them is remade that which has gone out, neither illness of hydrophobia, and more than that, bleeding is not to be feared except with colic passion and vomiting, and except for the contents of the belly, and excessive drinking of wine or eating of eggs, and doing of many things which dissolve virtue, or which are corporeal or animal in nature.</end_of_turn>
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And consider carefully the composition of humors before giving food and drink, and medicines if it is possible to them.</end_of_turn>
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And enter into rest if any cause does not prohibit, or be exercised by any exercise so that the patient be subtitled.</end_of_turn
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And stop the bleeding in the feet of the day, so that it is three o’clock, as we have said.</end_of_turn>
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And take care that the foot of that be preserved on that day from all accidental animals, as well as from anger, fear, and all bodily accidents, as from work and excessive drinking and other things that may be hurtful to them.</end_of_turn
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And in his seat make present the causes by which it is customary for men to be aromatic and odoriferous and to have balms and similarities to those according to the quantity of possibility.</end_of_turn
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the bleeder on a cushion which is more firm than the cushion of that which must be bled.</end_of_turn
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And draw out the arm, and cool that with your hand the bleeder gives two or three compressions; and strengthen the ligament with a bandage and cover that with two compressions.</end_of_turn
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And be the tempering strict, for the stricture when not equal, or the stricture is too great, the hour prohibits the flow of blood; or is too soft, and the hour prohibits the body of the patient fainting.</end_of_turn
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And take the tempering, so that that which must be bled cools his hands between them before the veins swell, and is declared by the feeling.</end_of_turn
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And the bleeder take a little oil against himself properly; and then suspend the hand of the indicator over that vein, leaving the place of the wound open, for the vein escapes a little, and the percussion is settled because the vein is the one that they found thus as a string that flees beyond the bleeding, and that is filled with blood, and when the bleeding stops over that one is contracted beyond the bleeding, and the bleeder is discerned; and the bleeding does not open the vein, and if it does open, that one is stretched.</end_of_turn
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	Therefore, because the bleeder is finished and is requested in all these matters.</end>
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And in case the vein be burst in a vein, the hour is not good; and if so, repeat what you have done before, leaving that place a little, or over it with fasting, if that place is not clotted.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if that place is clotted, or the illness is spread, the hour you leave it for a day or two, and do not strengthen the bandage, because it will cause fresh clotting, nor enter into rest.</end_of_turn>
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And repeat the bleeding if necessary.</end_of_turn>
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the wound is small and the blood flows silently, and you fear that it will not be enough to save the quantity you wish, the hour you repeat the bleeding in that place according to custom and adjust a little in the wound, and do fasting until that place is clotted, because that place is clotted in many people because of little wound.</end_of_turn
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	More than once that has clotted, the hour does not repeat it, because it is not useful for any cause; and suspend over that any part of the wound of oil, because it relieves the body of the patient.</end_of_turn
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	It is better in this place with oil than with other oils.</end_of_turn>
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	Similarly, administer oil to the wound in all bleeding from which the veins beyond the prohibition of the body of the patient are bled, and make it thick and viscous when it is stopped from one of those to that place, because the blood is subtile and is turned when it is great.</end_of_turn
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	If in the place of the flebotomy there is generated great swelling, which causes veins to become congested, especially those which have not bled, or in the opening of the small vein, then withdraw your finger, and place over the place a sponge soaked in water and salt, a little scraped off, and press that for an hour, until the swelling is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And cover that with the warmth of the blood of that vein along with another vein or another
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if you stay in that place for several days, any blackening or greening will not matter; if you wish, pause over any cause of pain or dizziness, or any cause of hiccup or of mental distress or of swelling or something like that
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	Veins become congested due to swelling caused by flebotomy from the basilica
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	Therefore place your hand over that, and if you find excessive pain, put your compression over that; for when that swelling is great it is bad and harmful; and then keep that you pause over any cause of that which we have said, because a strong flow of blood comes from the great artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And apply a compress wet in which there is a styptic, so that the place is hardened, and then care for that as for the other treatment until it is healed
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And cover that you extract from the blood of all men according to the quantity of its virtue and according to the color of the veins remaining over the blood according to how it appears
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	For if the blood is black, then you must leave it to rest until it is cured; in the same way if it is thick, you must leave it to rest until it is thinned; and in the same way if it is acute, until the pain is gone
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And cover that whoever is full and strong and has need of extracting blood in a vein, that the flebotomy of the vein should be greater and the flebotomy should be large
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And in that one who is pale, do the opposite of that, and cover that you extract it in small doses, and that the patient should be steady
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	The best thing in the flebotomy of the vein is that it should be a transverse section, not a puncture<end_turn>
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	This method of flebotomy is saved from the flow of blood and from the lesion of nerves, and is more pleasant and more safe than the flebotomy according to breadth and length<end_turn>
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to which it is accustomed to succeed without fainting you must do the flebotomy, and cover that you care for that before the flebotomy with a little piece of bread infused in wine in place of a thousand grains or of simple oximel scraped off; and extract a little blood from the blood in three doses or four<end_turn><end_turn>
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if there is a chill of complexion, then before doing the flebotomy give an infusion of wine with marjoram or with honey flavored with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and the like, or with an aromatic and scented infusion.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if fainting occurs due to this, that is a cause of the patient not having enough blood, then cover that you must precede with drinking water from the marrow and a fragrant infusion; and use aromatic herbs and let the patient rest on that side.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes which we have said in the division of fainting due to evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And whoever wants to prevent fainting and dissolve the blood according to the dose, cover that for which the flebotomy is for moving the evacuation, and the virtue of that one is cold, which evacuates the blood little by little, as is according to the quantity of the virtue in the continuous days
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	May whoever wants to prevent fainting and keep the blood according to the veins, and the patient is strong, then do that immediately for seven or eight hours from the first flebotomy<end_turn>
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	May whoever wants to take the blood from the body contrary to the departure to which it declines, cover that it should be done on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	May that body in which there is no blood already scraped and is acute and causes fever, cover that you take a little of the blood in one dose and take a large quantity of it and amplify the opening until fainting does not occur, for in that case you have preserved all the conditions of flebotomy; and place your hand over the pulse of the patient so that you do not cause death instead of fainting, for much swelling occurs when the flebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not cover when you want to remove the arm and evacuate the blood according to the dose, when already the orifice of the vein is closed and it is difficult to have the blood, because you must prefer that over that fierce urgency and extend your fingers widely, for that is too bad
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	The patient has a swelling that is painful to the touch; or the swelling remains with the acute pain of the phlegm, which is a coagulation of blood in the orifice of the vein; or it is caused by the inflammation of the marrow of the bone, or of the fatty substance of the marrow.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	If the vein is clotted, then do not touch it until the clot has settled.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if it is necessary to evacuate the blood according to the circumstances, and this is not excusable, then do so over that area or on the other arm in another vein
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	The swollen vein called "funis brachi" is phlegmatized in the place of fat or bone, when not found or hidden, which is composed of those things.</start_of_turn>
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	The quality of the phlebitis of these veins is that the patient places their hand in cold water until the pain disappears and the vein becomes clearly visible.</start_of_turn
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	Then strengthen the point over that which there is a ligament or stricture; and do not phlebotomize horizontally or longitudinally, but rather in a small circle.</start_of_turn
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the opening be wide and your phlebotomy be over the joint of the hand a little.</start_of_turn
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of the blood is prohibited, then repeat the hand in cold water and let the blood flow in the water until you have achieved your purpose.</start_of_turn
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	Even in the summer days, you are excused from the repetition of hand in cold water, and the month is stopped for the preservation of the blood in cold water in winter.</start_of_turn
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	The phlebotomy of this vein is more beneficial than all the others, for it has no pulsating vein or nerves.</start_of_turn
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	The phlebotomy of the cubital vein is related to the diseases of the fetlock.</start_of_turn
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	The quality of the phlebotomy of these veins is that you strengthen the hand over the ligament or over the hand, for since you have placed it in cold water, the vein is swollen and is immediately visible; and do phlebotomy in a circle; if you do not do so, you will not achieve anything.</start_of_turn
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	Beware that you do not touch your hand with phlebotomy, for you leave them without nails of flesh.</start_of_turn
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And repeat the hand in cold water and let the blood run in that way, for if you do not repeat it in cold water, the blood will coagulate in the orifice of the vein, and it is prohibited to flow.</start_of_turn
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	When the blood is extracted according to the quantity of need, then you pause over the vein with oil and salt, so that it is not solidified too much; and at the same time cover that you do not touch anything nearby.</start_of_turn
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	Moreover, the help of the phlebotomy of the left hand is that it is related to the diseases of the heel.</start_of_turn
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do the same in the phlebotomy of these veins as you did in the other.</start_of_turn
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	The help of the median vein in phlebotomy is for diseases that are in the lower parts of the body, such as diseases of the knee, and for retention of menstrual blood, and for the diseases of the tonsils and ulcers of abscesses and ancient wounds.</start_of_turn
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	The quality of the phlebotomy of these veins is that the patient puts their whole foot in cold water and makes a friction over that area until the veins become visible; and they bind over the ankle joint with a bandage; and in the area of the vein they feel a pulsating that must be pointed out, and from that there branch out in the face of the foot many nerves.</start_of_turn
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	Therefore, phlebotomize as widely as possible or leave the bandage over the ankle where it has been placed to avoid adhesion.</start_of_turn
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	If you phlebotomize on the face of the foot, then you must take care of the nerves that are left over that area of the face of the foot, and pause your phlebotomy over that which you phlebotomize so as not to injure it.</start_of_turn
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	Be careful in your phlebotomy.</start_of_turn
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	Even if blood flow is prohibited, repeat the foot in cold water and let the blood run in that way until it is evacuated.</start_of_turn
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	If the phlegmatic patient flees in the first watch, then repeat the phlebotomy a little later, when the limb is relaxed; and do not fear the malice of the patient, more than that you take care of the nerves just as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Similarly do as with the other foot, exactly as before.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And concerning the sciatic nerve, as we have said, its root is to be left in the pelvic cavity
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	The benefit of phlebotomy is that it is useful for an aching ankle when it is for healing the burn.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	The quality of phlebotomy is that the patient's pain ceases, and he is relaxed and his belly is relaxed from the flank of the thigh to below the four fingers up to a long strip that does not appear except for this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore, when it appears, repeat the phlebotomy whenever possible and according to the condition, and it is better; or perform it by incision or by excision, because the root of the limb is relaxed
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	It is in many homes not so well known; and if you find it like that and it does not appear to the feeling of the whole, repeat the phlebotomy of some part of the limb, that is which appears in the two toes instead of the thumb and the index finger
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	Take care of the nerves, and run the healing in the quantity you wish
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then remove the ligature and place your hand over the site of the phlebotomy to strengthen the limb, because it is immediately healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	From the wind and from the qualities of these things
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	The winds are of barley, or of wheat, or of ivy
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And the wind is useful in two ways: one is by scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is by the wind itself
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this wind that is of scarification is done in two ways, that is by fire or by friction
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And to the winds that are administered by scarification and extraction of blood there are fourteen parts of the body, of which one in which the winds are stopped is the ankle; and the fifth part from the knee downwards; and the winds from the chin downwards go beyond the mouth; and the winds from two spatulas; and the winds of alohost, which is at the end of the thigh; and the winds of two flames; and the winds of two braziers; and the winds of two cavities; and the winds of two cushions
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	The wind does not extract blood except from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and by this it does not take away the virtue of these things, just as in the case of phlebotomy; neither does it suffice that the wind should be done by fire or friction in any ailment that is useful for the evacuation of everything from the body
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	However, if necessary, we can cause a wound for an ailment or for a continuation, we will administer it at the beginning and at the end of the month, and in the middle of the month and at any other time as needed
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of this is that in many people in which there is an excess of blood, they do not agree with the extraction of blood by the wind and they find in the belly great coldness and bitterness; and from those they find repletion and redness in the face and in the belly, and in the belly of the thigh; and from those who find thirst in the face and front of the head and shadows and faintness in the knees; and from those who vomit the blood of the wound; and from those whose laughter is multiplied; and from those who find a taste of blood in their mouth, or that their tongue is swollen and spitting blood; and from those who sleep multiplied, and from those who see blood in their sleep full of rigor and old age and spots and other causes that make them similar to this
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore, when in any case of these, and properly if it is in the third or half of the month, it is commanded that the wind should be done more than at any other time of the day or two or three hours
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of the wind from the neck is that when it confers gravity to the head and that which is effaced from the heels; however, it does not suffice that it should be a close evacuation of everything from the body
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this wind is in the place of the cephalic phlebotomy
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not lawful to use it for those who are of complete madness, or in which there is congestion, because it gives great harm to that.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason it does not suffice that it should be used for the old people, and in the heads of those who have diseases of the head
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	May it be known to him who remains silent on this matter that the cause of the pain is oblivion; and for this reason I command the attendant to remove his hand a little from the patient's side, fearing the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	The scent of ale is more effective than the lancing of the veins of the belly and the bladder: and for this reason I assign it to the asthma, and to the constriction of bile and the cutting of the pain of bile, and to coughing, and to distension
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And I order that the scent of ale be applied sparingly, because if it is left behind, it generates weakness in the body and the stomach
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	The scent of chamomile relieves headaches and ophthalmia, diarrhea, anxiety, and toothache; and it is more effective than the lancing of the veins of the veins of the marrow
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And I command the attendant that he does not touch his hand too much with the knife so as not to bruise the artery and cause the flow of blood to stop
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	The scent of mint relieves hiccups in the mouth, and corruption of the gums, and resembles the taste of the diseases that are in the mouth, and it is more effective than the lancing of the veins of the liver that are in the armpits
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	And the scent which is useful over the armpits relieves the headache, which is useful for replacing heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the scent of the armpits of the armpits which comes from the bones relieves the lancing of three veins, that is of the bladder, belly and head, because those that are behind bring blood to all those veins which are more numerous than those that go out from them, and those smaller veins which go out of the others enter into those three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	I command the attendant not to proceed too much with the knife, because the flesh is stripped of skin, and leaves the nerves and blood vessels exposed.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	This is a scent that is applied over the buttocks and relieves haemorrhoids and ulcers behind the legs.<end_turn>
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And I order the attendant that it should be a strong scent, and that it should be of cinnamon, because it digests strongly of fat; and strong should be taken subtle winds and should be applied with a knife.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	The scent of the camomile that is taken in small quantities is useful for all the body, and relieves the ancient pains of the kidneys and the liver, and the bladder; and it provokes menstruation, and relieves vomiting and diarrhea; and it is more effective than the lancing of two veins, and it stops swelling and bruising, and two cavities
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However they do not benefit all the body and make it swell in many people<end_turn>
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the scent that stops swelling is useful alongside the scent of two veins of the buttocks
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The quality of the position of the scent is that it stops the initial vomiting and promotes the vomiting of a tempered amount, and does not prolong the position of the scent, but rather pauses them leisurely, and keeps them moderately, and that the humors go to the place they should go spontaneously without being delayed
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease until you see that the place already recovers and swells and that the rigor of the blood appears
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And when you have finished the lancing and repeated the vomiting a few times, and consider the condition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For the weak person who has soft flesh and rare veins, I command that you give a little scarification and do not do it again, because the place is not to be ulcerated
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	I command the attendant to widen the scarification and make a little hole, and to breathe slowly.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if there is toughness in the blood, I command that you make two incisions, because in the first incision the delicate vein of the blood is opened up and the blood is released from it.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	And in the second one the acquisition of the extraction of the thick blood is obtained
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is not thick, I command that you make a third incision so that you can achieve the marrow
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a little, suffice with a single incision.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a lot of blood, we make several incisions; and if we know that the blood is thick, I command that you make a wide incision.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	The limit of the incision is only the depth of the skin.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	If the thumb is large, hard, dark, and swollen, that the veins become smoother, open and resolving; if in summer, thus as olive of aloes or olive of violets, or olive of meadowsweet, or olive of poppy seed; if in winter, then olive of mastic or olive of lily, or olive of chamomile, or saffron.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	If the swelling is great, fiery, then let olive oil be taken either amaranth or balsamite, or aloes or pennyroyal, and the like.</end_of_turn>
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the wind is of great power of tough hair, then let it be forbidden to take oil, and let the veins of the wind be bathed with water of almonds or hot water of the sun, or water of poppy seed, or water of chamomile, or the like.</end_of_turn>
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And if the patient has moisture of humiture, wash their veins with vinegar or water of myrtle, mastic and alike.</end_of_turn>
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And if the swelling is great, wash their veins with strong vinegar or water of elderberry, which is greater, or of chamomile or of camomile, and the like.</end_of_turn
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And let the wind be kept away from bathing; having bated it must be administered almost immediately after the bath for an hour or two, and let it rest near the wind.</end_of_turn>
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that makes it useful to restore the veins from a phlebotomy before the venostasis?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Let us consider at the beginning: if the wind or the one who is to perform the phlebotomy is bilious and winds over them sick and inflamed, let it be foreseen that cold causes will be excluded, thus as vinegar and lettuce, and saffron, and juniper berries, and alike.</end_of_turn
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And omit their food thus as poultry, and fatty meats, and foods with vinegar, and the like.</end_of_turn
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And if the complexion is fiery, let it be foreseen to abstain from drinking strong drinks or eating almonds and fennel, and garlic; and let them be advised to drink little and eat sparingly, and omit poultry and meat and fish and peas and onions.</end>
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And let the drink be greater than the food in the day of wind and phlebotomy.</end_of_turn>
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And let the patient be given in some hours after the meal some strong drinks like barley barley flour or medicine of must or honey before or after the wind or phlebotomy or at the same time, so that the principal members be comforted and the sickness be mitigated; and let them not take any enemas.</end_of_turn
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the winds that we must not sacrifice are the winds that stop their fetor on the heel and the ankle, and on the navel, in the groin, and the armpit, because these members must not suffer sacrifice upon them.</end_of_turn
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for these except for the attraction of the sickness of a limb, thus as the wind is stopped over the breast in the disease of flux of blood of the breast; and they use this for that the wind is dispersed from the limb thus as over the belly and the navel; for that scarcity strengthens the limb and makes it scaly and removes the pain that resolves the wind.</end_of_turn
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And already is it stopped on the hiccups when they happen in their application or support, for by the power of strong attraction it makes the hiccups go away and expels the phlegm from its place.</end_of_turn
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And in the same way when it is stopped on the heel and the ankle it removes the wind from those enclosed.</end_of_turn
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These winds are administered cold with vinegar only; and some are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some are administered full of hot water in the diseases of the breast.</end_of_turn>
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is for that the wind should be full and greater, so is hot water alone or hot water in which are boiled herbs that are convenient.</end_of_turn
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of wind administered with fire: the breadth of the orifice of two fingers, as we have formed it; and the quantity of the preparation is the amount of a palm; and it is placed on the side of the limb, in the place where it is in the circuit, the amount of the limb, the neck is small according to the quantity that enters it with a needle.</end_of_turn
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.

E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.

E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquella sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.

Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.
