Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	O, son, understand that the learned physicians, the vulgar people and those who at some time neglect the works of the Ancients or do not read their letters.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	Therefore, in our land, this kind of madness among the learned is a private matter; and I have never forgotten it at any time; for I have not abandoned it until now, except for the length of reading the works of the Ancients and studying to understand them, from which I have extracted this science.</end_of_turn>
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I direct you to experiments and studies throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that concerns my science and the experiments that I have made on the subject; for I have abridged what is proper to you others and delivered it from the burden of long dissertations; I have opened it in the end for brevity; and I have shown in the end how I have formed various methods for treating those ailments that are administered in this way, as it is mentioned in addition to the declaration, just as I have done in the two preceding chapters.</end_of_turn>
Capitol primier.	Chapter First.</end_of_turn>
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collection from this fracture of bones, from which the previous preface is necessary, before we begin the recollection of fractured limbs and various parts of each.</end_of_turn
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us speak in the prologue of this chapter about the summaries of the discourse; and the chapters that follow are intended to bring to light the artifices and to settle the truth of those things; so that you and those who wish to learn this noble art may know or learn it from you.</end_of_turn
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Therefore, I say that when an accident of fracture or dislocation or twist or any similar thing happens, the hour immediately covers that you should begin with cold compresses or apply an aleatory, or whatever helps, if it does not impede any cause, as befits prudence, or if it is the heat that has caused the accident, or if the person is young and robust, or if it is cold weather.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let food be moderate in salads of fresh herbs and boiled meats of calves and crabs; and forbid fatty meats and feed that is full of fat, and all food that fills the veins of the stomach, except that you follow the rule of caut dressing, and do not fear the effusion of matter from the limb.</end_of_turn
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	Then return the patient to their first position as soon as possible.</end_of_turn>
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And when the broken bone begins to be restored, the hour covers that the patient should not be given nourishing foods of great viscosity, such as porridge made with flour and water, broth, eggs, cheese, fish, beef, fat, and barley, and in this regimen there is a coagulation of the fracture that is more useful and more gentle.</end_of_turn
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	Therefore, you know that bones that are fractured in the first degree and in decrepitude cannot be continued to be fractured and consolidated according to their nature because of the drying up of the limbs.</end_of_turn
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all the time by the drying up of those limbs, and they are continued and consolidated those that are from them at the end of the convalescence, just as the bones of small children.</end_of_turn
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature must adjust and remember that the fractured bone of any part whatever, is of such great size that it adheres and strengthens itself as soon as it is bound together, until it comes to the end of movement and rest, just as with fire at the beginning, except that no cause hinders that.</end_of_turn
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	Therefore, in this case it is necessary to stop the patient's food, food in which there is gravity and viscosity and greatness, as we have said.</end_of_turn
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many different fractures according to the diversity of the limb.</end_of_turn
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	Therefore, you know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limb, for the fracture of the thigh bone is different from the fracture of the head bone; and the fracture of the foot bone is different from the fracture of the forearm; and so on with all the other limbs.</end_of_turn
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I remember all kinds of fracture, explained in a distinct chapter from the others.</end_of_turn
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There are many different fractures within each category.</end_of_turn
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fracture within each category are diverse; for example, a fractured bone in its star may be fractured in a different way from one that occurs in its marrow; some fractures are simple, while others are compound, proceeding from the break of the bone itself and not from the surrounding tissue, just as it is in writing when prepared to write, and it is a fractured bone with a wound and disruption in the head, and a fractured fissure of the bone.</end_of_turn
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And in every case it is an evil or torment proper in restoring them according as will be remembered from their distinctness in the various places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Sign of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for this is known as fracture of the bone: it is twisting of the limb, and from that protrusion and appearance of the limb to the sensation, and so from that when it is compressed with your hand
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is no apparent twisting of the limb or even if it is not suspected, you must touch the bone gently when you touch it so that the patient does not feel great pain, for here there is no fracture
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	There is also the possibility of slight twisting or small fracture, whereupon you must not press on it with your hand and compress it; there must be a pause in relation to the medicines of which you remember at that moment; and immediately for stricture of the marrow
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you must know that when the limb is bent and is not fractured into two or other parts that do not affect it in its stability, as for example the whole part of its substance, the hour is that you begin to rectify it immediately after the cause has ceased.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it recurs after the cause has ceased, leave it for a few days until the swelling subsides; and then support it in any way that you can, as by raising and binding.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And you must know that the restoration of the limb and its convalescence is easier than that of the bone in which the fracture has occurred
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And so do all things according as will be remembered in each case.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	May be if there are fractures in the bone, it is necessary to extend this limb fractured in two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two cords or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And let your position be such that you can support the limb relaxed according to its natural figure, while the fractured parts are extended from the limb, so that you can restore those adhesions with engineering and in any way that you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And take care that you do not cause further pain or injury to the patient by your operation of healing; and follow the treatment that you apply to a bone with another companion in many other forms
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And you must take advantage at that moment of your touch with your hand in order to rectify any other cause, and if there is sometimes any other cause, rectify that and support that for the amount of your skill
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid violent extension and compression, just as wise doctors do who make use of cautery after their operation, or who make use of constriction in the limb in the way that we have seen in the operation of their veins.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And so add, equality, decent operation and stricture of that limb, rest, tranquility; warn the patient about this and make him understand that he should not feel pain in the hours of his watch and sleep, and see his recovery and agitation, and you must see his digestion, and must do all his movements with all your skill; and wait until the position of the limb is such a position as ensures the pain, which is because when it is in the position of the limb the pain or injury is removed; the hour is that you change that position to another one in which there is no pain; and keep it in such a position that the limb is neither too flexed nor too extended, so that the limb does not suffer twisting when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the stricture of the limb is that which I recommend; for you must know that fractured limbs are diverse in their size and greatness and in their form
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And as for those that are small such as the arm and the finger and the toe and the like, the hour is that the covering should be of soft material.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	And as for those that are large such as the thigh or the chest, cover that with firm and hard covering, which connects the great limb firmly and strengthens that throughout its extent without causing any bruising
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And so do all things, pause the ligament conveniently at the place of that fracture with three covers or four as the limb deserves; and strengthen your hand a little on the ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And so look at the most prominent part of the place of the fracture, and strengthen less than that where you have strengthened the place of the fracture
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And so lengthen the covering of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the stricture little by little, until you have taken away a great part of the limb
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And thus take another instrument and wrap that other bandage around the limb to be bound firmly; and when the bandage has been placed in its place, proceed with the operation in the manner described previously concerning the first bandage.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And if there is a swelling in the area of the fracture, or if the limb is twisted, leave it as it is in such cases; otherwise do not touch it for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And place another instrument over it, and tightly bind over these bandages as much as necessary; if there is no swelling or oozing from the wound, and when the oozing has ceased and the swelling has subsided; leave that for a few days; and then remove the supports gradually as necessary
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	The supports of the major limb are of various kinds, and should be formed skillfully; or of wood; or of palm leaves; and the width of each support should be as follows: ...
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the support which is placed over the fracture should be larger and wider than the others, and its length should be according to the size of the limb; and grasp the supports with another instrument according to your previous instructions; and tie them securely as we have said previously, so that the support is the most stable in the area of the fracture and the more the limb is elongated, the weaker the support should be
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it must be ensured that the threads are of moderate thickness and flexibility, and are of silk; and if the threads are thick, like those used for surgery in other places, it is a great error when the support is removed and equality is not restored
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	Subtle threads are not suitable for this purpose, for you will not achieve sufficient support in this way, and it must not be the case that there is less than a finger's breadth between the supports
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is suffering from excessive stiffness of the limbs at the extremities, support the limb in the places mentioned until the stiffness has disappeared without causing further injury
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some bandages for fractures are like ointments, and others are like disruptions of the cord, and I remind you of this in the chapter concerning singularity
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	Remember that every fractured limb is not straight at first; the reason for this is that when the limb is large, it is not appropriate to support it on the bandages immediately; rather wait a few days or even more, according to your estimate of the risk of oozing
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is the method of dressing which the Ancients used to restore fractures, dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of dressing similar to that of the ancients, suitable for multiple complex fractures, especially for women and men, because of which it is not heated or cooled by the air: and take powdered charcoal, which is the middle of wheat that remains after the wheat has been ground.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And keep it moist like this, but do not make it wet; and cover it with a cloth that is not too thick or too thin; and use this as a dressing
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method for plastering is for fracture, dislocation and sprain: recipe of asafoetida, of lapdanum, of acacia, of enula, and marigold, which is ground from a thousand grains of Salvago, by weight of two drams. Five of mirra and aloen by weight of one dram. Twenty of alochil by weight of two drams. All of these are triturated and sieved and mixed with water, with oil or with egg white if the patient's wound is raw; and use this plaster, for it is of good composition and restores the broken bones pleasantly, and gives comfort to many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method for plastering which gives comfort for fracture and sprain: recipe of marigold and white alum at the rate of two drams. Five of mirra and aloen by weight of one dram. Six of acacia by weight of one dram. Two hundred of beeswax by weight of two hundred.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All of them are powdered in a mortar with a rough stone, are mixed, and are moistened with water or liquid and administered
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	In this dressing there is no virtue of restoration, but rather of calming the pain and driving out the cause of the pain properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of dressing that restores broken bones: take figs and poppy seeds; mix them up and make a dressing of them
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A short method of dressing that promotes the restoration of bone fractures and when you desire resolution of the remaining swelling: mix powdered elderberry, chamomile and violet flowers, barley flour, all in equal parts Put everything in a decoction and keep it warm, if the limb is not scorched
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	If it is scorched, however, keep it comfortable with lukewarm water or with vinegar and use it
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of dressing that is more powerful in resolving this is when the swelling is severe: mix elderberry and linseed seeds, barley, meadowsweet, marjoram, violets, chamomile, all in equal parts and fennel; put everything in a decoction and keep it warm with vinegar or water, or with wine, according to the quality of the limb and the degree of swelling
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Hippocrates does not say that in the free air it should be placed over the fractured limb in order to promote its restoration, but rather that it should be covered with wax and oil and not otherwise; and I recommend that you rather use an intermediate degree between thickness and thinness
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	Indeed in Gaul they put it over the fractured limb in order to promote its restoration and the causes of its pain, such as small inflammation or cold, as well as its causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of dressing that relieves the lesion and pain: mix millet, chickpea flour, ground fennel seeds or pennyroyal seeds, elderberry, salt, all in equal parts; grind them together and sift them, and make a dressing of them
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The quantity should be according to the degree of swelling that must be left on the limb, and if there is no pain or swelling or the bone is not fractured, it is not appropriate to remove it for a long time.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is acute pain or swelling or inflammation in the area, then in that hour you must cover it or remove it immediately, and keep the dressing on it
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take linen cloth and marine sponge soaked in warm water, and immerse that in lukewarm water; with that wash the area until the swelling and pain disappear; then put on a bandage with a soft bandage soaked in strong vinegar and olive oil or olive oil alone, and keep it on for a night until you are sure that the cautery has healed, and that the swelling of the limb has subsided, and that the pain has gone away.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And do the same with the stricture and put on a small dressing and do not bind it tightly for your initial constriction, but rather do it gradually as it improves.</start_of_turn>
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if sometimes the swelling and the redness and the pain and the inflammation and all these things have already subsided, and digestion of the dressing and the stricture has begun, then in that case you must repeat it as before, just as you did at the beginning when you put on the dressing.</start_of_turn>
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no other cause appears in the limb of those that we have mentioned, then do not remove it for three or four days or five or seven days.</start_of_turn And some people keep it like this for xx days according to the appearance of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and when the coagulacion of the marrow over that has taken place.</start_of_turn
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And when you adjust in the stricture more than in your initial stricture, and when you adjust in the nourishment of the patient's diet, according to the memory of that.</start_of_turn
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	Indeed if sometimes the limb of the fracture has dried out and become flexible again more than when you first covered it, know that nutrition is prohibited in that case; and therefore take away from that lukewarm water for three days; and loosen the stricture a little, and by this operation restore nutrition to the limb, and it will recover quickly.</start_of_turn
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	Indeed those who restore the fracture of the limb do not do as others when they do not restore it at the beginning, according to the custom; and they restore it according to their whim, which is an error in the operation of them, and is dangerous, and if they do that which increases the pain in the limb when it is free, they will aggravate it with that which they do.</start_of_turn
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have never seen anyone do that, for it is more reasonable that it does not happen.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter two: Of fractures when they happen in the head.</end_of_turn>
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	There are various kinds of fractures, and their figures are diverse, and their causes are different, for some fractures are caused by impact to the space, and the impact hinders all the bone within the cavity, which remains fractured, just as when it happens in the wrist; and for this reason this kind of fracture is called fracture of the bone; or the space impacts some part of the bone, and impacts the marrow without passing the incision through the back of the bone; and this kind of fracture is called absolute elevation.</end_of_turn>
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the swelling of these two fractures is great or little, and of a fracture that is contracted or contained; and the cause of these is impact with the palm of the hand or with the edge of the foot, and the like.</end_of_turn
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating that has already approached the bone which is left fractured; or it is on the face of the bone, and the swelling of these two fractures is great or little.</end_of_turn
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	Or the fracture is that which is hidden in the bone, in the substance of the small vessel, and for this reason it is called capillary fracture.</end_of_turn
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And the fracture is caused by impact or by chance or by impact of the foot and it leaves an indentation in any lamina of the bone to the parts adjacent, and it is fractured in the hollow part just as when it happens to the nails when they are impacted and broken through.</end_of_turn
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	Mostly it is caused in bones of soft texture, as for example their heads.</end_of_turn
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And thus all these stationary fractures are like separated stars.</end_of_turn
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I find it necessary to remind you of everything in this place.</end_of_turn
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I know all these kinds of fractures by detection on them and by questioning them in order to detect any underlying corruption of the bone that is over them.</end_of_turn
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	The capillary fracture is known by this that it is discovered on the bone, and it is excised, and it is limited over it with a tent, so that the fracture appears black.</end_of_turn
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fracture attention should be paid at the beginning to the signs of the illness, and when sometimes for the signs that may signify for significance appears with vomiting of bile, extension, loss of consciousness, loss of voice, syncope, fever, and acute pain in the joints and stiffness of those.</end_of_turn
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if sometimes non-violent accidents occur you expect health, the hour you begin the treatment of them.</end_of_turn
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	Which cause is that if it is verified in the beginning like that which is verified in the days of spring, the hour you must study in the marrow of the bone thirteen days according to all custom.</end_of_turn
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the summer days, the hour you must cover the bone thirteen days starting from the seventh day, having to keep that which is left of the bone corrupt from the marrow, and to take care of the accidents which we have recommended.</end_of_turn
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the marrow covering the brain, and it is contracted and contained, the hour you must insert the fractured parts and bind them, as I recommend to you.</end_of_turn
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And that you take the head of the illness that is inflamed, and you uncover the bone according to custom and manage as you are able according to the figure of the inflammation, and that you are curious about the illness.</end_of_turn
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you that you detect the bone, flux of blood or caut abscess, the hour you oppose it with what covers it, and that you cover the area with clean cloth soaked in vinegar and oil, and make the swelling subside until the abscess is sedated; and be sure to drain the blood; and start the treatment by applying the bandage to the bone and opening the wound.</end_of_turn
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to two methods of operation.</end_of_turn
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the first method is that you insert the bone with a straight incision, and this is how you do it: And you give another incision a little wider than the first; and this is how you do it.</end_of_turn
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And you give more of the latter incision.</end_of_turn
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And know that you must give your name as an inscription, for some of them are more lazy than others; and some of them are shorter than others and are at the back of the order of their extremities, and they are made of iron or venomous material.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use of them [instruments] makes it easier to perform the incision on the inscription so that you do not break the head and leave it behind.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, then cover that you pierce in the circumference of it before you administer the inscription, which are called superficial not deep
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	They are not called thus except that those who do not stop the term of the bone until they are close to it, because the superficial part of the limb or margin over that which the head of the limb is left behind appears like a margin or small circle, which prohibits it from being submerged and passing through the substance of the bone
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take a large number of these superficial incisions, of which each one agrees with the substance of each bone, except in those cases where in all tests of the limb the extremity that is acute in length and breadth is such that the quantity in length and breadth is according to the quantity of substance of that limb.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of incisions: The quality of piercing in the circumference of the broken bone is that you stop the incision on the bone and rotate that around which you have tied it until you know that the bone has already been penetrated; and then change the incision to another place, and stop when there is between all the distance the quantity of the thickness of the ray or around that
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And indeed incisions are made with the inscription when there is between each break of the bone, and make that one more subtle than you can over that in order to finish levitating, as we have said, until you have eradicated the bone, or with your hand, or by any other cause for some tremor that has appeared in it, such as nails and fine forceps
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And know that you must take great care that the inscription does not touch any cause of infection.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And therefore when you have pierced the circumference of the bone, and if it is continuous with the infection if it is continued with it, then extract that, know that you should burn and cauterize that with the substance of the infection that is in the bone or another cause similar to an incision, but indeed that you must make it more tense and subtle than the others
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if there remains any small parts of bones and fragments, then take that which is convenient for you from the causes of the ailments; and indeed take care of the wound with lint and dressings as we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another way of operating is light, long, which says dissection Gaul and the lauzing for great profit; and this is the saying of it: it is necessary for you at the beginning to begin to discover the part of the bone of the limb in which the fracture is the most vehement and most manifest, until when you have discovered that part and you have stopped leaving that limb that the incision is slow and peaceful of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And that the blunt part is round and does not touch any cause, and the acute part is of it in two directions before and after in length, as sometimes; that the blunt part is adjusted to the infection with the face of the acute incision on the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And indeed pierce about the inscription with a little mallet so that you can insert all the bone easily as if it were rotated, and you will be sure of the safety that it will not happen by chance that you fear in any way, and if the physician was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	And if there remains any adjacent cause to the bone of the cavity in several places, pierce that one with the extremity of the incision that is blunt, and deliver that one with ease, which is delivered from it without document and without fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the bone is not pierced into the cavity, and what is broken or remains of the bone is the face of it, and remains in it in asperities and subtle fragments, then know that you must burn that asperitat and extirpate those fragments with subtle reasons for those for which you have prepared the number, of various quantities so that you can easily manage them in all places and make the most of them according to what you lose in your operation that broken bone and its figure.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And know that you must administer in your reason the greatest part of those reasons at the beginning of the reasons, and indeed use the greatest part of the subtle of them, and do not stop until you have completed the greatest part and the most subtle of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	Indeed in any other small fractures capillary and subtle fracture, know that you must take care according to what you have lost for the rectification of it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	It is because of this that no learned person has been able to explain it in its entirety.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	Therefore, as we have said before in great fractures...
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	If the swelling is rectangular when you radiate it out, then take as much of the plaster as the amount of the wound and immerse it in scented oil, and place it over the orifice of the wound; and take another bandage doubled or tripled and immerse it in wine and scented oil and place it over the first bandage, and do so until the pus comes out willingly from that place, without causing damage; and then give him some lard around that area, and do not tighten it until the wound is whole only as much as the wound itself
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave it like this for a day or two until you are certain that the burn has subsided; and then remove the bandage and administer medicines which are useful for drying, such as linseed and barley flour, henbane and marjoram, and similar things to these
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is necessary that you grind these medicines into powder and sprinkle them over the wound; and in general, give any medicine that has the property of drying, such as alum or mercury.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And take heed of your art that the wound in your care should be dry; do not put anything greasy on it or anything else; and do not let it become infected; for when it is applied to the swelling of the head, it corrupts that and impoverishes that, and brings about illness in the patient
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And take care in the head, as when it is solidified it breaks the bones more and especially when the care is negligent; and it is black on its surface; and therefore consider that if an accident happens to the patient, the things that we have said are dangerous for him, because it is perilous in every way.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if there is no blackness except for the medicine that has been stopped, and it is in virtue of that medicine that causes that blackness, then take three parts of vinegar and two parts of scented oil, in the proportion of three to two.</start_of_turn> And mix it with these ingredients a bandage, and place it on the swelling; and care for that with the spices of care which you consider to be useful until it is healed.</start_of_turn>

De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is fractured.</start_of_turn
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not fractured but simply bowed down somewhat, or one of these has been softened, so that in it there are two bones, for the part that is left is cartilaginous and is not fractured, and does not cause it any damage but swelling and pain and numbness.</start_of_turn
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	Moreover, if one of the two parts is fractured, then you must insert a little support in the nose, and stabilize that fracture with the index finger and the thumb, until the nose returns to its natural shape.</start_of_turn
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this with ease, and take care that you do not cause any pain to the patient during this operation.</start_of_turn
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the lower part of the nose, and you say that it does not matter, then you must make it equal with the extremity of the ray where the thickness is small.</start_of_turn
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, you must make it look like that.</start_of_turn
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And cover its restoration on the first day of the fracture if possible; and if not, then leave it for a while or two until the burn subsides.</start_of_turn
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And put in the extremity of the nose a wad of linen, if the fracture is in one part, or two cushions, if the fracture is in two parts, and make them of such thickness that they fill the cavity of the nose.</start_of_turn
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And tell the old restorers that the cushions should be bound at the edges, and should be changed throughout the day, even though I do not see it; for you must know that the wad should be bound with almond paste with powdered charcoal; and do so until the bone is firm and the cartilage is solidified.</start_of_turn
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And in some cases put sponges inside the nose instead of a cushion, because it is better for swelling; and that the patient should not be prohibited from inspiration even if the fracture of the nose is violent, for the patient will recover more quickly.</start_of_turn
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This matter is not necessary for you; and if you wish, do this, and if you wish, do that.</start_of_turn
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another bruise appears after the burn subsides, plaster the nose with wax or with soot moistened in wine and scented oil, or with vinegar.</start_of_turn
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	May it be that if the cautery does not happen to slip, then cover that part with meal of size and with a powder of burnt chaff with an album of honey; and immediately stop over it with a sponge, and do not leave it exposed for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	If the bones of the nose are fractured in a slight or great degree, then split them open, and extract those with instruments that are suitable for them; and immediately close the wound, and care for that which encloses and consolidates, and apply plasters as necessary
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is a wound in the nose, then care for that which is causing the bleeding and administer lead tubes until it is completely healed.

De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Restoration of the mandible when it is fractured
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the mandible is fractured and the fracture is not accompanied by bleeding, keep the fracture from displacement only if it is clearly displaced, and not fractured into two parts and bent outwards. In such a case, its sensation is light
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	Therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, insert the left index finger into the patient's mouth; and in the same way, if the fracture is on the left mandible, insert the index finger of the right hand; and grasp with that the swelling of the fracture outwards, with your other hand at the opposite side of the bone; thus you will easily equal the amount.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	If the fracture of the mandible has already been separated into two, then administer extension of two parts according to rectitude until it is possible to equal them
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	If there is displacement of teeth with disruption, then strengthen those that you expect to remain in place with gold or silver or gutta percha; and immediately stop over the fractured mandible, and immediately stop over the duplicate tissue, and stop over the large pulp in place appropriately, or one piece of gutta percha equal to the length of the mandible; and tie that down according to what is appropriate for the libandage of the tooth and that which is convenient for the application, until it is not destroyed
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	Command the patient to rest and tranquility, and abstain from eating spicy foods for him
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you see that the figure has already been altered in some way, then you will cover it up and take it off on the third day; and immediately correct what has already been altered of it and plaster that with powder of mill, with an album of honey, or with meal of size, because you must not leave it uncovered, and stop over the plaster sponge
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And thus when it is fixed and adjusted that plaster over it, and the arrangement of the bone is not altered, leave it in place, do not take it out until it is healed and strengthen the fracture; for if the swelling of this fracture is not dispelled in three periods, it will not be healed
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another wound occurs after the cautery, then administer what has been said above in the case of bleeding until it is healed, and remove that wound
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is accompanied by bleeding, consider whether it is a fracture of the bone separated or sutures; in this case you are ordered to remove those sutures with what is convenient for the removal of those of the torment
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the wound is wide, then you will enlarge it with the flebotome according to the quantity of your need
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have finally removed those sutures, and those that you will not remove, then you will close the wound if it is wide; otherwise, stop over that one of the plasters which you consider convenient and care for that, until it is healed
