De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Restoration of the jaw when it is fractured
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	When the jaw is fractured from the front towards the back of the teeth, and that fracture is caused by one of three things.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Or it is fractured, or separated, or is separated into two parts without causing sutures; and it is desirable for the restoration of it; or it is just that it has occurred in the sutures, and it is difficult to restore it; or it is just that the fracture is accompanied by bleeding
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that case, when the fracture is accompanied by bleeding, is that two assistants be present, so that one may hold the fractured jaw and the other extend the cheek towards that part
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And immediately bind the fracture with the said strings until the shape of it is restored according to what you cover, and not in too little or too much prominence
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	If the pain persists despite the extension, then let him rest his hand from the patient, hoping that some degree of the swelling will subside; and let the size of the elevation depend on the quantity of the need; extend and elevate the foot and cover the swelling with your hand until the fracture is reduced.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	If it is not possible to retract the limb from the socket, in order that it does not slip further, then let the patient rest his face on his chest, and place a cushion under his arm, supporting it with a smaller cushion of equal size.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the attendants must support the limb under the socket until the bone of the foot is elevated above the level of the socket, and when the fracture is reduced, grasp those parts which are above with your thumb and index finger
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	Even if the fracture is displaced and the limb is hanging down, let him rest on that and extract those satagias with ease
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	If it is retained in the bone, let you make an incision of the limb with one of the instruments which you have prepared beforehand, since you have already rested the foot from the discomfort which it caused; and the discomfort is of the kind of fist or nail of which this is the shape
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	It is similar to a wound of which this is the cavity; and let its width be according to what you need of it, according to the greatness of the bone or the thinness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	Let its length be as it is possible for the operation; that there be two limbs always, sometimes one limb is broad and the other narrow.</start_turn>
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the membrane which you have incised when you have extracted the foreign body from the bone is wide, and you are sure of its stability, then you adjust the two lips of the membrane together with sutures.</start_turn
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is slight, or if you fear excessive bleeding, then you must cover the membrane with gauze and powder according to the quantity of the wound.</start_turn
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if bleeding should occur, let you apply pressure to the wound with wine vinegar and oil of rosemary and wine, and rest upon it.</start_turn
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	May the stiffness of the bone when the wound is closed and the fracture is set, be that you place a plaster cast of barley meal with an egg of alum, and place over it a catgut, and support the limb with a cushion, and do not remove the hand, if you should feel it, and take nourishment, for the Saracens say that it should be long like three fingers and as wide as from thumb to wrist; and put powder twice over the catgut and plaster; and take a splint of walnut shell whose width is three fingers and as long as the fracture itself; and wrap it around the limb, and around the fracture with the splint; and keep it moistened as before, and turn it over the thumb and index finger of the limb and over the painful area, and reduce the fracture over all parts, and when the stiffness of the fracture has become like the stiffness of the limb, and that which is not concealed by you.</start_turn
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And finally, that the splint should not rest on the broken bone; and so that you see the patient every day, since when the ligament is softened or the splint is already softened, then you must rectify that and strengthen the bandage.</start_turn><end_turn>
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And place the patient’s hand over the limb’s collar, and leave the hand resting from the limb for him to sleep with a small cushion; so that in this way the limb’s attendants are elevated from the side of this, and therefore the fracture of the foot is elevated with the elevation of the muscle; or that the arm is bound to the limb’s collar.</start_turn><end_turn
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	Do not remove the bandage if no bleeding occurs at the site or excessive bleeding, within twelve days.</start_turn><end_turn>
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And renew the plaster if you have seen the face of the limb to it, and adjust in the stiffness and restore that and leave it until the fracture of the foot is restored and is coagulated.</start_turn><end_turn
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And is strengthened and comforted according to the month in eighty days, and several visits in various homes are sufficient in a month of time of that.</start_turn><end_turn
Capitol .vi.	End of treatment.</start_turn><end_turn>
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Restoration of ankle fracture.</start_turn><end_turn
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The ankle bone is fractured in the lateral part of the limb and is not fractured from the bone except for the margins.</start_turn><end_turn
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is fractured in the limb – and it is fractured in the middle of the limb – and is not known except by touch, then according as the figure of the fracture forces you to prepare the limb and reduce that according to the natural figure in every way that is possible for you.</start_turn><end_turn
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And thus pause your hand over the area of the heel, over the moles of millet and stop the lion; and pause the powder of marigold doubled; and pause over them the spatula as much as the total amount of the spatula or a little less.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	If you leave the spatula concave in some of the area of the heel, then you grasp that concavity with the stop lion, and then put the spatula equally.</end_of_turn>
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And thus stretch downwards with the tongue with constriction downwards and with tightening of the spatula until it does not remain slippery from the heel.</end_of_turn>
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Consider the ligament in each day; and when it is softened, leave another unguided and tighten the spatula as much as the heel is slippery.</end_of_turn
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And I hold the patient over the side of the bed like this.</end_of_turn>
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in xx days or in .xxv.</end_of_turn>
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And thus when this number is completed, then you dissolve the ligament, and you know with certainty that it is not from the bones from which you started, neither is its dissolution feared.</end_of_turn
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the heel bone and leave the tendon behind, then you cut over it, keep it, and do as we have said in the fracture of the scaphoid bone in apostema caudate with a burn if it happens here.</end_of_turn
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.</end_of_turn>
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the foot.</end_of_turn>
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot has several veins that are fractured in the middle of the bone and there; more the extremities of the limb move backwards that so cicatrize and diminish.</end_of_turn
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And concerning the accidents of the limb when the middle of the bone is fractured, it is that it inclines to the inner parts and causes great pain, and difficulty in walking, and coughing, and vomiting of blood; and it is declared in the cavity of the fractured bone and is not hidden from feeling.</end_of_turn
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of the limb is that you rest the patient on the two sides, and suspend between the buttocks of the limb a cushion; and then press the muscles of the limb, and adjust the flanks of the limb to the greatest of two sides, and stretch your hand over the area and execute the operation of the limb and in the equalization as much as is possible and as it is convenient, until you restore the shape of the bone as it was before.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And thus pause over the plaster and stop and pause over the staple of a spatula of obsidian or of ivory and of its like in suspension, because you wrap that around it; and gently encircle that over the fractured bone that it is not crushed; and keep stretching that which is strict downward; and consider the ligament at all times, and when it is softened stretch that also.</end_of_turn
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessary you cause a loosening of that, you must correct the fracture or swelling or pain or apostema that occurs in the area, then you will cover that and remove the plaster and correct what happened in the manner of treatment of the limb; and thus reduce the plaster, sometimes up to the face; and adjust the stricture so that it is healthy.</end_of_turn
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.</end_of_turn
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Of the restoration of the back when it is fractured.</end_of_turn
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that the fracture of the back does not crack completely but in places that follow the two; and from the extremities of the limb from the front part does not happen except for what is cartilaginous.</end_of_turn
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And you must know that it is not hidden from feeling, you must inquire about it from those who know it.</end_of_turn
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is thus that you embrace the fracture as it is said according to the possible manner, except that you embrace as much as covers, and then plaster and strengthen the fractured bone with a staple, if you deem it necessary of that.</end_of_turn
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the back is declining to the inner parts, then it happens to the patient severe pain and puncture, just as if it were a puncture that happened to him who has pleuracy; and for that the bone puts on the membrane; and it happens to the difficulty of handling, and coughing, and vomiting of blood; and this is of great difficulty of treatment.</end_of_turn
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And indeed the Ancients have invented in that way that they can move without bending.</end_of_turn
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And from them it is said: cover that you stop feeding the patient who caused inflammation and swelling, so that the belly is uninflated and is extended, and the fracture is fixed to the parts outside.</end_of_turn
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	May we avoid this, lest it should cause unnecessary bleeding, if not otherwise; and if it has already happened, then it will help to prevent further bleeding.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	I say to you that it is necessary to suspend it from the wind and that it should suffice for a while; for in this way it is like reasoning, but I fear that the wind will drive the moisture to the wound for its weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	I say to you: cover the wound with a bandage that is already immersed in cautery oil, and leave fine powder between the ribs until it is full; let the ligature be gentle when you wrap it around the circumference; and do the same with healing the disease with feeding and medicine
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if it causes violent constriction of the disease that does not suffer from this, and if you put the instrument through the wound, remember over the disease, for when you cover the wound, uncover the broken rib, and do the same with the instrument that preserves the belly, as is usually done, and that they come out easily, and take away that one.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And do the same with the two lips of the wound, if it is large, by stitching, and care for that which is under plaster until it is healed.</start_turn>
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if there is bleeding from the wound, immediately cover it with powdered charcoal in scented oil and hold it over the wound, and let the disease be cured with what covers the bleeding.</start_turn>
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And rest on the side on which you are lying, until it is healed.</start_turn
Capitol .ix.	End of Document.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	Restoration of fracture of the vertebra of the thigh and of the heel.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some veins sometimes fracture the bones of the heel, and sometimes to them it is necessary to apply an at traction, just as it is with the vertebrae of the thigh.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when this happens to someone and you want to know if he is well or not, consider that sometimes the veins are already softened and relaxed and sometimes they are soft and limp and dead and you cannot move them neither extend them nor flex them without causing them pain, if you tighten them they say that it is not well, and in such cases of adversity it is fatal.</start_turn
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if you touch them and find them constricted with the teeth and pierced, then you know that the bone of the limb is saved and the disease will heal with care.</start_turn
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the vertebrae of the thigh like this and you want to know if it is well or not, consider the weight of the limb.</start_turn
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Sometimes when it is softened, it is necessary to do what is necessary in the greatest number of cases, and when you lie over the two thighs, you feel the breeze and the evacuation of urine is forced from you, knowing that this is fatal, and you should not work on their care.</start_turn
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	May there be no other cause of this, for the cause is better and lighter.</start_turn
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the care of them is that you perforate with a cautery needle at the sensation of the bleeding that stops over the fractured vertebra, covered with scented oil alone, or with pieces of ground glass; and hold over that any vein that gives blood until the bleeding stops.</start_turn
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And hold one of the existing and comfortable plasters, and strengthen over that which is ligament; and command the patient to rest and be calm and not to sleep on the side where he feels pain until he is healed.</start_turn
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if there is separation of the bone of the heel or any other cause that is already separated from it, then cover that part with a dressing and keep that bone; and do the same with the two lips of the wound, by stitching if it is large; and do the care of that which is under plaster until it is healed.</start_turn
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	And if the femur is fractured at the thigh end, and it is the end of the limb, then cover that part with the left hand on the buttocks and hold the fractured bone with the right hand as much as possible; and hold over it the plaster and bandage, if you do not mind, and strengthen that.</start_turn
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel the heel fractured in it, then rest over that, and keep that, and care for the wound with the care that is usually done until it is healed.</start_turn
Capitol .x.	End of Document. Restoration of fracture of the femur.</start_turn
De restauracio de la ancha.	Restoration of the limb.</start_turn
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the limb often break, and when they break, the fracture of them is nothing but a communication in the extremities of these and they are inscribed in the length and decline towards the inward parts; and it happens to the patient pain in the area and puncture, and the limb is stiff when fractured.</start_turn
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	The restoration of the limb is that you extend your hand over that which is over the fracture which is the shape of the limb.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	If the fracture is at the extremity of the limb alone, then you embrace that part which is askew according to the proportion that it is displaced until it is restored to its natural position.</end_of_turn>
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	More so if the fracture is in the long bones or that already declines to the lower parts, then you make the patient lie on his belly until he is prepared for the restoration of that fracture.</end_of_turn
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And therefore when you have restored that, suspend your hand over the bandage, and then pause over the splinter of bone or cartilage, and hold tightly over the place where you do not fear puncture of the fracture or removal of the splinter.</end_of_turn
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And embrace the concave part with that which lies over that which prevents the stricture according to equality, and command the patient to lie on his side or across his chest.</end_of_turn
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	More so if the accidental burn occurs, then you cease the extension of the limb and the restoration until the accidental burn has subsided, and pause over it until that which is before has departed; and then return to the restoration of the limb, and hold tight as before.</end_of_turn
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if it happens in the heel bones or they are fractured, then you must treat them.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xi.	End of Document.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	Treatment for the fracture of the adjutorium.</end_of_turn>
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adjutorium is that which is between the hip bone and the head of the femur.</end_of_turn>
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is fractured, the restoration of the limb is in two ways, of which one is that you grasp the bone plate of middling thickness according to this shape:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And join at two extremities two ligaments, and then suspend it from the elevated place.</end_of_turn
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And follow the patient on a cushion; and then put the fractured limb outside the bone until it reaches the tilt of the limb at the middle of which the curvature of the limb is attached.</end_of_turn
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And if there is any other serious cause, or if the limb extends to the lower parts; and the physician should hold the fracture firmly in the greater trochanters, until the fracture returns as it should.</end_of_turn
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the patient should be placed lying down on his shoulder and suspend the hand of the hip over the ligament; and command two assistants that one of them hold what is above the fracture with his hands; and the other hold his legs; and whichever of them extends to his part.</end_of_turn
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then you must tighten over the fracture with the ligament and over that with the other ligament, and whichever of the two assistants extends both of his parts.</end_of_turn
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	Therefore if the fracture is close to the extremity of the muscle, then you must cover that half of the ligament over the trochanter and the other half the fracture must be over the hip bone.</end_of_turn
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	Similarly if the fracture is near the hip bone, then you must cover that ligament over that place and that hip bone.</end_of_turn
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Embrace that which is facilitated and convenient, and when it is restored as it should be according to what covers and is applied well, then hold that which is not accidental burn.</end_of_turn
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	More so if an accidental burn occurs, then leave the stricture for seven days, and pause over it a soft bandage soaked in vinegar and oil until the burn has healed, and then hold that once more.</end_of_turn
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the way to hold that is that you suspend the bandage over the fracture, and then pause the covering of the gauze over the bandage; and then adjust the limb over that adjutorium, and put your hand open over the muscle.</end_of_turn
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And pause the sponge and tighten over the adjutorium the limb so that the limb is in place of splints, if it does not prevent any cause of the fractured bone.</end_of_turn
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And use splints.</end_of_turn
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And that the bandage over the fracture is that which is more flexible and more strong than the others; and pause between any two splints the width of a finger, and the length of the splints according to the fracture plus three fingers from the total extent.</end>
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And hold over the splints at the stricture which I mentioned at the beginning of this chapter.</end_of_turn
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	The stricture over the fractured area must be made even tighter.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	The more prolonged the fracture, the smaller the stricture should be
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	Therefore, if sometimes the situation of the bones and the stricture are as we have said at the time when you restore the limb to its usual position, then do so slowly
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	If you fear post-traumatic swelling, then leave the stricture and the bones inside for seven days as we have said before
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	Then consider the ligament in all parts for three days so that it does not become inflamed in the fractured area; or abstinence from food is prohibited to prevent the limb from suffering from excessive tension due to the stricture; therefore rectify everything as we have said before.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	Even if you are confident that no other cause of this exists, do not remove the ligament until three days have passed at the very least
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	Let the patient sleep on their side with their knees bent, and their hands resting on their stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And suspend all nourishment with full lanolin ointment, and consider throughout the night or day that the fractured limb is not deformed or softened, or that the ligament is not damaged; therefore rectify everything with your skill.</start_turn>
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	Abstain from food for the patient according to the order we have given earlier, even if food is initially lukewarm; and make sure that the food is cold when served.</start_turn
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	Concerning the application of the dressing and the change of the bandage, keep them in place for forty days; and make sure that they are loosened and that baths are administered, and that the medications that correct this are administered along with them.</start_turn
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	If the fracture is old, do not remove the ligament and the bones until at least one month or two months have passed.</start_turn><end_turn>
Capitol .xii.	(End of document)</start_of_turn>
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Restoration of Fractures of the Arm.</start_of_turn>
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm consists of two bones called the ulna and the radius; of which the former is small, and is called the olecranon, and the latter is large and is supported from beyond the little finger.</start_of_turn
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And it is strong if only the larger bone is fractured, or if only the smaller bone is fractured, and it is very strong if both bones are fractured together.</start_of_turn
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the smaller bone is fractured, the restoration of it is light, and its healing is easier.</start_of_turn
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the larger bone is fractured beyond the little finger, the fracture is bad, and the healing is difficult.</start_of_turn
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And the worst of all is when both bones are fractured together.</start_of_turn
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the fractured bone is the smaller one, it is convenient for the doctor to postpone the restoration of it, which facilitates healing until it is healed.</start_of_turn
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	If the larger bone is fractured, however, it is necessary to prevent excessive extension.</start_of_turn
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both bones are fractured together, you must absolutely prevent strong movement.</start_of_turn
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	You must also keep the limb still, restoring the limb and extending it on a cushion, with the palm of the hand below the other fingers, and the thumb below the others, and the forearm must be lower than the hand, and the patient must be placed over a cushion.</start_of_turn
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And provide a cushion under the limb or around it, so that the patient does not move.</start_of_turn
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And have one minister extend the arm from the side beyond the elbow with the palm of the hand facing inwards or towards the ligament, and another minister extend the forearm similarly.</start_of_turn
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And the doctor should immobilize the bone until it has healed according to the best possible figure.</start_of_turn
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	If there is swelling of the bone, reduce all the pain in the area with your skill.</start_of_turn
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	If there appears a separated wound that does not seem to be healing, leave it open and do not attempt to restore it until you are confident that it will heal according to our instructions.</start_of_turn
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	If the fracture is painless, and I have already dealt with the singular case, take care of it.</start_of_turn
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	If an accident occurs during the beginning of your restoration, then line your wound with a circle of butter fat and white wax, and put more between spiciness and blandness, and stretch the butter fat over that which is strict and subtle until the accident is released; and afterwards leave the circle and stop the plaster prepared from powder of mallow with flour, and then stop the chills; and let the plaster be as solid as possible over that fracture that is more flexible and strong.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	Indeed, the name of the arm bones is seen in the greater arrangements, or rather the fracture in a socket or in two sockets together.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	Then stop your stricture over the area of the fracture that is more flexible and strong, and when more is required remove the restriction from the parts above the fracture or from the parts below it, stop the restriction a little more soft as is preceded by the memory of them at the beginning of the chapter
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the cloths that are wrapped around the fracture should be moist cloths, neither too firm nor too rough, the thread which is used to tighten should be neither too fine nor too thick, as we have recommended
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	Consider the limb and the ligament nearby for several days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if any cause arises that requires rectification, as for example that which arises in the limb, then cover that limb with cold water until that cause ceases to exist.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And keep the limb still until the restoration is complete, and then remove the stricture
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the restriction is already softened and the bone is already recovered and seems like those, then restore everything with your skill
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider also if nutrition is prohibited from reaching the limb due to excessive restriction, because cover that little one and leave that for several days until it runs out, and then strengthen that one
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	If no other cause of those mentioned above occurs in the patient, then do not leave the dressing loose for about xx days or more of those
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And let the patient suspend their hand for the movement of their limb, and make them sleep on their side two
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	And know that this fracture is restored in xxx days or in xxxii days, or that the limb is restored in xxviii days, and all this according to the nature of the complications and the abilities of the skill
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the thumb and the fingers
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	Know that in the thumb of the hand and in the knuckles of the fingers there must be a fracture, and it does not occur except with a wound covered with soft tissues
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	And when the hand is fractured or injured, then the patient must continue to move and rotate their limb without causing further damage, and place their hand over that which is extended
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	And the minister should extend the broken bones and the doctor should unite them until they are congruent with good congruence
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	Then stop the plaster and the bandage, if there is no further risk of caut; and remove the plaster according to the extent of the wound, and you have already wrapped that in butter fat
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	If the fracture is in the palm you must leave the belly of the palm uncovered, and make the patient keep their hand stretched out, and command the patient to strengthen that which is their fractured thumb; strengthen it with butter fat long
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And let the limb be suspended in a soft butter fat, so that the limb is applied to the palm; strengthen that as well as you can
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	If the fracture is on the outside, then stop the plaster and another plaster on the inside of the palm, so that the hand is open and flexible; and stop the restriction, as the hand is rotated between the fingers with ligaments
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if there is a fracture in one of the knuckles of the fingers, if that is what is said, then unite it according to what is necessary and strengthen it with the palm of the hand, and if you wish, place a bandage on the little finger to elevate the fracture and prevent it from being crushed
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	And if the fracture is in the other fingers, such as in the middle, ring, index or thumb, unite them as a whole and bind them with the finger to which it is most appropriate; or bind them all together as a whole, which is better; or leave a small plaster on that little finger, as we have said before
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	Consider in your restoration, and indeed that, the disposition of the caut burn — in the surgical operation — against what is covered when any cause of those mentioned above occurs, as it is repeated in the narration.
Capitol .xiv.	Capitol XIV.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	Chapter XIV.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	When the bone of the thigh is fractured, it is commonly observed to convert to the outer side and towards the greater trochanter.</end_turn>
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	The restoration is carried out by tightening the ligament over the fracture and leaving the fractured area, while the patient lies on their stomach and on their face.</end_turn
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	And the minister extends all the ligament according to its quality, when the fracture is in the middle of the bone.</end_turn
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	If it is near the thigh, then let the proper ligament be applied to the outer side at the fifth space, so that the extension is made there, and the other ligament leaves the fracture.</end_turn
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	Similarly, if the fracture is close to the bone, then let the proper ligament be applied to the inner side, and the extension be made towards the outer side.</end_turn
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	Then the doctor should gently seize the bone on both sides until it is reduced according to its natural inclination; and the bone is joined by good connection. The hand should be placed over the area to prevent further displacement.</end_turn
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	If displacement occurs, leave it for a few days until the swelling subsides, and then return to your care.</end_turn>
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The bandage should be tightly applied: cover the fracture with a hard bandage, and bend the knee two or three times, and remove any excess; and finally cover the limb up to the hip and the thigh.</end_turn
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	Long thread is passed inside between the thigh and the limb near the bone, and the extremities of the thread are fixed at the lower part of the two parts, and the thread is rotated over the limb and the thigh where there is excess bandage.</end_turn
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	Finally, rest on the thigh in the place of that fracture and put a stool on the limb bones.</end_turn
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And fill the space between the limb and the thigh with warm cloths, so that the swelling is stopped.</end_turn
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And gradually tighten the bandage from the middle over the place of the fracture with three wraps or four, and when you have almost reached the ligament of the place of the fracture, your bandage should be less tight and lighter and more soft.</end_turn></end_turn>
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	And extend the two extremities of the thread to the lower part of the foot until it reaches the heel, and tighten both ends of the staples from the other side so that the ligament is not strained from the knee joint.</end_turn></end_turn
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	And keep the bandage on for a while, until no displacement of the limb occurs, no further swelling or pain; and if any of these things happen, stop the treatment and rectify everything as has been said above, according to what we have mentioned above.</end_turn></end_turn
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is very painful, leave it alone as much as possible; otherwise, remove it and treat the wound as before, until healing takes place.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn>
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	And so many other remedies are applied to this fracture of the thigh as are adjusted to the staples, as we have said in the treatises and in the arms.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn>
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	However, in the restoration of it in this way does not cause the patient to suffer; and if it is only restored, or if another bandage is applied to the other limb, it is necessary to keep the limb which is being treated immobile.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	And remember that the thigh is strengthened in forty days or a few months or a few weeks.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn>
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	Restoration of the fracture of the thigh bone.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	Remember that the fracture of the thigh bone is often accompanied by swelling, but it does not always happen.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	If it does happen, the fracture is not more than a fissure or break in the bone, and this is accompanied by swelling or pain, and about this the patient feels nothing.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	And the restoration is made in such a way that it is glued together again where it was fractured, and it is joined as well as possible for equality, facility and manufacture.</end_turn></end_turn><end_turn
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	And so, stop the bleeding and place your hand on that round stone, if you wish; and stretch out your hand from under your stricture to where it is convenient.
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	Consider all the precautions which have been recommended in other fractures, thus as with cautery and similar to those which are opposed to any accident which may arise until such time as the patient is healed.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.</end_of_turn>
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the thigh.</end_of_turn
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	Know that in the thigh there are two bones, of which one is thick and is called the femur; and the other is slender and is called the fibula.</end_of_turn
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	And concerning the accidents which occur in each of these fractures which also occur in the bones of the arm, and for which restoration is necessary just as for the arm, and the operation for them is one.</end_of_turn
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	And if two bones are fractured together, the thigh is converted into many parts.</end_of_turn
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if the slender bone is fractured, the thigh is converted into fragments Denant.</end_of_turn
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if the thick bone is fractured, the thigh remains as before, and this is among the causes which you should not be ignorant of.</end_of_turn
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	And so, administer extension, equalization and suspension of the bands according to the healing.</end_of_turn
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	But indeed, if the fracture of the thigh is slight without great displacement, let the extension be milder and lighter, and relieve your power.</end_of_turn
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	And in the thigh there is some cause for an operation on the arm, and that is when you have healed the cracks and when you have completed all the works of the operation, then you will take hold of the flesh of the heel which is held back by the causes which were held back alone, and it will be sufficient to remove the white of the palm; mix these with the ones which are little in greatness, and do not be greedy, and let the length of these be according to the length of the thigh, and of the distance from the knee to the heel.</end_of_turn
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	And so, cover over any wound in two coverings according to their length, and place one over the part of the thigh from one side and the other from the other side, and let them be from the knee to the heel.</end_of_turn
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio. E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And more, cover more than when you fractured, and when it is properly placed.</end_of_turn
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And so, consider every day the thigh and study it carefully, and you will keep it from apostemata and from inflammation or from other causes resembling these; and when any cause of these occurs, then you will remove it from it until it is healed.</end_of_turn

De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the heel and the bones of the foot and the toes.</end_of_turn
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The heel does not usually fracture; however, in the bones of the foot some fractures occur; and in the toes fractures are rarely seen, and do not occur in them except in cases of great disposition.</end_of_turn
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if in the bones of the foot there is a fracture and sometimes those bones must be elevated between them, then you must place the foot on the prepared earth just as when going.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And so, place one foot on what is elevated from those bones, and hold it, and press, and heal those until they are whole in the places.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And so, stop the bleeding and hold out your hand, and place under the belly of the foot a little cushion on which are two balls of paste.</end_of_turn
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And so, stretch out your hand from under the foot, because you have covered it with cloths and other causes of which you approve.</end_of_turn
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed, then you will remove the ligament, because you will find the bones healed, or fractured or dislocated, and the operation in these is just as harmful as the disease.</end_of_turn

De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	From the care of node which occurs in the remnants of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Moist wounds cause this node to appear in the remnants of healing fractures, and more especially when it is near the joints, and is often accompanied by swelling of the limb; and it frequently hinders the natural movement of the limb.</end_of_turn>
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider if the node is recent and administer in this way medicines that have stypticized thus far, and observe, and see, and touch, and smell; and if any of these things are perceived, take some of them, or all of them, and mix them with vinegar or alum or urine, and apply that over the node in a paste, and bind those around it for good constriction.</end_of_turn>

And read the extraction that you must not remove that for moist days; and remove that and repeat this until the node is softened; or strengthen over that layer of lead descent, which has the property of softening all that is swollen in the limbs.</end_of_turn

Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.</end_of_turn>
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Of the restoration of a fracture when it is restored and then keep the limb limp and still not according to its natural habit.</end_of_turn
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture has been restored, and then keep the limb limp and still, then it is not useful for anything except for these causes: one is the multitude of solutions of the ligament and the laxity of the ligament which has become faulty; or for the excess of stricture of the ligaments so that the nutrient cannot flow to the limb; or for the multitude of superfluous emboli; or for excessive movement that is not in its time; or for weakness in the body of the patient and for lack of care.</end_of_turn
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu. And keep the limb still for a while, so that the limb does not impede the circulation of the nutrient, or continue to embolize it with water that boils over, until the nutrient returns to its natural figure.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.</end_of_turn
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the care of fractured bones when they have been restored violently and prevent their operation from being carried out except for that which covers them.</end>
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When an injury occurs to a limb which has already been restored, keep the healing of it at a gentle pace and in a prominent manner to the fractured bone and the node, and for this reason fear not to perform the natural operation of the limb, however, do not compel it so that you cause the limb to suffer.</end_of_turn

More already have many doctors and restorers who have done this who have made this known to us in our time; and this operation is not to be despised for fear of death.

More if the swelling and node are recent, then keep them covered with lukewarm water in which are many soft herbs, such as chamomile and rue, and meadowsweet, and it is useful to apply to them a paste of alum or oil of laurel, or take figs of rue and bind them with wool or linen thread.</end_of_turn
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas. De sermo en dislocacio.	About dislocation.</end_of_turn>
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the sudden displacement of any joint of the limb, because it is prohibited from movement, and it is accompanied by the deformation of the limb, and causes great pain and damage to the patient.</end_of_turn
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore when an injury occurs in some dislocation, it is necessary to perforate immediately so that it can be reduced, and do not delay in reducing it, for if it is delayed, the limb is swollen and strong, and it is difficult to reduce the dislocation.</end_of_turn
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And so, do not move or stretch during the time of the apostemacy, because vomiting brings spasms and pain to the bowels.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	When this happens, cover the patient's face with a towel, and immediately stop vomiting; then bring cold water and oil to the member, and gently reduce it.</end_of_turn>
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all parts should be treated with the water from which the memory will remain in their place.</end_of_turn>
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And thus I have ordered the heads of dislocation according to what precedes fracture; from the upper part of the body inwards to the lower part outwards.</end_of_turn

De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Be aware that the muscle is not dislocated in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated from the part of the tibia to the part below
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis. E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat. Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from the toes or from under the muscle, and you see it with your eyes, do not be deceived.
