E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And thus it should be loosened; and therefore if the joint is formed in the knee area, then you should loosen the ligament of it and leave it thus
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if the joint is not to be stretched, then you repeat the packing and the ligament, and leave it thus for several days until it is drawn out; and then loosen that one
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	More if by chance the joint is drawn towards the reduction, and the position is in movement, then administer moisture in bath and friction mild, and understand, until it is relieved; or rest over the joint without movement, since there is fatness; and bind it, and leave it thus for the day and the night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And thus leave it thus, and put that in the bath; and when it is finished, then you will gently massage the joint with temperate friction, and then repeat over that which was alleviated, so that it is comfortable, once, twice, and three times
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already spread throughout the bones within the bath, until it is lined
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, rest over that wound of moist cow and scald it at the border and stretch over that; and do a few times, so that that which is moist will be reduced to its position.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of the care of dislocation of a limb, that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The dislocation of the hand frequently happens, and its reduction is easy, unlike that of the other joints, however it must be noted that the limb must not be too much displaced or that the dislocation happened with violent force.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of the dislocation of the limb is to place the wrist of the patient over a table and extend the limb of that, and put your hand or palm over the area of the joint, and press that until it returns to its place
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However it must be considered if the palm is already bowed towards the belly of the hand, then the patient must put two of his hands over a table at the time of extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is previous you must put two of the hand, then the position of the hand of the patient intrinsically over the table, so that the hand of the doctor covers that area of the joint
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And thus if it returns quickly, well it is good; and if not, then you must stretch that over the paste giving up the apostema and leaving that; and do not repeat that, for if you do, you will suffer or will not be able to do the reduction any more than for several days
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However the joint remains according to its stiffness; and do not note to the patient any cause, but that the hand is softened and cannot stretch any cause; for it is understood that the nerves are cut or crushed, and that it is not due to the limb itself but is stretched with a pointed cautery because of the position of the limb and the force which is conferred by the cause
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore when the limb is returned, then you rest over it the paste which we have recommended, and keep it stretched for five days; and then loosen it and keep it relaxed and exercise the hand
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	However if the movement of the limb is delayed and an accident happens in it any gravity, then you will gently massage that with cold water and do a few times with friction until it is relieved
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the care of the dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some times the fingers are dislocated throughout their entirety
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any finger of those at the two of the palm or at the belly has been dislocated, then you must stretch the finger and impel the dislocation back to its place with your thumbs until it returns
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And hold the tip of the finger, and suspend that beyond the part which has been dislocated, and leave that for two days
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And thus suspend that and extend that until it is equal in that limb on that day
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And if at night it does not happen, keep it bound according to that narration, and do not stop loosening that in the day and exercising with movement, and keep that in the night; and do that for several days until it is healed.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And keep it stable in that way, if it is dislocated at the belly of the hand, and keep that part there and do the first operation there until it is healed
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And it is similar to what happens when it is displaced to the other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	When pain in the joints is caused by cold humors that infiltrate every part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	And it is similar to what happens when it is displaced to the other parts.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	When the dislocation of the bones of the thighs occurs, and the pain is very great, it is not enough to do anything but let the patient rest.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	And so it is enough to say that the old doctors spoke of these things in a long and detailed way, from which we learn little; we shall therefore omit that which is useless and explain only what is necessary.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in gout which occurs in the foot from the thigh bone downwards, there is neither healing nor soundness; and in the same way as when it is caused by two fractures.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And it is cured only when it occurs in the thighs themselves with the cold which I recommend.<end_turn>
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And let the patient's face be covered with a cushion and let the limb be supported so that it does not press on the foot.<end_turn>
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And place another cushion under the knee and another under the toes of the foot.<end_turn
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	The servant has the foot, and does not hold it in a fossa; and another servant has the other foot in the same way as the first.<end_turn>
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And so cover the head of the patient and hold the toes firmly together; and extend the limb from the knee to the foot and bind it there; and do the same with the other limb from the hip to the foot.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And so the servants extend the limb from the thigh to the foot, and do not hold the two thighs and the limbs of the buttocks in their places as has been said above.<end_turn>
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor rests his palms on the bone with strength until it returns, or rests on a board, and let the patient adjust their feet on the board until it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	And if it does not return in this way, take a board whose breadth or length is equal to three palms, and support it on the wall where we said that the patient should put their foot in which the limb of the board rests.<end_turn
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And so hold the heel of the board on the bone, the doctor rests the feet on the other limb, and gently stretch until the thigh is fixed and returns to its place.<end_turn
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	Or if you wish, keep the patient’s thigh bone from rotating with your hand; and keep your foot on the ground under the heel of the thigh bone, which should reach from the hip bone to below the knee; and keep your hand from the hip bone to below the knee; and let the length from one thigh bone to the other be as much as from the thumb to the wrist of the hand, and that is enough in every thigh that is broken in this place, and that no part of the limb should be fixed to the ground so that it is not crushed.<end_turn
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a rounded cushion in the place of the turn, and let it be rotated in the two thighs.<end_turn
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And in the limb there is a break in the place where the cushion is placed, the length of which is equal to a palm from the side of the rotation; and in the other two thighs it is similar to that.<end_turn>
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And so strengthen the ligaments which you have stretched in the foot of the patient in the break where the thigh bone is placed, and the ligaments which you have stretched in the thighs in the rotation where the feet are placed.<end_turn><end_turn>
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And now you must assign a servant who will support the patient's turn with their hand, and the doctor should palpate the spine as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the manner of the turn: ...
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And when the spine is returned and the limb is palpably healed, then you must place three fingers of your hand over the area where the pain is, and stop; and place your hand over the area of the hernia so that it does not protrude again.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And just as we have said, use the patient's nourishment sparingly until they are healed
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any swelling remains in the limb at the end of the healing process, then you must administer medicines that soften and soothe the limb during the course of treatment; these medicines have been recommended; and they are administered in that area like ointment of lead
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And many physicians have observed swelling in the back of the spine of two, and it is cured by that dislocation; and that is the bone which has already been mentioned because it must not be affected by this medicine, for it will cause death to you
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXV
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the treatment of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You must know that the ankle joint and the muscle joint do not suffer anything other than dislocation alone, and not from any other affections that affect the other joints of the little toe with swelling and concave depression
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the ankle joint is dislocated in four ways, which is either upwards, downwards, forwards or backwards
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	Mostly it is dislocated upwards, and slightly forwards or backwards
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And a sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that, when you adjust the limb of the patient who is healed with the limb of the patient who is suffering, the limb of the patient who is suffering appears longer and the heel appears more prominent than the limb that is healed; the limb cannot bend its knee without causing pain, and the limb is bowed outwards as far as the heel has been moved forward by the cautery
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that it is in the opposite direction of this one
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that the limb expands slightly, but it does not bend where it is painful; if it is forced to bend, it cannot do so without causing pain; the urine is retained and the swelling is excessive, and you must walk the patient on the talus bone
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of the dislocation of the ankle is that the heel does not expand, nor can it bend downwards where it is painful; the limb is shorter than the other, the swelling is softened, and the heel has been moved forward from that place
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	More reduction of these species of dislocation is that you consider, when, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already passed its best; in this case you must not do anything for it, for it is not necessary for treatment in this case; and indeed you must not attempt to do anything for it, for it will cause death to you
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	More in the case where the dislocation is recent, and is one of the four kinds of dislocation, then you must support the joint and extend it upwards and downwards, and to the right and left, for it is strong and does not require any other treatment
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	More so, if it does not return in this manner, then you must prepare a strong minister and extend the limb of the patient from the lower part, or from the middle or from the ligament which is bound over the limb below the ankle; and another minister should grasp the limb of the patient and support their toes; and strengthen the ligament with another minister over the back of the ankle and hold another minister over the foot.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And the extension of the limb from the heel to the ankle or from the heel to the ankle bone, or from the back to the tibia or from the back to the fibula.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And the extension of all these until the patient’s limb is elevated to the height of the knee and remains hanging down
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this kind of extension is common to all four kinds of dislocation
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	Therefore, if the dislocation returns as we have said, it is well; and if not, then treatment is necessary in all four cases.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of the limb itself, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is at the joints below, cover that the patient should rest upon the sitting bones; and immediately suspend the ligaments over the edge of the space in that place where between the head of the space and the place which is left to hang down; and extend the ligament from the part of the angulus to the highest part of the fork.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And immediately another minister should strengthen the patient's ankles, and measure the great space of the painful space and extend to the other side for violent extension, so that that which returned to the sitting place
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this kind of pus is lighter treatment than the one with which this limb is reduced than other kinds.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	More if it is excused to you and you do not obey the order with this kind of treatment, however cover that the two feet of the patient be bound together with strong ligament, eagerly, over both ankles and both toes
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each by the quantity of four fingers, and let the painful limb be extended more than the other by the quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And immediately the patient should be suspended upon the head of the thigh, and that it be in the greater; and let the length of them from the earth be the quantity of two ankles.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And immediately command a a strong young man to shorten the head of the space, and that it be suspended with the patient another young man, and the other young man will shorten the limb with force pushing, so that the joint returns to the sitting place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	However in the proper reduction, when the dislocation is at the outer part, cover that the patient follows his heel as we have recommended in the haven gelbozitat; and let the ligament be stretched over the painful limb itself and over the toes of it
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And immediately two cushions are placed, one at the foot of the limb, and the other at the head; and cushions are placed adjusted to the middle of the limb which is left hanging over which damp cloth is wrapped, so that the patient is not moistened because the limb is between the patient's thighs, because you must extend to the other side not to be taut.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And immediately every minister extends their part, and the doctor with his hand grasps the reduction according to the art
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey respectfully, it will be well and greatly; but if not, suspend over that diligently and as we have said in the gelbozitat for that engagement
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	However cover that the patient follows his sitting bones so that it is almost flat.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is at the ankle bones, it is necessary that the limb be extended eagerly, as it is according to this medical narration about the limb; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand over the painful ankle, and immediately grasp that with the other hand, and with that grasp pause that which was extended to the other side at the ankle bone
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is at the back parts, it is not necessary that the patient be extended to the toes, but it is elevated from the earth; because it is necessary that it be placed upon a hard cause, as if the ankle joint is dislocated to the outer parts, as we have said of the walking of the limb about two spans; and it is on its face and the ligaments are extended, as we have said, there is no spasm.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it is necessary that cold compression be administered on the area where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore when the reduction is completed as we have said — and the signal of the limb's reduction is not hidden from you, that you extend two cushions from the patient, and when you have once placed those cushions and the patient extends his limb the sitting limb and expands that excuse, then you know that the limb as we have said is returned — and immediately you adjust two cushions and place them close together and extend with a bandage so that the ankle is not swollen in any of the parts; and keep the patient at rest for three days or for four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And immediately unbind the ligament and the bandage, and compare one limb with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	However, if you see those cushions in the bandage, you know that the dislocation is already stopped, and then you may allow the patient to leave.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of discomfort, you know that you must return and place that one again, and extend that one according to your first structure, and leave that one for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And immediately remove that one, and make that one walk slowly for some days, until it is comforted

De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	From the care of dislocation of the toe.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The toe is dislocated in three ways, that is, towards the outer side, towards the inner side, and towards the greater side of the foot; but it is not dislocated towards the front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation is that the patient applies pressure to the area with his hand; when he does so, the toe is confirmed to be dislocated
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all these positions is that the physician must do nothing but remove the patient's hand which he has placed over the area; then extend his hand again; adhere two fingers to the side of the foot; put the foot between the thighs; and finally secure the toe to the palm of the hand, and hold those between the thighs over the toe until it returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of recovery is that his hand adheres to the area without discomfort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster that area and bind the limb to the area; and leave them bound for three days or four, and then remove them
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not allow the patient to walk for a few days, until he is well and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	Moreover, if the dislocation was excusable, then administer strong extension to the ligaments which were previously treated in the care of the hip is narrated above
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.</start_of_turn>
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the care of dislocation of the ankle
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle is sometimes sprained by slight displacement, and sometimes it is dislocated according to custom, and the dislocation is caused either by excessive inward pressure or excessive outward pressure
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation is that sometimes the ankle swells from the part which is dislocated
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the treatment of its displacement is of little relief, and that it should be easily extended with the greatest comfort and must be equal when it returns
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the treatment of dislocation according to custom, cover that he does nothing but remove the hand which he has placed over the area, and take hold of that which is behind the two of those in the middle of the foot
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And put your right hand on the great toe and your left hand on the lesser toe of the foot in the place of the ankle
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And pull the foot towards you with your right hand, and with your left hand for two spans, and then extend with your left; and press the bones of the foot against the right side of the limb.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this for two spans as we have counted
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And press the bones of the foot to the limb for the third span, and you are at the ankle
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, if it returns in one span or two according to this manner, and if sometimes the foot is equaled, it is good; otherwise, repeat the operation until it returns
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	Moreover, if the reduction is prohibited to you in this case, then make the patient walk on the toes over the ground, and stretch a little on the ground, and keep him between the thighs, and you have already cauterized over him so that he does not burn himself
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And let the attendants of the patient hold his thighs, and another extend the foot with his greatest power or with the ligaments that lie over the ankle; and extend whichever minister you wish against the extension of the limb, and the heel of the foot retains that which was cauterized so that the body of the limb is not pulled towards the lower parts because of its extension
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the physician should embrace the dislocation with his thighs, and another attendant should hold the sound limb at the lower parts, so that the dislocation returns with ease
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And thus when the dislocation has returned and its reduction has been declared, then remove the plaster and extend that which was tightly bound, and rejoin the limb to the limb with the bandage.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	Beware or take care of the nerves which are behind the ankle, so that the ligament over that is not too tight and does not burn excessively
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And let that be for two days or three; and if the ligament is softened, remove it
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And remove it on the third day or the fourth, and prohibit the patient from walking for forty days
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	May it be certain that if one must go forward despite that space, it is not in vain that the dislocation is not over and corrupted, and indeed that it does not receive care.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if the heel should burn with the cautery, then know that you must administer it in the cessation of the pain which precedes our narrative in other places, for remedy and embrocation, until it is remauged.</end_of_turn>

De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocations of the toes.</end_of_turn>
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Know that which is dislocated must be held with little extension so that it does not become difficult; for this is a doubtful matter.</end_of_turn
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	And if the dislocation is in the hollow of the two bones of the foot, then know that you must cause the patient to sit on the ground or on a table, and be as if going forward.</end_of_turn
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then place your foot on the ground, and place your hand over the joint which you have just mentioned, and hold the foot so that it returns without appearing in the eminence.</end_of_turn

De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the species of dislocations that are caused by swelling or fracture or any other concomitant.</end_of_turn
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of these causes occur, and you take care of the treatment and restoration of it, the patient often dies.</end_of_turn
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for this reason you must not presume that you can cure it alone, but rather that you must be learned in art, with long experience, merciful and humble, timely, not arrogant or presumptuous; and that you should use in the beginning of medicines that cause no further pain, only those that actually alleviate the pain, and that you should leave the patient to the divine judgment, not to your own judgment, for in whom hope of salvation appears, relief from the disease, and in whom you hope for salvation.</end_of_turn
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And thus you must work so hard to reduce it at the beginning of the cause, that you must indeed cause a cautery.</end_of_turn
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And thus if the limb returns as we wish, then know that you must administer a regimen that causes a cautery and cures the swelling in which it is customary to mix desiccant herbs.</end_of_turn
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is in a fractured bone and the two fragments are separated, then you must perforate the membrane of them, and do as we have said in the simple diseases of the same kind that is said above.</end_of_turn
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	Be mindful and prudent according to your virtue of that which I have said about the way of fear, as I have foretold above; for what is better for you than the Creator Himself, and more permanent to His glory, and more joyful for you in the things of this world.</end_of_turn
